story:
Support a Product which has been Proven to Save Lives

 

“It started with a drawing on a napkin.” We’ve all heard that phrase a time or two in our lives.  Our product has that same humble beginning.  Almost 4 years ago, we made sketches on a napkin in a restaurant as we began to conceptualize a product which had all the necessary tools built-in to safely carry out an investigation, document evidence, apprehend fleeing suspects, locate missing persons, provide light in the darkness, detect dangerous heat sources…and save lives.

 

We are an American company which has bootstrapped its way through all the developmental challenges to bring a unique High-Tech Tool into existence.  We are comprised of a small group of individuals with vision, determination, expertise and long-term commitment.  In a short period of time, the napkin sketches evolved into a number of hand-built prototypes for public safety experts to utilize and to provide us with their real-world feedback.  Now we have taken the valuable data and sculpted a final, production-ready, world-class product with all the suggested changes and improvements included.  We have designed and machined our own Injection Tooling for the fabrication of the Impact –Resistant enclosures.  We have secured the supplier agreements for all the major components necessary to assemble this amazing tool in production quantities.  We have been granted the trademarks and have patents pending which will protect our efforts in bringing this distinctive product to market.  We are poised to grow.  We are poised to create jobs.  Our product has been PROVEN to save lives. 

 

Now…we need your help.  We are in need of funds to purchase raw materials and components to build the first large production quantities of our product.  We also plan to hire, train and support the growth of additional production personnel and a full-time International Sales Team.  If you have any experience in sales, you know that it takes a considerable amount of time and consistent effort for the sales cycle to bear fruit.  An enormous amount of groundwork must be laid in order for the actual Purchase Orders to begin to arrive.  During the ramp-up, the production staff and the sales team still must be funded for their efforts and expenses. 

 

We have turned to crowd-funding because we believe America is still the land of opportunity.  We believe people from all over the world still have an inherent belief in entrepreneurship, vision, hard work and determination.  Please help our company grow.  Please help us to provide jobs to those who desperately need them.  Please help us to bring to market a product which has been proven to save lives.

 

Tell your friends, family and co-workers.  Feel free to direct anyone and everyone to view our video and learn about our product and our efforts.  Any contribution will be greatly appreciated.

story:
Software Built for Trainers™

Train More Clients with Better Outcomes

Push Active is the first customer relationship and workout management software that helps personal trainers serve more clients with better outcomes. Our software simplifies client-management, automates and optimizes workout plan creation, and enhances client and trainer engagement.  Push Active is mobile ready.  If you want to see Push Active in action watch our video below.

We are evolving the way trainers network with prospective clients. By seamlessly connecting clients to select trainers through our app, we make them more accessible, opening up more possibilities for clients and more business for trainers.

How it Works

By participating in our crowdfunding campaign, you'll help us complete the first software product built just for trainers - something that will become a key tool to run and manage your business for years to come.  We'll be able to start the design process as soon as we've raised at least $10k, and you'll get access to a Push Active account immediately. But, we won't start the clock on your one-year subscription until June 1, 2014.

We're asking trainers and studio owners around the world to join us in crowdfunding $35k towards enhanced design and usability of our app that will facilitate even faster workout creation, client management and lead generation.  In exchange, you'll get significantly discounted one-year subscription with special perks, starting immediately.  

Contact Us to Set Up a Live Demo

We have received phenomenal support, engagement, and feedback from our initial 100 trainers and coaches, which include a number of fitness studios, like Wilmington Performance Lab.  One of our early customers also includes the Carolina Clinic, the executive health branch of the University of North Carolina Healthcare System.  These partners have been actively training over 250 clients using Push Active's software in addition to the hundreds of other clients being served by individual trainers.

A New Business Model

Push Active is changing the way trainers and studio owners manage their clients and we are excited to take the software to the next level.  We are initially focused on independent trainers and studios that are interested in improving outcomes and scaling their business.  

Our software combined with our proprietary virtual training process offers a new model that allows trainers to work with clients in-house as well as remotely. This allows trainers to engage with clients on a level not yet seen in the personal training industry.  Check out the infograph  for how the Carolina Clinic Scaled their Business (infograph) to serve over 50 members per trainer.

CASE STUDY: HOW THE CAROLINA CLINIC SCLAED ITS COACHING SERVICE


Introducing Our Team

Co-Founder & Chief Executive Officer: Andrew Hooge, CSCS/USAW Level 1  

Connect with Andrew on Linkedin

Prior to launching Push Active, Andrew lead Fitsistant, a company that built the first software assisted services platform that provided a highly scalable virtual coaching staff to everyday athletes all over the world. He previously spent close to 20 years as a strength and conditioning coach for professional and amateur athletes.  Andrew is the author of "Fitskiing", and his expertise has been featured in mainstream magazines and networks including CNN.  He holds a bachelors degree in exercise science and is a certified strength and conditioning specialist.

Andrew created Push Active because he lacked the tools and resources to efficiently manage his clients and track their progress.  He wanted a way to better engage with his clients outside of the fitness facility and a more efficient process for generating client leads. Andrew was frustrated that most applications created for trainers were by individuals with little to no background in personal training, athletic training and strength and conditioning.  These applications lead to primarily consumer (client) focused apps that provided little value for trainers who wanted to improve outcomes and their earning potential.  

Co-Founder & Chief Technology Officer: Bryan Minihan

With close to 20 years of product development and management experience, Bryan was previously the CTO of Health Decisions, PrepChamps & SpeedGreetings.com and headed Global Usability for GSK.  Bryan's passion for Push Active stems from his love for solving challenging problems and making products a joy to use.  The lack of management and analysis tools that helped the best personal trainers and coaches reach their full potential along with his background in building health applications made Push Active an easy choice for his next venture.

Director of Endurance Performance: Justin Park, J.D., CSCS

A former M&A attorney turned Professional triathlete, his varied, successful career focuses on building healthier individuals and athletes with extensive experience in working with corporate executives. He combines an uncanny ability to apply his coaching skills to a business environment, that drives Push Active's endurance performance initiatives.

Our Supporters

Our investors and advisors include: 

- Gary Park: President of UNC Hospitals

- Blackstone Entrepreneurial Network.

- Andrew Pearson: Advisor Marketing and Sales

- Nichol MacDonald: Advisor Business Development and Partnerships

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $35,000 to take Push Active to the next level.  This will allow us to facilitate an enhanced design and interface to help trainers manage clients even more efficiently while increasing the amount and types of progress that can be viewed by trainers and their clients.  To date, we've invested over a year of time at no pay to build the underlying software, algorithms, and back-end tools that have produced great results for our initial users.

Our current software has all the essential features, including:

  • Ability to create Workouts and Templates Fast
  • Branding (customize your look and feel with your logo and colors)
  • Periodized Plan Creation and "Workload" Management
  • Branded Client Login and Interface (share workouts easily with clients)
  • Robust Messaging (gmail for trainers)
  • Trainer Management (for studios)
  • Progress Reporting (adherence, strength, endurance, etc...)
  • Functional Screening Interface and Exercise Filter (our software helps with exercise selection)
  • Over 750 exercises videos
  • Ability to add your own exercises and videos
  • Pre-Built Templates
  • Live Demo's and Webcasts 
  • Ability to save workouts and exercise groupings as templates for reuse
  • Ability to manage multiple trainers and analyze results
With $35k we will add:
  • Improved Trainer and Client Interfaces that allow for faster workout plan creation and improved client management
  • Enhanced Progress Reporting Interface
  • Additional Pre-Built Templates (think Couch to 5k, Tabata, etc...)
  • Native version of our App (iOS and Android) and Integration with Mind Body software, outside apps (Runkeeper, etc...) and wearable tech (Nike Fuel, etc...)

The Impact

Our current revenue stream will allow us to continue to build upon these features.  However, we want to improve the trainer/coach experience by bringing top design and usability talent into the mix.  This requires raising $35k upfront.  Essentially, we're offering heavily discounted pre-paid subscriptions so we can fund these improvements. 

Some initial results 

  • How Bill George Scaled his Business
  • How Graeme Prue Scaled his Business
  • How the Carolina Clinic Scaled their Business (infograph)
  • What Others are Saying

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Tweet about the campaign @pushactiv or @andrewhooge
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

We recognize that some people viewing this campaign are not trainers, and thus do not have use for a trainer account, but would like to support Push Active.  We encourage anyone to contribute at the $99 level or more!  If you are interested in getting in at a more substantial level, please contact us.

story:
The Rutgers Nearly Headless Knights Quidditch club is an IQA official team in the Rutgers New Brunswick community. Recently given the opportunity to attend World Cup VII, April 5/6th in Myrtle Beach, SC, this is the first year the team will attend a World Cup and the second year that the team has been around.

In Fall 2012, some current members of the team founded the club to bring competitive Quidditch and fun to Rutgers. 

Now, Rutgers has recently qualified for this year's cup, along with 80 other teams from around the world. This year's World Cup VII will be held in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, April 5/6th 2014, and we need your help getting there!

If you would donate to our campaign and distribute the link to this page, your help would be greatly appreciated. Your donations will go directly toward Rutgers getting to and affording Myrtle Beach!!

We sincerely thank you in advance for any help you provide. Your generosity will bring us one step closer to winning it all!

Some info for the curious!!!!

What is Quidditch?

Muggle Quidditch, a co-ed, full-contact sport, has grown from a game started by Middlebury College students in 2005 to an internationally recognized sport with more than 500 teams in existence. The International Quidditch Association (IQA) now holds an annual Quidditch World Cup where teams compete for the title of IQA World Cup Champion.

Find out more at http://iqaquidditch.com


Meet the Nearly Headless Knights

Jaw Yu (Coach)
Katie Gibison 
Chisa Egbelu
Phill Cain
Hersh Ranade
Lindsay Marella
Aaron Wilker 
Frank Mac (Snitch)
Olga Pryymak
Juan 'JC' Arencibia 
Jordan Biagi
Shom Ganguly
JonJulian Minervini
Lennin La Cruz
Emily Karwowski
Matt McGimpsey
Sonni Waknin
Kristin Lawton
Steve Quach
Quran Kelly-Battle
Stan Binmitende
Kashif Khan
Anthony Rewinski
Nour Srouji
Aaron Tolliver
Andy Liebau


Follow us on social media!
Facebook!!
Tumblr!
Twitter!!!

http://youtu.be/BigpjplH2Es?t=2m

Where does your money go?

We are college students, majoring in Engineering, Human Resources, Math, the Arts, Pharmacy, etc. Most (uh...all) of us do not bring home large paychecks and this trip is an expensive undertaking. Here’s what your donations will help us purchase:

- Transportation for 23 players--bus costing over $2,000 (no, we can't just drive, school policy...)

- World Cup VII registration: $400
- Hotel rooms provided by IQA in Myrtle Beach, SC: $1,794

Giving a total of over $4000!!

Spread the Word

1.  Contribute - look over the perks and contribute at a level that works for you.
2.  Pass on the campaign information so others have the opportunity to help us spread the word. 

- Please use the "Share this Campaign" tool at the top of this page.

Shoot us an e-mail at rutgersquidditch@gmail.com if you have any questions and we’ll get back to you as soon as we possibly can!

GO RU!

story:
What is Operation Blossom?

Our friend Rebecca is journeying to Thailand on Nov. 12 for her gender reassignment surgery, and as a community, we are raising funds to send a supportive companion along with her! 

Individuals as well as organizations such as the Fairness Campaign (www.fairness.org), the Women In Transition (www.witky.org) are collaborating to make this dream a reality. We've already connected Rebecca with a volunteer to accompany her, so now we need YOUR help to make sure the volunteer has travel accommodations, lodging, and food as she walks with Rebecca on her transformative journey.

We only have three weeks to raise the funds, so we need your help right away! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $2000 to make sure all expenses are covered, but more would be great. Give what you can, share the message with others, spread the love!

When you donate, you'll get a thank-you note and the satisfaction of knowing that you helped fund this important project.

Any money left over from this round of Operation Blossom may be used to help fund similar projects in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, or if you'd like to do more, you can get involved in a number of other ways:

  • share our message with your friends, family, and co-workers, and ask them to contribute
  • share a link to this fundraising page on your personal social networks like Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and more.
  • purchase a t-shirt designed by Rebecca and wear it to show your support! (Hurry, there's a limited supply of these shirts! Email Lindsay at lgargotto@gmail.com to order one.)

If you want to donate by mail, send donations to:

Fairness Campaign

Att: Rebecca Grant

2263 Frankfort Avenue

Louisville, KY 40206

story:
Our Story

Currently there is no all inclusive birth center in Los Angeles AND there is a critical shortage of midwives of color. The Community Birth Center (TCBC) is born out of a need and a vision; and with your support- we will reach our goal.  We believe that financial circumstances should not exclude anyone from caring,   supportive, safe midwifery services- and therefore have created this birth center to serve our local community and all of those who believe in our mission and services.  Further, by creating this space- we will serve as a hub for all birth practitioners and a training ground for those interested in becoming an apprentice- or simply donating their time and effort to this grassroots movement.The Community Birth Center belongs to us all.


The Impact

DIsparities in the United States, continue to show that low income and minority families have the highest rates of maternal mortality, infant mortality, preterm birth, and very low birth weight babies.  According to the NPR, Minorities and low income women are about 60 percent more likely to deliver babies early, and black infants are about 230 percent more likely to die before their first birthdays.  This statistic is horrifying and the question is why?

Experts state that lower use of prenatal care, less adequate care, and high stress associated with lower socioeconomic status, contribute to women being three to four times more likely to die in pregnancy.  The Community Birth Center, aims to address this issue head on.  We will provide quality care, to all communities regardless of race or socioeconomic background.  We want to provide quality care to EVERY WOMEN!  We ARE our community and we ARE the ones we have been waiting for.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support. By word of mouth, social networks (i.e. Facebook, Twitter, etc), we must get the word out.  Financially we cannot meet our goal, without the help of the many who share in this dream.     Let's make this happen.

Your contributions will go toward ensuring TCBC stays open and runs smoothly. We plan on taking full paying clients ($4,500 for homebirth or birth center, which includes standard prenatal bloodwork & 1 ultrasound) and at least 1 discounted family PER MONTH.  This means that with your help, we will be able to not only open this much needed birth center, but we can also offer services for FREE each month, to a family in financial need.  The money will also go to our website, rent, flooring, paint, birth tub installation, shower installation & our tankless water heater. (This is to ensure we never run out of hot water!!!)

We all have the right to make informed decisions and seek out the birth experience of our dreams-and with your support the Los Angeles area, will not only gain a much needed/wanted/dreamed of birth center- we can also offer families the opportunity that might not have it otherwise.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us make this dream come true! We are a grassroots organization in the realest sense of the term. What we have accomplished so far is because of the sheer will, determination, and generosity of a very small group of people. Please share this link with others who can help us reach our goal.  Each dollar counts!!!

Community Birth Center belongs to us all. 

The Impact
DIsparities in the United States, continue to show that low income and minority families have the highest rates of maternal mortality, infant mortality, 
preterm birth, and very low birth weight babies.  According 
to the NPR, Minorities and low income women are about 60 percent more likely to deliver babies early, and black infants are about 230 percent 
more likely to die before their first birthdays.  This statistic is horrifying and the question is why?Experts
 state that lower use of prenatal care, less adequate care, and high 
stress associated with lower socioeconomic status, contribute to women being three to four times more likely to die in pregnancy.  The Community Birth Center, aims to address 
this issue head on.  We will provide quality care, to all communities regardless of race or socioeconomic background.  We want to provide quality care to EVERY WOMEN!  We ARE our community and we ARE the ones we have been 
waiting for.

What We Need & What You Get
We
 need your support. By word of mouth, social networks (i.e. Facebook, Twitter, etc), we must get the word out.  Financially we cannot meet our goal, without the help of the many who share in this dream.     Let's make this happen.Your
 contributions will go toward ensuring TCBC stays open and runs 
smoothly. We plan on taking full paying clients ($4,500 for homebirth or
 birth center, which includes standard prenatal bloodwork & 1 
ultrasound) and at least 1 discounted family PER MONTH.  This means that
 with your help, we will be able to not only open this much needed birth
 center, but we can also offer services for FREE each month, to a family
 in financial need.  The money will also go to our website, rent, 
flooring, paint, birth tub installation, shower installation & our 
tankless water heater. (This is to ensure we never run out of hot 
water!!!)We
 all have the right to make informed decisions and seek out the birth 
experience of our dreams-and with your support the Los Angeles area, 
will not only gain a much needed/wanted/dreamed of birth center- we can 
also offer families the opportunity that might not have it otherwise.

Other Ways You Can Help
Help
 us make this dream come true! We are a grassroots organization in the 
realest sense of the term. What we have accomplished so far is because 
of the sheer will, determination, and generosity of a very small group 
of people. Please share this link with others who can help us reach our 
goal.  Each dollar counts!!!

story:
I hate filling these things out. Everyone reading this, should know everything about me already.

I need gallbladder surgery, but my insurance won't cover it. I work a part-time minimum wage job, and can't afford to pay for it out of pocket. It's not elective surgery, it's something I need to live a normal life. I am in pain every day, even though I may not show it.

Even if I don't reach my goal, I will use the funds I raise to go towards my surgery. My parents and I are also saving whatever money we can to help me get my surgery, but whatever I raise here will help tremendously.

If you can't donate, but you know someone that might want to help, you can share the link.

I appreciate all of you. Thank you for pushing me to do this. If any of you ever need anything, don't hesitate to ask.

story: On the night of September 7th, 2013 at approximately 10:20 P.M. P.A.S. driver Kyle Boisvert was hit by another driver causing the RV he was racing to roll and a catch fire after a few moments of trying to get free Kyle finally got free and immediately began to stop drop and roll. Kyle was then taken by A.M.R. to the Hospital, once he arrived it was discovered that his body was over sixty percent burned with third degree burns, he was immediately air lifted to a Burn Center where he has remained since that Saturday night. With the money we hope to raise Kyle and his Family will be able to get him the care he needs and take off any financial stress they may have. Thank you very much for your interest in supporting Kyle, no amount is to small, whatever you can donate will help greatly and is greatly appreciated. Be sure to share this with your friends and family to help us reach our goal!

story:
Short Summary
 Aquilla the beautiful vocalist and educator was recently diagnosed with Triple Negative Breast Cancer. Triple Negative Breast Cancer, which is a rare and extremely aggressive form of breast cancer. The medical field has not found a sound treatment outside of chemotherapy.
Aquilla Graves Sadalla, received her B.A. from Northern Illinois in History Education (1971).  She began her teaching career after graduation, and then stayed home to raise six children.  After coming back into the education field, she returned to higher learning and received a M.A. in Special Education from Chicago State University (2003).  She continued teaching in various Chicago Public Schools for fifteen years, then returning to college to earn a C.A.S. degree in Administration and Supervision
(2007) from National Louis University.  She began her doctoral journey, receiving an Ed.S degree as an Educational Specialist (2011) from Argosy University.  She is currently completing a doctoral degree in Educational Leadership from National Louis University (2016).  Aquilla is a mother of six musical geniuses, four of which travel worldwide performing as a brass ensemble.  She is an accomplished musician, songwriter and song stylist, plays numerous instruments. 
Aquilla is a grandmother, community servant, and visionary.  As an educator, Aquilla emphasizes the importance of building relationships; her most ardent belief is “it takes the village to raise the child.”
Aquilla has asked that we read and educate ourselves on this topic.  These two websites can be a starting place:

www.cancertreatment.net/articles/breast/triple-negative

www.nationalbreastcancer.org/triple-negative-breast-cancer

Aquilla is no longer able to work or attend school. The focus has turned to her healing.  We are uniting to raise $15,000 to support and assist her with medical and personal expenses. A mother, educator, musician, and community activist should not have to go at this alone.  Please lend your support in her fight to win this battle.  Make a monetary donation and tell others about this campaign.

 

Thank you for your support!

story: If you know Tracybaer, you already know the magnitude of her beautiful, generous soul. The last thing she deserves is the "c" word but ovarian cancer doesn't care about who deserves what. Tracy had a rushed surgery to remove the cancer and is on the road to a wholesome recovery. But the bills are coming in and it is a lot to swallow and has caused her to close the doors to her yoga studio. If you have room to give, it will help tremendously.

story:
The Career which called me:

I am a massage therapist and have been for the past two years. My aspiration in entering massage school was to work with cancer patients and their families. And now that dream is about to become a reality through Malaika Massage Therapy.  Something amazing is on the horizon and you can be a part of making it happen!

Short Story 

The short story is I have always wanted to help people - in 2008 I trained for my first half marathon with the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society's Team in Training (TNT). I was introduced to my co-worker's mom, Linda, who was diagnosed with myeloma (a form of blood cancer) - I trained and ran in honor of her (she's the woman pictured with me). We formed a friendship which still inspires. I continued involvement with Team in Training - completing my first triathlon and marathon, also becoming a TNT mentor. It was the stories of teammates which drew me - the mom running in honor of her daughter, the leukemia patient going through chemo training along with us, and the reality check at the loss of one of my friends from leukemia before her 26th birthday. 

Cancer sucks, as does any unexpected medical illness. A massage offers a chance for a patient or family member to feel nurtured, away from the disruption of medical treatment. Massage is a chance for the body and mind to feel nurtured, to reconnect within, and perhaps to have a moment of rest. 

What is Needed & What You Get

Funding for this project is for start up costs and to establish a revolving fund for Malaika Massage to become non-profit. Who knew marketing materials, accountants,legal fees, high quality sheets and lotion could cost so much? 

Although nothing tangible will be mailed to you - the options are pretty cool on the impact you can make into another's life. 

Perhaps, you'd like to make a contribution in honor or memory of someone, their name will be integrated into the Wall of Honor at my office, inspiring all those who visit Malaika Massage.

Of course there are the basics of sheets and lotion - but when working with a medical population other supplies like supportive pillows, extra blankets, and cancer treatment specific lotions are also valuable. 

A bit more about Stacey

I am Nationally Certified in Therapeutic Massage and Bodywork (NCTMB).A professional member of the Society of Oncology Massage and a member of the American Massage Therapy Association (AMTA).  I earned my 600 Hour massage diploma from the Holistic Massage Training Institute in Baltimore, Maryland, where I  maintain a license in Massage Therapy (Minnesota does not currently license this profession).In addition to my massage training, I have completed 200 hours in Oncology/Hospital Massage, Presence in Caregiving at the End of Life, and Manual Lymph Drainage. I was a participant at Healwell Massage Therapy Hospital Stewardship Program in Arlington, Virginia, working with in-patients in Acute Rehabilitation, ICU and Oncology. I also hold a Masters in Public Health from the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and hope to incorporate my research interests with alternative medicine.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you are unable to contribute financially, but you can still help spread the work about Malaika Massage Therapy.

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you for your support!

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you for your support!

story:
Eddie's fight with ALS

About me...

Eddie Lopez was first diagnosed with the Lou Gehrig's disease in late 2011.  Before then, Eddie and his wife, Angie, dedicated their lives to raising 3 children and two grandchildren.  Eddie's father trusted Eddie to run the family plumbing business.  Since the beginning, he has faithfully worked to serve the people in Tucson Arizona and surrounding areas.  He is a son, a father, and a grandfather.  2011 changed everything. They now need our help.

Eddie is my brother-in-law who has ALS.  His wife's health has deteriorated rapidly and his daughter has been struggling to care for both of her parents.  Their funds have been exhausted and the family is in serious debt.  Eddie desperately needs a van converted for disabled in order to be transported by wheelchair to his appointments.  The family needs to raise $25,000 to purchase the van and related medical needs not covered by insurance.

Eddie, the son, father and grandfather...

Eddie was one of the most honest and trusted plumbing contractors and business man in the Tucson area for over 40 years.  His career as a master plumber came to an abrupt halt in 2007, although he did not realize it at the time.  He continued to help those who needed his services without requiring upfront payment.  He used his savings with the hope that he will be repaid by customers.  He continued to pay his employees, but unemployment and financial distress by many of his clients left Eddie with a decision - to use his own savings or to shut the company.  He and his wife decided to use their savings.  It decreased rapidly to zero, then to debt, then left them wondering how they can keep a roof over their heads.  His health began to fail in 2009.  By late 2011, he could no longer work; even moving around on his own was difficult.  As of today, he is wheelchair bound, has a tracheostomy, cannot walk or lift his body.  He has limited use of his arms, his coordination is poor, he cannot feed himself, he cannot clean himself, and he needs round the clock care and supervision.

Angie was overwhelmed with trying to keep the company alive, caring for her husband and raising two of their grandchildren.  Angie soon became ill herself with a serious heart condition that has kept her in and out of hospitals for the past year, and she's been reduced to less than 100lbs.  Their daughter resigned at her job, is caring for her mother and father, in addition to raise her daughter and her niece/nephew.

Where the funds will go...

Please help raise $25,000 to purchase a specially equipped handicap van that will provide the mobility Eddie desperately needs.  Any amount you can donate will go directly to fund this purchase. Whether it's $1,000, $100, $10 or $1; anything will help.  Even if you cannot contribute financially at this time, please help spread the word in any way you can (e-mail, facebook, twitter, word of mouth, phonecalls, anything you can do).

Words cannot express my gratitude for your generosity.  Having transportation for Eddie will help in unimaginable ways.  If you need further information on this campaign, please e-mail or call me.  My e-mail address is g.grisel.salazar@gmail.com.  My phone number is 201-320-3394.

In the case more than $25,000 is raised, the additional funds will be donated to the ALS Foundation, Arizona Chapter (webaz.alsa.org).

I sincerely thank you for taking time to read about Eddie's story and the struggle the family is going through.

story:
The video above was put together by my wonderful friend and VERY active advocate for EB, CHRISTIE ZINK. These are photo's she took of me assisting my beautiful friend Vanessa with her sons dressing change (preparing for the care our baby will need when he gets home!), I love this sweet little guy and his smile and his story makes me even more determined to get my baby home!  I am so honored to have these amazing people as a part of my life!  

PLEASE help us save our son!


My name is Tona Crooker. My husband William and I have 4 young kids at home and knew it was time to expand our family. Unfortunately I have had serious complications in my prior pregnancies and we felt it was safest not to try that again. We chose to adopt. What we didn't know was just how hard this road could be. We love each and every one of our children and would do anything to keep them safe and to protect them. But in the world of adoption it is NOT that easy.  We love our son,( "Baby N" as he is called for now) and we want him to be home with our family as soon as possible. The worst part for me as a mother is knowing he is suffering and NO ONE is there to hold him and love him and comfort him. 

Baby N was born with a rare genetic skin disorder called Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB).  Most of his entire body is wrapped in Bandages to protect him from serious injury and fatal infections. He NEEDS these bandages to survive, and sadly he can not recieve the full medical attention it will take to give him a fighting chance at life, until we get him home! 

Everyday things can cause serious pain. He can not just put a shirt on like every one else, to him it means new, painful blisters on any unbandaged areas of skin. He can not just scratch his arm or rub his nose if he has a little itch, without ripping his skin right off. He can not be held or touched to be comforted with out extreme caution from his caregivers to prevent new injuries.

His little body is basically covered in open wounds and he is left susceptible to any and every infection possible. His body is in a constant state of healing for survival, draining all the nutritients he gets and needs to grow, and using it just to survive!

I can't imagine the pain that any child born with EB goes through, but I am heartbroken just thinking of the pain he has to endure and with no one to love him and comfort him. He has no one to make him feel safe and secure, and he has no idea how hard we are fighting for him here. We need to make sure he does not wait a day longer then he already has to.  We NEED to get to him before it is to late....

 

We NEED all the help and support we can get!

 

International adoption is a HUGE expense. And worth EVERY penny. There is no way for me to put a price on any one of my children, and it is devastating that MONEY could stand in our way of giving our sweet baby the chance to fight for survival. EVERY dollar we raise will go directly towards bringing him home.   When it is all said and done we will have spent over $45,000 on this adoption. To me it seems like an insane amount of money to come up with in such a short amount of time, but we are taking it one step at a time....

For our next step we need $2,200 - This will complete the paperwork we need to send to the amazing people who are making this possible for us!

but it doesn't end there...

We will need to pay other fees...

To then move forward from there we will need $3,700, and again it will be to complete more paper work...

Then we will have travel expenses and in country fees (which all add up VERY quickly), we are NOT including what it will take to provide child care for our children currently at home, while we travel for this adoption, along with the time and pay my husband will miss from work etc.

We JUST want to get him home!
We NEED to get him home!

By making a $10 donation and choosing the "Butterfly Magnet" perk you will recieve a beautiul hand made butterfly magnet, made personally by me,  along with a personal thank you card  for making  your donation.

 If choosing to donate more, The $25 "T-shirt" perk will get you a t-shirt I designed to help raise awareness for EB. We are working hard to bring our son home, but we also want to make sure we are working hard to find a cure, we want him to have the best life possible and there is nothing better then a cure! you will also recieve a butterfly magnet as well as a personal thank you card for making your donation.

For a donation of $40, you will recieve a beautiful one of a kind Butterfly Tote bag, that I will assemble personally, along with the handmade butterfly magnet and the t-shirt to help spread awareness. I will also send you a personal thank you card for making your donation.

 

 

We have set our goal at only $2,000 so that we can keep moving forward as quickly as possible. But in all honesty we truly NEED every bit of help we can get to get him home. The adoption part is expensive... yes... and no matter what we will get him home. But we truly can not afford to have credit card bills and loans to pay off when it is all said and done. We will do whatever it takes, but we also have to know that once he is home he will have enormous medical expenses, some will be covered by our private insurance, but others are not. Special clothing, creams, lotions, blankets,  stuff that he will need just to make every day manageable we will need to pay out of pocket for, and we absolutely can do that. The more money we raise to help bring him home the less debt we will have to worry about once he is here, and honestly that will make the life long care for him that much better.

 

This is your opportunity to help us change his life forever...

He will NOT survive in an orphange...

PLEASE help us get him home to us, his family, where he belongs!

 

And remember EVERY bit helps! one more way to help is to SHARE this campaign and our story. The more people who know, the more awareness we can spread, and the closer we will get to our son, and also a cure for EB..

 

Thank you!!!

To me it seems like an insane amount of money to come up with in such a short amount of time, but we are taking it one step at a time.... 
For our next step we need $2,200 - This will complete the paperwork we need to send to the amazing people who are making this possible for us! 
but it doesn't end there... 
We will need to pay other fees... 
To then move forward from there we will need $3,700, and again it will be to complete more paper work... 
Then we will have travel expenses and in country fees (which all add up VERY quickly), we are NOT including what it will take to provide child care for our children currently at home, while we travel for this adoption, along with the time and pay my husband will miss from work etc. 
We JUST want to get him home! We NEED to get him home! 
By making a $10 donation and choosing the "Butterfly Magnet" perk you will recieve a beautiul hand made butterfly magnet, made personally by me,  along with a personal thank you card  for making  your donation. 
 If choosing to donate more, The $25 "T-shirt" perk will get you a t-shirt I designed to help raise awareness for EB. We are working hard to bring our son home, but we also want to make sure we are working hard to find a cure, we want him to have the best life possible and there is nothing better then a cure! you will also recieve a butterfly magnet as well as a personal thank you card for making your donation.
For a donation of $40, you will recieve a beautiful one of a kind Butterfly Tote bag, that I will assemble personally, along with the handmade butterfly magnet and the t-shirt to help spread awareness. I will also send you a personal thank you card for making your donation. 
 


 
We have set our goal at only $2,000 so that we can keep moving forward as quickly as possible. But in all honesty we truly NEED every bit of help we can get to get him home. The adoption part is expensive... yes... and no matter what we will get him home. But we truly can not afford to have credit card bills and loans to pay off when it is all said and done. We will do whatever it takes, but we also have to know that once he is home he will have enormous medical expenses, some will be covered by our private insurance, but others are not. Special clothing, creams, lotions, blankets,  stuff that he will need just to make every day manageable we will need to pay out of pocket for, and we absolutely can do that. The more money we raise to help bring him home the less debt we will have to worry about once he is here, and honestly that will make the life long care for him that much better. 
 
This is your opportunity to help us change his life forever... 
He will NOT survive in an orphange... 
PLEASE help us get him home to us, his family, where he belongs! 
 
And remember EVERY bit helps! one more way to help is to SHARE this campaign and our story. The more people who know, the more awareness we can spread, and the closer we will get to our son, and also a cure for EB.. 
 
Thank you!!!

story:
7 days to go:

As there seemed to be a general lack of interest in our Axhilirit Eczema campaign, we spent most of last week personally contacting hundreds of SA clients that had purchased the products since 2009 to find out exactly why the lack of response.

We came to a stunning and most desperate conclusion.

Around 90% of clients contacted that used the products were 'last resort cases' where they had tried everything else before finding us, including steroid and cortisone containing products.

In about 70% of these cases, the eczema symptoms had stopped with the use of one bottle of oil or one tub of cream and had not returned. A further 23% had to use the products a second or third time before the condition was under control and a mere 5% of the clients occasionally have to 'top up' on their treatments to keep their conditions under control. 2% of clients did not respond to Healing Oil Products.

Most of the clients contacted are from lower/middle income groups and although they stated that the products had changed their lives and that they were grateful to have been able to use it, just cannot assist financially.

Kind Regards

Ronald Gibson

20.05.2014

 

************************************

Hi to all the supporters of Indiegogo.

I am Ronald Gibson, owner and founder of Healing Oil Products, and I am requesting your assistance in having our natural proprietary blend, Axhilirit Eczema Oil and Cream for Eczema and related conditions, Clinically Tested in various studies as required by the MCC of South Africa in order for us to continue making the products easily available to all who suffer from these sometime debilitating conditions.

Medical Registration of all Complimentary and Alternative Therapeutic Products (CAMs) is now required by law in South Africa. All products making any claims that are sold on a formal basis at convenient outlets such as Pharmacies, Drug Stores and Health Shops must be Registered at the Medical Controls Council (our version of the FDA) even though the products do not need a doctor's prescription to obtain.

Axhilirit Eczema Products are currently used for assistance in the accelerated healing of dry and itchy skin such as Eczema and related conditions. Many Psoriasis clients have also found benefit when using Axhilirit. These products have been available on-line to members of the public since 2009. Presently we market and sell mainly on-line, by word of mouth and a small number of health shops and pharmacies.

Over the last 20 years, friends and family have made use of the oils for various skin related complaints including Eczema. It was due to popular demand, and people finding our products an effective last resort, that we started to sell to the public. Although the oils were tested and found safe for topical application, new legislation requires that the method of active ingredient delivery and proof of efficacy in all alternative therapy products be officially established in a controlled, clinical environment through a double blind study from a certified institution. Although we have built up a reputation amongst our clients for producing excellent quality products that are effective, these trials will provide added credibility to Healing Oil Products.

In order to set up the relevant protocols, a sampling will be done of the thousands of contactable clients that we have had up to date. Thanks to loyal clients that wish to stay in contact we have built up a formidable database. The sampling will consist of our existing clients completing a questionnaire to establish the exact condition that they wished to treat, the extent of the condition, previous products exposed to or used, short clinical history, how the Axhilirit Eczema product was used, etc. This will then act as a guideline for the studies. The number of subjects in the studies will depend on the funding available.

The funding that we need will be utilised to apply for and obtain a licence to have the products Clinically tested, the design of the testing protocols, the fees charged by the licensed independent institutions that will do the laboratory work and Clinical Trails, and submission to the Medical Control Council. An amount of $100 000 is needed to adhere to the minimum standards for Clinical testing.

We wish to stay independent in order to keep prices to the end user as affordable as possible, therefore have decided to go the Crowd Funding route instead of signing with a pharmaceutical company or drastically increasing the cost of the products to the consumer. We also donate 10% of our production to charities and those that cannot afford to purchase our products, and will not have to curb or reduce this essential service.

Presently most formal medications and treatments provide temporary relief whereas feedback from our clients indicate that more than 70% of clients obtain long term results, with the balance experiencing less severe flare-ups with longer periods in between. Your contributions will enable more people that suffer with eczema to experience the benefit of our products with the additional confidence provided by Clinical trails.

Even if you cannot contribute financially, it would be highly appreciated if you could spread the word through social media or word of mouth.

For more information, please visit our website at http://www.healing-oil.co.za/ or our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/HealingOilProducts.



Background and Origin of Healing Oil Products

The traditional original recipe for our plant based products dates back to before the First World War where it was used for infected wounds, but fell into disuse with the advent of Penicillin. 

Throughout the years, the original blend was used with great success in our household on infected wounds. Whenever we had a batch of the oils available, friends and family would ask for some.

In 2004 our lives changed irrevocably when my wife, Hanneli, was caught up in a cooking oil explosion, leaving her with Third and Second degree burns over 35% of her body, including her face, neck, hands, arms and both legs from thighs to ankles. 

After more than a month in ICU and another two weeks in hospital, Hanneli was sent home with little hope of regaining functionality of her hands and nothing more that the plastic surgeon could do for her, advising her that she would have to make peace with the way she looked. We were so involved with the drastic changes to our way of life, fighting medical insurance and making sure that the bills get paid, that we did not even think about using our own oil mixture on her burns.

Not able to return to our regular life after this life-changing event, we moved to an area where Hanneli could enjoy a less stressful lifestyle and focus on healing. 

Having gone without our 'magic oils' for a while, Hanneli's horse suffered a horrific injury that refused to heal, prompting us to obtain the ingredients to mix another batch of oils. It was while applying the oils to the horse that most of the content of the bottle spilt over Hanneli's hands. A while after this initial treatment of rubbing the spilt oil into her hands due to the soothing effect it had, she noticed that she could move her wrists all by herself - the first time in four years! 

Excited about this result, we agreed that she should continue with treatments for herself whenever she treated the horse. Two weeks later dimples sprouting hairs started forming on the scars and a noted texture difference could be seen in the scarring in her face. Another two weeks later and she wanted to die from the itching as the old scars started regenerating into what could only be described as resembling her original skin. 

Encouraged by the effect the oils had on Hanneli's skin, I started to experiment with combinations of essential and plant oils to address all her subsequent skin issues; from the annoying itching to the unsightly blemishes. Friends with eczema tried the 'itchy mix' for their itchy eczema and reported back that the eczema was under control and in some cases had disappeared. The AxhiliritEczema products were developed from this mixture and have assisted in keeping Hanneli's life-long eczema condition under control. She has not experienced a flare-up since. 

Due to popular demand, friends and family encouraged us to launch the products so that more people could benefit from it, and so Healing Oil Products, Axhilirit and Rejuvinit were born.

Feedback from Clients

Tanna’s Axhilirit Eczema story

My 18 year old daughter came back from a weekend away about two years ago with little blisters on her fingers.  The GP said it looked as if she had been bitten by bed bugs and gave her medication which did not help.  Within a few days she had blisters on her feet…. And so the eczema journey began.

I have literally spent thousands and thousands  on various attempts to help her.  These include:

·   Four different types of cortisone creams and other creams from the doctor

·   A series of visits to a dietician to assess her reaction to various foods

·  Four months of weekly visits to a doctor for acupuncture

·  Visits to and natural medications from an iridologist

·  Visits to a doctor practicing in homeopathy

·  And when her blisters were so bad under her feet that she could not walk, visits to the GP for cortisone shots.

All of the above seemed to make a slight improvement, but only for a few weeks and then we were back to square one.

My husband found the Natural-oils website while trying to research ways of controlling eczema.

The final crunch came in July this year, just after her June/July exams.  She is a very contentious student and stresses a lot at exam time which makes her eczema worse.  This time, it came out on her hands, feet and face.  She refused to go to school. I ordered the Axhilirit Eczema Cream and this product has been the most successful of all my attempts to help her.  I wanted to share the following photo’s with you to show you how it worked.

Pic 1 was taken on 13 August 2013, (the day my order arrived) before any Axhilirit Eczema Cream was applied. You can see that her face was inflamed.

Pic 2 was taken on 14 August 2013, 24 hours after the first application of the Axhilirit Eczema Cream

Pic 3 was taken on 15 August 2013, 2 days of Axhilirit Eczema Cream applications

Pic 4 was taken on 19 August 2013, after 6 days of Axhilirit Eczema Cream applications

Tanna has continued to use the Axhilirit Eczema cream and we are so grateful, she has just finished writing her matric finals AND the dreaded stress related part of her eczema outbreaks was kept at bay.

Thank you for this truly amazing product!

Varinia van Niekerk - East London, South Africa


I do not have funds available, how else can I help?

Even if you cannot contribute financially, it would be highly appreciated if you could spread the word through social media or word of mouth.

Private Contributions

Due to contribution requests from clients that do not have credit cards or access to PayPal, we have made concessions for PRIVATE CONTRIBUTIONS. Private Contributors qualify for the same perks as on Indiegogo as well as being issued with a receipt as proof of contribution. If you wish to make a private contribution, please email us at info@healing-oil.co.za 

For more information, please visit our website at http://www.healing-oil.co.za/ or our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/HealingOilProducts.


Content and Photos: 

All rights reserved. Copyright © 2009-2014 RFG Consultants t/a Healing Oil Products 2009-2014

story:
What happened

On 3 October, she jumped off the stairs while being carried from a significant height, hit her legs against a wall and landed awkwardly on the ground, breaking both her front legs.

The vet recommended surgery and using metal fittings to realign the bones. However, because there both her front legs are broken, the procedure is more complicated and almost double the cost.

How your contributions will help

We were quoted SGD $6,000 which will cover:

  • X-rays
  • General Anesthesia
  • Surgery
  • Warding at the animal hospital

For my family, this $6,000 is a large sum of money. Any contribution, no matter how tiny, will be greatly appreciated in helping us with the bill-shock.

I hope you don't misinterpret my intentions. I don't like the idea of asking people for money so directly nor do I expect to raise full funding for her surgery. As her owner, yes, it is my responsibility and burden to bear the costs. 

    Risks & Challenges

    After the procedure, she'll take at least 3 months to recover fully and the surgeon  assured a high success rate based on his records. However, there are minimal risks involved in her recovery process. Nothing much to worry about at this point of time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    For those who don't feel comfortable with contributing money, please share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends and family

story:
Our Story  

By Eric Cetnarski, Co-Founder

Several years ago Malcolm McQuirter and I were working in stressful corporate jobs.   Good health & overall wellness seemed like distant, unachievable goals.  Bouts of insomnia, illness, allergies, etc. become more common. We knew this path was not sustainable.

So we took a risk, quit our jobs, and went back to school. Malcolm received his Master's in Ayurvedic Medicine, and I finished a Master's in Sustainable Management. I also become trained as a Sound Therapist.  In 2013 we joined forces and started Samana+ as a part-time endeavor. (Samana is a Sanskrit term for equilibrium/balance.)

We overcame the cycle of stress, fatigue and general dis-ease. We want to share what we have learned with you and our community!

We currently offer Ayurvedic Health & Wellness programs, Sound Therapy, Guided Cleanses, and Workshops. We will soon offer select Ayurvedic body therapies and expanded workshops.

Successes

We are happy to report that not only are we much calmer and happier, we've been able to help 100+ people improve their quality of life. Some of our successes to date include:

  • Eliminated or drastically reduced airborne and food allergies for dozens of people. *I'm one of the successes - I had developed seasonal allergies and intolerance to apples and nuts.  After completing our Urban Reset cleanse - I'm almost completely allergy free and can eat apples and nuts again! 
  • Helped a man with a very rare neurological disease recover. He was nearly bed-ridden and is now surfing again.  (Here is a video he sent us.)
  • Helped several women with fertility issues. One woman's monthly cycle had stopped completely.  After working with Malcolm she regained regularity.
  • Used sound therapy to help a woman with chronic adrenal fatigue balance her energy and sleep cycles.  She is now working again and enthusiastic about life. 
  • And through our workshops and sound therapy have given many people tools to deal with the stresses of modern urban life. (e.g. Breathing exercises for the bus.)

Please visit our testimonials page for more stories.

We are grateful to have helped so many people, and want to expand our offerings. It is time for us to set up our wellness center! 


We Are Raising $15,000 To Renovate Our New Center.  By Pre-Ordering Services or Donating, You Can Give Yourself And Others The Gift of Wellness & Help Us Open Soon!  Not only will can you enhance your life, you will help us create a community for others. 

We've found a home for Samana+ in Oakland's Temescal District.  It is located on the second floor of the former Hooper's Chocolate factory.

It is a beautiful 1700 sq. ft. space, but it needs some love. We are currently painting it, installing new floors, and building out treatment spaces. 

Progress So Far -

The main room before and after some paint and and flooring.

Eric's Sound Therapy studio - it is taking shape.

But there's more to do!  By contributing/pre-ordering services, you will give us the working capital to help us:

  • Get the the office up to fire code (purchase exits signs, etc.)
  • Buy workshop supplies and furniture (chairs, whiteboard, etc.)
  • Purchase body therapy equipment and oils.
  • Stock our retail section with wellness supplies and books.
  • Finish renovating our community treatment offices.

Our company is founded on the mission of being of service to the community. Right now we are turning to our community to help us attain working capital.  In return, you get access to health and wellness programs that work!

Will you join us?
You can order a specific service or buy a credit for use when you are ready.   We packaged some services with extras for our IndieGogo contributors.

**The Holiday Season is a great time to give the gift of health to yourself or to a loved one.   Do you have health goals you want to achieve in 2015? Samana+ can help you reach them!  Not sure what to get a friend or family member? Empower them with Samana+ tools for stress reduction and optimal health!**

Suggestions:

Urban Reset Guided Group Cleanse ($225)
This is a great program for people with allergies, digestive issues and bloating. It is also fantastic for people who need to train themselves to get off of sugar/caffeine/junk food.  Our Ayurvedic mono-diet cleanse is gentle, yet powerful. The best part is you get to eat!  We offer cleanses during the change of seasons and will offer them more frequently when at the center.  IndieGogo contributors get one free one-on-one consultation session with Malcolm during the cleanse.



Ayurvedic Wellness Pack ($400)
This service is great if you have a chronic health concerns or just want to find a better way of eating/living. Malcolm will work with you to refine your eating/other habits. He'll give you a program you can use for life.  (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.)



Sound Therapy Pack ($200)
Sound Therapy is excellent for people who need to de-stress immediately.  It is also helpful for a host of other concerns including sore muscles, letting go of stuck emotions, etc...  Eric will work with you and develop a program to help you meet your needs/goals. He'll give you tools you can use everyday. (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.)


Bliss Therapy (Sound + Shirodhara) ($150)
The ultimate in relaxation and transcendence. :) A 30 minute crystal bowl sound immersion followed by one hour of warm oil applied to your forehead (third eye).  Can't be described - only experienced.  (IndieGogo contributors get $50 off!)




Workshop Pack ($100)
Access to 6 workshops offered by Samana Plus.  We are working on several events now including 'Yoga and Activism', Yogi Nidra for Stress Reduction, Eating for the Season and a weekly group sound/toning meetup.  (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.)



Not in the Bay Area?
You can make a donation, buy a sweatshirt, or participate in our Urban Reset Remotely.  

The Impact

Your purchase/contribution will help this bootstrapping team get up and running faster - without costly traditional institution debt. More importantly, however, you will be giving yourself a gift of relaxation & wellness. You'll also be created the causes and conditions for others to receive our services!  We all benefit! :)

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk Samana+ has is a delayed opening. Renovations can take longer than planned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please consider passing this along to your network.
story_txt:
Our Story  
By Eric Cetnarski, Co-Founder Several years ago Malcolm McQuirter and I were working in stressful corporate jobs.   Good health & overall wellness seemed like distant, unachievable goals.  Bouts of insomnia, illness, allergies, etc. become more common. We knew this path was not sustainable. 
So we took a risk, quit our jobs, and went back to school. Malcolm received his Master's in Ayurvedic Medicine, and I finished a Master's in Sustainable Management. I also become trained as a Sound Therapist.  In 2013 we joined forces and started Samana+ as a part-time endeavor. (Samana is a Sanskrit term for equilibrium/balance.)
We overcame the cycle of stress, fatigue and general dis-ease. We want to share what we have learned with you and our community! 
We currently offer Ayurvedic Health & Wellness programs, Sound Therapy, Guided Cleanses, and Workshops. We will soon offer select Ayurvedic body therapies and expanded workshops. 

Successes


We are happy to report that not only are we much calmer and happier, we've been able to help 100+ people improve their quality of life. Some of our successes to date include:


Eliminated or drastically reduced airborne and food allergies for dozens of people. *I'm one of the successes - I had developed seasonal allergies and intolerance to apples and nuts.  After completing our Urban Reset cleanse - I'm almost completely allergy free and can eat apples and nuts again! 
Helped a man with a very rare neurological disease recover. He was nearly bed-ridden and is now surfing again.  (Here is a video he sent us.)


Helped several women with fertility issues. One woman's monthly cycle had stopped completely.  After working with Malcolm she regained regularity. 

Used sound therapy to help a woman with chronic adrenal fatigue balance her energy and sleep cycles.  She is now working again and enthusiastic about life. 
And through our workshops and sound therapy have given many people tools to deal with the stresses of modern urban life. (e.g. Breathing exercises for the bus.) 


Please visit our testimonials page for more stories. 

We are grateful to have helped so many people, and want to expand our offerings. It is time for us to set up our wellness center!  
   We Are Raising $15,000 To Renovate Our New Center.  By Pre-Ordering Services or Donating, You Can Give Yourself And Others The Gift of Wellness & Help Us Open Soon!  Not only will can you enhance your life, you will help us create a community for others.  

We've found a home for Samana+ in Oakland's Temescal District.  It is located on the second floor of the former Hooper's Chocolate factory. 


It is a beautiful 1700 sq. ft. space, but it needs some love. We are currently painting it, installing new floors, and building out treatment spaces.  Progress So Far - 
The main room before and after some paint and and flooring.
Eric's Sound Therapy studio - it is taking shape.But there's more to do!  By contributing/pre-ordering services, you will give us the working capital to help us:
Get the the office up to fire code (purchase exits signs, etc.) 
Buy workshop supplies and furniture (chairs, whiteboard, etc.) 
Purchase body therapy equipment and oils.
Stock our retail section with wellness supplies and books. 
Finish renovating our community treatment offices. 


Our company is founded on the mission of being of service to the community. Right now we are turning to our community to help us attain working capital.  In return, you get access to health and wellness programs that work! Will you join us?You can order a specific service or buy a credit for use when you are ready.   We packaged some services with extras for our IndieGogo contributors. **The Holiday Season is a great time to give the gift of health to yourself or to a loved one.   Do you have health goals you want to achieve in 2015? Samana+ can help you reach them!  Not sure what to get a friend or family member? Empower them with Samana+ tools for stress reduction and optimal health!** Suggestions:

Urban Reset Guided Group Cleanse ($225)This
 is a great program for people with allergies, digestive issues and 
bloating. It is also fantastic for people who need to train themselves 
to get off of sugar/caffeine/junk food.  Our Ayurvedic mono-diet cleanse
 is gentle, yet powerful. The best part is you get to eat!  We offer 
cleanses during the change of seasons and will offer them more 
frequently when at the center.  IndieGogo contributors get one free one-on-one consultation session with Malcolm during the cleanse. 
Ayurvedic Wellness Pack ($400) This
 service is great if you have a chronic health concerns or just want to 
find a better way of eating/living. Malcolm will work with you to refine
 your eating/other habits. He'll give you a program you can use for 
life.  (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.)
Sound Therapy Pack ($200)Sound Therapy is excellent for people who need to de-stress immediately.  It 
is also helpful for a host of other concerns including sore muscles, 
letting go of stuck emotions, etc...  Eric will work with you and 
develop a program to help you meet your needs/goals. He'll give you 
tools you can use everyday. (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.)

Bliss Therapy (Sound + Shirodhara) ($150) The
 ultimate in relaxation and transcendence. :) A 30 minute crystal bowl 
sound immersion followed by one hour of warm oil applied to your 
forehead (third eye).  Can't be described - only experienced.  (IndieGogo contributors get $50 off!) 
Workshop Pack ($100) Access
 to 6 workshops offered by Samana Plus.  We are working on several 
events now including 'Yoga and Activism', Yogi Nidra for Stress 
Reduction, Eating for the Season and a weekly group sound/toning 
meetup.  (IndieGogo contributors get 6 sessions for price of 5.) 
Not in the Bay Area? You can make a donation, buy a sweatshirt, or participate in our Urban Reset Remotely.

More importantly, however, you will be giving yourself a gift of relaxation & wellness. You'll also be created the causes and conditions for others to receive our services!  We all benefit! :)

story:
Personal "Thank You" from Matthew McConaughey"

We are running a Referral Contest. The Winner will get a personal "Thank You from Matthew McConaughey" (Kris our awesome impersonator) Got to http://goo.gl/9QeEAX and ClicK "Share" on the icons
>> Facebook Tweeter Google+ >>

Contest Ends July 7

SHORT SUMMARY

Aging is not something that you can run from.  The normal mindset is to age gracefully, gray and grow old.  I disagree.

The truth is that how you look really does matter.  It matters in the workplace, it matters in your personal life and it matters in general how you feel about yourself.  The challenge for men is that it is difficult to find real products designed for men that don't make them feel like a women when using them.  The other challenge is to find good quality products.

WHO WE ARE?

BEST Research Labs has started a movement called Reverse - The Art of Not Growing Old Gracefully.  This movement is founded on the principal that you should stand up and fight against aging, and strive to reverse the years of living from showing on your body.  

We have developed a series of high quality Men's skin and hair care products that are 100% organic and a unique combination of science, history and nature all combined into one.  


All products are made in the USA.  To relate to men, the product line itself is designed after a Muscle Car theme and the product titles are in line with the steps in overhauling a car.

Join our movement, and fight the good fight against aging.  Put it in Reverse, and go back to how you were.

WHAT WE NEED?

We are looking to raise $10,000 to help us truly launch our product and initiative.  We are done with our research and productization and packaging, but we need to reach people.  The $10,000 will go towards:

  • Internet Marketing in the form of Facebook Ads, Banner Ads, Website Updates and Email Marketing Blasts

  • Print Advertising

  • Marketing Collateral such as Info Brochures and Pamphlets

  • Signing up and supporting Authorized Representatives and Distribution Channels

  • Media Production such as Videos, Voice Recordings, Testimonials, etc.


HOW WE ARE DIFFERENT?

We are different from other Men's anti-aging products in that it has been designed for men by men.  We understand that men just want to look good, and do not want to decipher what to use or feel bad about using it.  We have a limited and focused product line designed exactly for what men need.  The theme we have can be related directly to men in the Baby Boomer and Generation X category in Muscle Cars from the late 1960's and 1970's, back in a time that made these men feel young and invincible.

The other unique attribute on our products is that at the foundation is 100% organic ingredients.  We focus on Essential Oils, which have been used for centuries for their skin restoration qualities and youth enhancing attributes, much like what has been documented in history to work such as what Cleopatra in Egypt used.  We have scoured the world looking for the right ingredients that are organic and proven to work, including Egypt, Middle East, Europe, Asia and South America.  These secrets have been long lost and forgotten, until BEST Research Labs has brought them back to life in our Reverse product line.

Some people just can’t contribute, and we understand, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help:

  • Join us on Facebook 
  • Spread the word on social sites about BEST Research Labs
  • Check us out on YouTube 
  • SHARE TO WIN - Click "Share" to win a personal thank you from Matthew McConaughey (Kris the voice). http://goo.gl/9QeEAX

story:
Die Goldeneye Familie möchte im Zuge der Goldeneye FOR A BETTER WORLD-Kampagne Miriam im Kampf gegen den Krebs unterstützen. Denn Miriam gehört zur Familie!
Wir alle möchten Mimi wieder so sehen wie auf diesen Bildern! Wenn sie lacht, wenn sie mal wieder hyperaktiv creativ ist, uns mit ihren Fotos und tollen Ideen verzaubert...Wenn sie einfach Mimi ist. GESUND und glücklich!
Anfang letzten Jahres wurde bei Mimi Brustkrebs diagnostiziert und obwohl sie so unendlich tapfer durch die Chemo gegangen ist hat der Krebs gestreut... Ihre Frauenärztin hatte sich 2 Jahre lang hartnäckig geweigert, diesen Tumor entfernen zu lassen und das Ergebnis ist, dass Mimi nun um ihr Leben kämpfen muss. Die Ärzte sprechen schon von palliativer Chemo - lebensverlängernd und nicht heilend.
Das können und wollen wir nicht hinnehmen!!! Wir haben eine Reihe von vielversprechenden Alternativ-Methoden aufgetan, bei denen nun der finanzielle Aspekt ein Problem wird. Sollten sich die Heidelberger Ärzte gegen eine OP aussprechen kann auch eine kostenintensive OP im Ausland anstehen. Die Zeit ist knapp und Mimi soll alles nur erdenklich mögliche tun können um zu LEBEN! Um GESUND zu werden.
Wir glauben an Wunder und an das Motto niemals aufzugeben - wir hoffen, da draussen ganz viele zu finden, die uns in unserem Projekt unterstützen! Eine Blut-Therapie kostet z.B. alleine schon 6.000€, von vielen anderen unterstützenden Mittel wie Ozon etc. gar nicht zu reden...
Wir wollen Mimi wieder lachen sehen. Danke für eure Hilfe und eure guten Vibes <3

Being one of the most amazing creature we were blessed with to meet & call our friend, our beautiful soul Miriam had to take on a struggle we wish upon nobody.
She was diagnosed with breast cancer that spread to the lymphknotes, needless to say the chemo therapy didnt work!! Because we believe in NEVA GIVE UP

we have researched & found many alternative procedures & healing methods.

The problem being the financial aspect. This is where we not only urgently ask you to send your prayers, positve thoughts, love, blessings her way but be so kind a find it in your heart & wallet to support us in NEVA GIVE UP!!

Bei dem grandiosen Erfolg unserer Spendenaktion für Mimi ist es denke ich an der Zeit danke zu sagen! Danke an alle, die an diese Herzenssache glauben, die mitgemacht haben und immernoch mitmachen!!! Wir konnten dank euch jemanden von außerhalb organisieren der ab heute Miriam im Krankenhaus mit einer Spezialbehandlung begleitet. Sie bekommt die besten Zusätze und Infusionen die man sich vorstellen kann und im Moment ist Bestrahlung angesagt. Was auch immer dann noch kommt - Dank euch muss sie sich keine Gedanken machen ob und was das kostet - denn egal was es sein wird, wir haben nun eine ordentliche Summe erreichen können, die die anstehenden Alternativtherapien tragen kann. Das Wichtigste aber ist, dass all eure guten Wünsche und Energien ankommen!!!! Mein schönstes Geschenk heute, war Mimi lächeln zu sehen und sagen zu hören:"Wenn es echt ein Benefiz- Konzert für mich gibt will ich dabei sein! Und wenn ihr mich im Bollerwagen hinkarrt!" Ich habe ihr zumindest eine Live- Übertragung versprochen und musste selbst mit den Tränen der Rührung kämpfen als ich sagte, dass ich natürlich drauf bestehe dass sie sieht dass sich ein ganzes Dorf auf die Socken macht und eine ganze Halle nur für sie rockt!!! Ihr macht uns sprachlos - und Mimi glücklich. Und DAS, Leute... DAS ist unbezahlbar!!! 
LOVE MOVES MOUNTAINS Danke natürlich auch an alle, die ganz nah bei Mimi ALLES geben, damit sie wieder gesund wird und die es bei der fast dramatisch zu bezeichnenden Aktion geschafft haben dass der Prophet nicht zum Berg kommt, sondern der Berg zum Propheten (ihr wisst was ich meine... DANKE  Ihr seid eine ECHT coole Herde und ich bin gesegnet euch zu .
Nun geht es nicht mehr wirklich darum, abartig viel Geld zu sammeln, sondern ihr Kraft und Mut zu geben! Wir haben mehr erreicht als wir uns erhofft hatten... Schickt doch auch einfach mal eine Postkarte statt Geld... Denn nun sind vor allem gute Vibes gefragt ❤
Für alle internationalen Spender und Helfer: 
With grand success like this we think its time to say THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts!! Thanks ALL for the support, love, positive vibes that Miriam has received n will continue to receive!
ONE WORLD, ONE PEOPLE!!
With your help it was possible to organize a special treatment for our MiMi. She is getting the best supplements and infusions you can think of.
Next step, she will be transferred for radiation treatment.
Thanks to ALL of you we do not need to worry about the financial aspect, we are positive that no matter what costs together we will make it happen!!
This being already overwhelming, we are so grateful for all the support, love, positive vibes that are coming in!!
It was the biggest gift to see our MiMi smile again, to hear her say "I want to there for the benificial concert, even if zou have to cart me there"!! The concert will be held in her and by her hometown in honor and support of her wonderfulness!!
We want it to be live streamed!
We are speechless and Miriam is endlessly blown away with happiness!!
Read her latest status's on Facebook, it will bring tears to your eyes like it did to mine, she is up for the fight people!!hat 
This is priceless!! LOVE MOVES MOUTAINS!!
THANK YOOOUUU also to everyone in our surrounding, close to Miriam, that are giving everything to make her healthy again.
Through you we were able to bring the prophet to the mountain....you know what we mean...THANK YOU!! You are the coolest bunch n we are blessed to know you!!
Remember its NOT  mainly the Money That Counts but your positive thoughts, blessings, love and happy vibes, continue to keep her in your prayers & Maybe send a postcard!! ONE WORLD, ONE PEOPLE!! NEVADA GIVE UP!!
