story:
Who are we:

Students from the University of Massachusetts Medical School representing the School of Medicine and the Graduate School of Nursing.


Our Goals:

The medical mission trip is a inter-professional student-run campaign with simple, but critical goals:

  • To establish a full-service clinic at different Bateyes (small communities near sugar plantations) over a two week period.
  • Provide basic health services including: Sick visits, deworming, access to medications via a pharmacy we set up during our stay, screening such as pap smears, and various diagnostic tests including urinalysis and pregnancy tests.
  • Provide students with invaluable experience and exposure to global health in addition to personal mentoring from preceptors.
  • Develop a needs assessment for the communities we serve and help improve the continuity of care they receive by using data gathered to improve our own future trips as well as inform our local partner, Good Samaritan Hospital
  • Return to the US with an improved skill-set, heightened cultural awareness, and a refined tool kit to provide higher standards of care to our patients stateside and abroad.


What we need:

  • The cost for each student to travel to the Dominican Republic for the medical mission trip is $1500 USD.
  • The cost covers: airfare, room and board at a near-by hotel and travel costs to the bateyes (usually by bus)

What we are doing:

  • Over the next several months, students taking part in the trip will be raising money locally to help pay for supplies and essentials that will allow us to provide better care to the patients we see. Since the patient population we see speaks primarily Spanish or Creole, we also employ several interpreters during our trip. Our local fundraising does not subsidize our personal costs for the trip.
  • We have several sessions where we work as a team to help organize and pack medications we have obtained through donations to stock our pharmacy in the clinics we set up.
  • We're all full-time students, dedicating the majority of our time to improving our skills as health care professionals


The Impact

Our patient population is primarily Haitian immigrants who have very limited health care access. The medical care and medications we provide will greatly improve the health of their community, improve their quality of life, and improve their own health literacy. In addition to providing the communities with priceless health care, our community engagement team is working to create more long-term solutions to the disparities in their health care.


What you can do:

Your donations will be used to help subsidize the cost of the trip for students. No donation is too small and every dollar will help make the trip more affordable. Anything you contribute will help us bring quality health care to the lives of others who desperately need it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, there's still a way you can help!

Spread the word, share this page on social media or distribute an email to friends, family or colleagues.

What we are doing:

Over the next several months, students taking part in the trip will be raising money locally to help pay for supplies and essentials that will allow us to provide better care to the patients we see. Since the patient population we see speaks primarily Spanish or Creole, we also employ several interpreters during our trip. Our local fundraising does not subsidize our personal costs for the trip.
We have several sessions where we work as a team to help organize and pack medications we have obtained through donations to stock our pharmacy in the clinics we set up.
We're all full-time students, dedicating the majority of our time to improving our skills as health care professionals




The Impact
 Our patient population is primarily Haitian immigrants who have very limited health care access. The medical care and medications we provide will greatly improve the health of their community, improve their quality of life, and improve their own health literacy. In addition to providing the communities with priceless health care, our community engagement team is working to create more long-term solutions to the disparities in their health care.



  What you can do: Your donations will be used to help subsidize the cost of the trip for students. No donation is too small and every dollar will help make the trip more affordable. Anything you contribute will help us bring quality health care to the lives of others who desperately need it. 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to help financially, there's still a way you can help!
Spread the word, share this page on social media or distribute an email to friends, family or colleagues.

story:
MajiSports

Namaste! Indiegogo and thank you for checking out MajiSports' MajiMat. MajiSports is an entrepreneurial endeavor of two UCLA Bruins, Giovanni Villa and Ben Kibreab.  MajiSports is focused on innovating and designing research based performance gear for Yoga Athletes.  Our first product is the unique MajiMat.

“Yoga has stretched far beyond its meditative, baggy-sweats roots to become a fashionable lifestyle pursuit appealing as much to competitive marathon runners and college students as it does to om-chanting meditators.” - The New York Times

The traditional yoga mat, which has not fundamentally changed in decades, has not been designed to provide ergonomic cushioning and protection for potential injuries of the knees, wrists and joints.  For too long yoga athletes have interrupted their flow by skipping demanding poses, rolling a towel and putting it under their knees, or folding the edges of their yoga mats to minimize pain and to avoid injuries.  In addition, most yoga practice is done in studios with hardwood floors and a typical yoga mat does not provide the necessary cushioning and protection from poses that involves balancing your whole body weight on one knee.  As most yoga practitioners, we experienced these issues in our daily yoga practice.  After suffering during hundreds of yoga classes, we decided to do something about it and design a more functional yoga mat that would provide the necessary joint protection while improving our yoga practice.

It took us two years to go from concept to a market tested prototype.  We worked with an Orthopedic Surgeon, Physical Therapist and Yoga athletes to design and develop the MajiMat.  The MajiMat is made from eco-friendly materials.  Now that we have a market tested prototype, we need your help to go from prototype to production.

The Technology of the MajiMat:

The MajiMat features an eco-friendly natural rubber surface with a unique three-dimensional pattern and soft texture that provides superior non-slip properties.  The MajiMat offers the space to perform all yoga poses with the benefit of durable impact protection where you need it most without added bulk.  The knee support system is ergonomically designed to contour around the knees for maximum comfort and injury prevention.  The knee and edge support system is engineered from both firm and memory foam for durability and comfort.  The top layer consists of a moister wicking fabric to keep the surface dry and provide maximum performance.  The edge support system is designed with strategically placed ridges to allow the MajiMat to easily roll similar to a standard yoga mat.

Close up!

What will Funding be Used For: 

With the help of Indiegogo community we can begin sharing the MajiMat with the world.  The funds raised by Indiegogo  will be used (1) to enhance the design by incorporating the feedback we have received from our test users, (2)  to create the tooling, and (3)  setup and initial production run of the MajiMat.   To produce our prototypes, we worked with a manufacturer in China, but our long-term goal is to manufacture the MajiMat in the United States and do our part to support the U.S. manufacturing industry.  

Spread the Karma!

Thank you for watching and for your support of the MajiMat.  Please help us spread our message for good karma!

www.facebook.com/majisports 

Twitter @majisports

www.majisports.com

 

MajiMat Buzz!

Our limited market test performed way above our expectations, we were even featured in national and local fitness and yoga magazines.

Featured in Shape Magazine January 2012 Issue!
 
Shape January 2012 Issue Article.
 
LA Yoga Magazine
LA Yoga Magazine Article

story:
Hi! I'm Bryan. I'm a certified fitness instructor located in the beautiful city of Vancouver.  I have a dream of bringing health and wellness to the people of my city.  Just over a year ago I opened the doors to Tipo Fitness where the neighborhoods of Strathcona and China town meet (two amazing communities full of history and flavour).  Although some people may see my business as just a gym, this endeavor is so much more than this. My goal is to create a meeting place where people come to talk about their goals and to take the first steps in becoming a healthier more balanced person, a place to go whether you are new to fitness or a seasoned pro.  One of the things that I was very conscious of was to do away with the 'crowded gym' and to refocus back on the client.  All sessions are private, one on one, aimed at the individual and their needs.  It's a chance for me to get to know my neighbours on a one on one basis, eliminating the tendency other gyms have of making individuals feel just like a number.   I also offer a multitude of classes such as hip hop dancing, Latin dance, kids dance, yoga, Tipo fit extreme, and martial arts.  Classes are small, 6-10 people (no over-crowding), with the intention of giving the instructors a chance to interact with people on a more personal level.  I feel in the last year I have only scratched the surface of what Tipofit can be and with your help and support my team and I can continue to give back to the community. 

I have begun to build a loyal clientele with the surrounding community.   Our neighbourhood has responded well to Tipo Fitness being here and hopes that we continue to provide our services.  However, as with any new business, there have been a few setbacks:

1)  In the early days of Tipo Fitness I was met with resistance and expense from the city and contractors.  On several occasions we suffered fines and closure due to contractors not having proper building permits.  Adding to this, the City of Vancouver took almost a year to issue the proper business licence, resulting in Tipofit inciting additional fines. 

2)  Tipofit was recently the victim of a break in.   As a result we lost lots of expensive equipment, had to replace damaged property, and incurred the expense of installing a security system to bring a sense of security back to the gym.  Because we are a start up company it is not financially possible to replace these items. Due to the unforeseen setbacks with the city and contractors, we were forced to cancel our insurance, making it impossible to make a claim for compensation.

I, we, need your help with the unexpected financial setbacks so we can continue to provide the community with health and fitness for everyone, re-equip our business with the items that were stolen and continue to work towards such future goals as developing our originally planned gluten free café.  Strathcona is a new and upcoming area that needs creative small businesses, like Tipofit, to thrive.  With your help we can do just that.

So how can you get involved? Have a look through the perk packages and choose one that's right for you.    For your generous donation you will received the Tipo experience outlined in each perk and become part of the Tipo family.    

Other ways to get involved? Simply use the power of the pen, or rather the mouse! Hit the share button and share this project with your friends and family to get the word out that we need your help! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read! I hope that through your support and donation I can continue to grow, thrive and give back to the community that I live in.  

Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

Bryan 

Bryan@tipofit.ca

Www.tipofit.ca

story:
Making Lives Better

MLB, founded in 2009 as a student led service organization at Rollins College, is devoted to improving the lives of people in rural communities around the world in the impact areas of Health and Education. Our vision is of a world where access to health and educational resources are the solution to better lives. 

Over the past four years we have raised over $75K toward health camps. Having reached nearly 6,000 people, we believe that our health camps, educational outreaches, and water purification projects (Mission Aqua) are imperative to the quality of life for many people throughout rural Nepal. 


Doti 2014

This campaign is meant to fund the majority of our 2014 health initiatives.  That includes week-long general and dental surgical clinics in Doti, Silgadi, Nepal. We partner with a local NGO, Sagarmatha Health Foundation (SHF), who contributes a team of highly qualified doctors and dentists to serve the rural Doti community. 

It is a harsh reality that most of the people whom we serve have never seen a doctor or dentist before.

In total, our health initiatives cost approximately $8,000 and so far we have raised approximately $4500. That is why we need your help. 


Your Impact

While it may not feel as though giving money is the most meaningful way to make a difference in the world, most often that is what's necessary; to provide the means for change is just as noble and impactful as giving time or labor. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute at this time, please spread the word of our campaign- through Facebook, Twitter, Blogs-- through whatever means you can. 

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Facebook: Like Making Lives Better here!


THANK-YOU, FOR MAKING LIVES BETTER.

story:
What is Sexpression:UK?

Sexpression:UK is a student led, not-for-profit organisation that aims to use education to empower young people to make informed choices about their sexual and reproductive health.

What is our goal?

We aim for a society in which young people are able to access reliable information about relationships, sex and sexuality; where youth are free from STIs, and unwanted pregnancy; and where they are empowered to make individual, informed decisions regarding their bodies and their health.

What is our situation today?

Sexpression:UK currently has branches in 29 universities in the UK and in the last year has delivered peer led sex and relationships education to more than 10,000 young people on a range of topics from sexuality, contraception and STIs, to pleasure and relationships.  

As a student led organisation we currently depend on sporadic sponsors and donations that we receive from people that support what we do. We are aiming to grow as an organisation and improve the sexual and relationship education that we provide to young people across the UK and increasing our advocacy activity to achieve our vision. The little funding that we currently receive is not enough for us to fulfil our plans and that is why we decided to launch our Indiegogo campaign.

What do we want to achieve?

Through Indiegogo we aim to fund two training events for our volunteers to receive high-quality and consistent training to ensure across our network we are providing the same high standard of education across the UK. This will prepare our volunteers to deliver the best peer education possible. The weekend-long events will each be attended by around 30 people.

In addition to this, we also aim to increase the funding available to our branches to allow them access to a wider range of excellent resources and enhance the education that young people receive.

We need your support

Our national committee is trained to deliver our volunteer training. They have a lot of experience in facilitating sexual and relationship education to young people and will be joined by many external speakers to enhance the training that our volunteers receive.

As we have branches all over the United Kingdom we aim to organise two training events : one in Newcastle and one in Bristol to maximise the convenience for volunteers.

With the funds that we raise we aim to cover:

  • The cost of hiring the venue for the weekend. (£300)

  • Cost of food and refreshments for the participants. (£200)

  • Cost of speakers/experts in this field.  (£200)

  • Travel expenses for 30 of our volunteers to travel to the venue (£1000)

Looking at those figures we aim to raise £3000 in order to hold two training weekends.

We will also be seeking more funding from businesses and other organisation to sponsor the events and reduce the costs.

If we obtain more more money we will share this equally with our branches so that they can buy more resources and improve the standard of education provided:

  • 9p/condom is the price that branches pay to buy condoms to use in demonstrations

  • £11.95 is the price of a FPA condom demonstrator

  • £79.95 is the price of a FPA contraception display kit

  • £57.95 is the price of a FPA drunkbuster impairment goggles

What do you get?

We have great perks available with each donation, check the side menu to see what we are giving away to show our gratitude for your help!

The impact

Sexual health education is not yet compulsory in the UK. Its delivery to young people in the UK is patchy and of a hugely variable quality.

Our organisation uses peer education to inform and ensure young people can make informed decisions about their sexual and reproductive health through our informal, fun, student led sessions in our local communities.

Over the past year we have taught over 10,000 young people with over 2000 hours of volunteer time dedicated to Sexpression.  Check out the video for some more figures.

Other ways you can help

Please spread the word about our campaign.

Tweet, Facebook, email the link to share our campaign with all your friends

Follow @Sexpression on Twitter and ‘like’ us on facebook to find out more about what we do..

People need to be aware that sex and relationships education is not yet compulsory and Sexpression:UK has an invaluable role in preparing young people for their futures.

We can't do that without you.

story:
My name is Patricia Smith. I have been an advocate of Medical Marijuana Patient rights for 34 years, but I never dreamt that I would be trying to raise funds to supply Cannabis Oil to children.

Jason David, in the above video, is a caring father of a six-year-old boy with Dravet Syndrome, a rare and catastrophic form of epilepsy. Jason gave his son medical marijuana for his seizures, after prescribed drugs did not work. Jason's seizures stopped significantly. 

    • Our collective, GrassRoots Solutions, supplies all of our patients organic, medical grade cannabis tinctures at NO COST! 
    • Our cannabis tinctures are tested for purity by a third-party independent lab
    • We supply FREE Plants to cultivators who donate their medicine to our patients.
    • CBD is a component of the Marijuana plant that DOES NOT cause a Psychoactive high, and is SAFE for children.
    • THC is equally important in treating many other life threatening conditions.

    Patients need Medicine and you get to Save a Life!

    • Many dispensaries are charging astronomical sums of money for this rare and valuable medicine. 
    • Patients have been placed a year long wait list due to the scarcity of this medicine

    • Our Medical Marijuana growers supply the base material free of charge. Your contributions will offset the significant cost of manufacturing and testing the tinctures

    • The higher your contribution, the more patients we are able to help

    The Impact of your Contribution:

    Not only does Medical Marijuana help children, it is also beneficial for adults suffering from life threatening conditions:

    • We are currently supplying hundreds of patients who have; Cancer, PTSD, Chronic Pain, Lou Gehrig's Disease, Parkinson's, Crohn's Disease, and Nausea from Chemotherapy, 
    • All contributions will be used to benefit patients. No funds will go towards administrative costs, we are all volunteers.
    • With your help we will be able to expand our program to reach more patients
    • We also offer counselling, legal advice, and continued education 

    My Qualifications: 

    • Nevada County Chair of Americans for Safe Access
    • Host of Award Winning Cannabis Crusades on KVMR
    • Created a Voter Initiative to protect Patient Cultivation rights 

    Don't give till it hurts, just till it feels good!

     Even if you are unable to contribute, you can still help:

    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

We recently made a move from Biloxi, MS to Brooksville, FL. Mom (Rita) took a job which ignited the move. Brooke (age 5) caught a stomach virus, just like any other child her age. She started getting dizzy and complaining about pain in her neck. We took her to 4 different doctor visits until one led by God stated that she needed to be treated at one of the best children's hospital.

What We Need

We do not have insurance and have been going through a lot with the government to get their proposed healthcare. We are missing work and drive 80 minutes a day from home to the hospital. We have been spending each night with Brooke since she was admitted on March 12th.

The Impact

Your contribution will be greatly appreciated by our family. We don't have much to give, but do have our gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out to everyone you can. Thank you, and God Bless those who can help us along with those who had the desire to but could not.

story:
The Cause: Melissa Di-mola is a grandmother, Mother and general amazing lady!

Around one year ago she was diagnosed with Breast Cancer. She underwent an intense course of chemotherapy which shrank the cancerous growth enough to have a mastectomy operation to remove her left breast.

Sadly though, the cancer had moved into her lymph nodes and more treatment was necessary. She underwent a 6 week programme of radiotherapy, which again was very harsh and invasive.

She has recently been examined post radiotherapy and although the cancer has decreased somewhat some stubborn cancer still remains in her Lymph nodes, especially under her collarbone- which is a very difficult place to treat using any of the mainstream treatments. 

This has called for us to go in search of alternative treatments, many of which exist and many of which have been proven to work.

The treatment that we are now hoping to fund for Melissa is a course of GcMAF  treatment which she will undergo for 3 weeks at a retreat in Germany.

GcMAF is an immune boost treatment whereby a patient receives super immune boosting supplement injections over a period of time and the human body, with this supplement the body can perform in such a miraculous way that its cancer fighting abilities are significantly increased. Subsequently, in most cases the patient is able to overcome their illness.

The cost is £3000 per week, therefore we are hoping to raise a total of £9000. We have already done some very productive fundraising that has raised us over £3000 so we do have a bit of a way to go but it is doable.

Please get involved and help us to send Melissa for the treatment that she deserves.

story:
On Saturday July 5th, our lives drastically changed. We found out John had a large aggressive tumor on his brainstem, which was considered inoperable. We received difficult news July 18, 2014 the biopsy results showed glioblastoma, which is aggressive and deadly. The neurosurgeon feels radiation and chemo will ultimately have no real effect due to the advanced nature of the tumor and its location. The prognosis is grim with a very short life expectancy. We are NOT giving up though and took John across the country to a clinic that does alternative therapies from around the world. It seems like a long-shot, but it's our only hope at this point. Please continue to keep John in your prayers, and thank you for your support!

Quick but sad update...hospice has now admitted John for home care. He has declined and is very weak, unable to walk, lethargic, and requires extensive care. He's still determined to keep fighting, so please keep praying for him and the kids. I know God is good, but it's difficult to understand and accept his will sometimes.

Jesus, the angels and all the saints welcomed John into paradise September 20, 2014. Although it's the hardest thing we've ever had to endure, we know God's grace and mercy will see us through.

story:
According to a report made by cdc.gov, more than 70 million Americans live with over 85 types of sleeping disorders. That means one in every four Americans toss and turn at night. It's easy to see that sleep machines are an important part of our everyday life because they can help us to...

 

 

Although small, Letsfit’s sleep sound machine is packed with up to 30 different soundtracks including 8 white noise sound effects, 8 fan sounds, and 14 music tracks making sure there are sounds for every occasion, with the ability to change between sounds depending on your mood, Letsfit makes sure there is a sound to suit everybody.

Letsfit’s new sleep sound machine comes with a built-in night-light making getting to sleep now even easier by changing the environment around you to become relaxing, and less stressful. It’s also perfect for times when you have to wake up late into the night and need that extra little bit of light but don’t want to disturb the environment around you. You can even use the ambient light function to change the color of the light.

Letsfit T3 is anti-slip, compact, and designed specifically to be non-intrusive in any home or office environment.

Letsfit have added 6 extra buttons to help you customize your sleep sound machine even easier. Now with 9 different customizable options, with a touch sensitive top and a 3.5mm jack that lets you plug in earphones should you not want to disturb others around you, our device is now even more user-friendly. It also comes with:

 

 

You can set the soundtrack to your sleep to turn off at a specific time, meaning you’ll have just enough time to sink off into a nice relaxing sleep, and won’t be woken up during the night by
unwanted sounds. Now with 5 different increments of time – 15/30/60/90 and 120 minutes.

Letsfit have included a built-in night-light to help you relax before sleeping, or to be used if
you suddenly wake up in the night and need that little bit of extra light to navigate your way
around without waking up the people around you or bumping into things in the night! (ouch!).
You can also adjust the light brightness and the color to suit the environment you are in.

You can also customize your music with EQ adjustment settings, now with up to 30 different
audio tracks (yes, 30!) that makes sure there will be a relaxing sound to suit everybody.

Here at Letsfit we have accomplished a lot since we started our journey in 2015. We care not just about fitness, but also the general health of all our customers on every level, and since becoming a number 1 best seller on Amazon in the fitness tracker category we decided that
fitness goes way beyond just this. Which is why the Letsfit product range now includes Resistance Bands, TWS Wireless Earphones, Weight Scales, Smart Watches and more.

 

Letsfit’s new T3 is an upgraded version of their popular amazon model, the T126L, a product that was built to help customers stay healthy, increase focus, and get adequate rest by helping them to get better sleep at home. This device can also be used as a tool to help to focus whilst studying, or even as a night-light in dark environments.

story:
What is Toledo Quidditch?

The Toledo Firebolts Club Quidditch Team represents The University of Toledo in intercollegiate competition. We were founded in the Summer of 2012, and played our fist match against our rivals BGSU. We have since then played in many matches and tournaments, including participating in the Midwest Regional Championship, hosting the Glass City Quidditch Classic, and World Cup VI. We have also participated in quidditch history, having hosted and played in the first ever televised quidditch match in the history of the sport. We have televised games against BGSU on two separate occasions, as well as, televising the semi-finals and the finals of the Glass City Quidditch Classic.

Our goal is to travel to and play in World Cup VII in Myrtle Beach, SC. The Toledo Firebolts qualified for World Cup VII at Midwest Regionals in October.

Every donation you contribute helps us out in the long run. We would be representing our school, our city and our state in South Carolina, and every donation counts!

Want to know more?

http://www.hometeamsonline.com/teams/?u=utquidditch&s=htosports&t=c
http://www.facebook.com/ToledoFireboltsQuidditch
http://www.internationalquidditch.org/


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is 500, but we will need more than that! We would like to get as much as we can so that we have to pay as little as possible out of pocket, this is going to be our biggest trip  of our teams career!

All of your donations will go to transportation and hotel prices. We are going to make sure that we are travelling as light and as cost efficient as possible, because we want to make every donation count! 

The perks are listed to the side for you to enjoy! GET THIS! The MORE you donate, the MORE stuff you get!


The Impact

Every donation helps each player to keep the cost as low as possible. 

Getting us to World Cup can help with future player recruitment! If we do well, it reflects well on our school, community, and it helps our program grow!


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE this page as much as possible! even if you can't donate right now it doesn't mean you can't help us to get to World Cup!

Every donation goes a long way! We really want to make this happen, and you can help us make it happen! Make this trip become a reality!
