story:
Turkish and Danish text below!

Türkçe kampanya metni aşağıda! / Dansk beskrivelse af kampagnen er længere nede!

_______________________________________________________________________

LINKS

Taksim´s `lady in pink´

Lobna in German Bild

Interview with Lobna´s sister (turkish)

_______________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH

Sing Lobna, sing ..

”From thoughts to words” – it´s not always easy!


Who?

Lobna Allamii is 34 years old, turkish-palestinian, born in Jordan, moved to Turkey at the age of 14 and then to Berlin at age 34, where she just started her new existence with new job, new house, new life.

She graduated as philosopher and took a master in ”human resource development in education” from Middle East Technical University (METU) in Ankara/Turkey, where she had spent almost 15 years of her life. She can speak Turkish, Arabic and English fluently and was just started to learn German.

The last 3 years Lobna had worked in the music business as manager, booker and agent. In connection to her jobs, she had travelled a lot in Europe and Middle East, and had also been in Brazil and Thailand.

3 words that will describe Lobna in some extent are joy, socialization and wisdom. Most of the time she has a smile on her lips and the southern temper is not lacking at all. She loves to travel, meet new people and never stands back when it comes to debating about any issue. As mentioned before she is a philosopher, so it´s not strange that Lobna has an opinion about everything.


What?

The 31 of May 2013 around 1.30 pm (local time in Turkey), Lobna got a gas canister on her head, that the police fired, as she was sitting and listening to a speech about Gezi Park at the Taksim square in Istanbul. It was not more than 5 days ago Lobna arrived to the city from her new home in Berlin. She was in Istanbul on vacation and to see her family and friends. Lobna was in the park the days up to May 31th for the sake of the trees and to be one of the many voices that wanted to save the park from demolition. Lobna had just brought good intentions with her when she attend the peaceful demonstrations, she just wanted to show her support to the city she lived in for 6 years and save one of the few green areas in the heart of the city. She got rewarded with a teargas bomb!

Lobna is now diagnosed with Conduction Aphasia Syndrome and has lost strength on the whole right part of her body, as the gas canister damaged the left brain hemisphere, that controls all the movements on the right part of our body.

She had two brain surgeries during the first two days. First one on the left hemisphere, as she got the gas canister on the left side of her head and second one on right brain hemisphere, as a so-called contrecoup effect caused a bleeding on right side. The doctors took out a part of her skull on the left side in the first surgery to relieve the pressure on the brain and now one more surgery is waiting her, where this part will be put on place. We still don´t know the date for this surgery, but the doctors are counting on that Lobna´s condition will reach a stabile point within the next 3 months, so the surgery can be done without any risk.


Short about conduction aphasia: This aphasia is a result of damages in the connections between our brains two speech centres – Wernicke, centre for speech comprehension and Brocca, centre for speech production. Practically it means for Lobna, that she understands what she hears, but has difficulties when it comes to express herself both orally and written. In Wernicke she is able to ”form the picture” of what she wants to say, but since there are damages on the connections the signals doesn´t reach Brocca efficiently and we therefore experiencing, that she is saying something else than what she actually intents to. It often gets a game of guessing even when she talks with her nearest. At the same time she is aware in the very moment she use words or sentences she actually don´t want to say and most of the time this awareness about lack of control makes her frustrated and she simply give up and don´t want to talk.

The doctors expect, that it´s going to take long time and a lot of retraining before she will get to a level, where she can communicate efficiently with others. For sure 1 year and it may be several years before she can reach her old level. It´s a slow process you actually don´t know where ends. She is going to practice her language and writing every day and transform other brain cells (neurons) to carry the task to connect Wernicke to Brocca, instead of the dead cells. When brain cells die, new cells will not be created, we just have the cells we got in birth, but other brain cells can be coded to take over the dead cells tasks with retraining.


Short about the weakening on right side: It´s by now general knowledge, that the right part of the brain is controlling the left part and the left part of the brain controls the right part of the body. Lobna got the canister on the left side of her head, with the result that the right part of her body was paralyzed when she was in intensive care unit. The doctors were afraid of chronical paralysation, but the last days in intensive care unit a bit of function appeared on her right leg. This sign of function was good news, as it could mean that she would eventually be able to move and use the right side of her body, even that to begin with there was just a little movement on her leg and none on her arm.

Today Lobna can walk without help from anybody, but her right arm is still weak. She can move her arm but do not even have strength enough to hold a pen. It gives her difficulties in her daily routine and a lot of frustrations, because even to get dressed or use a spoon, fork or a knife is a battle for her.

A long retraining to strengthen the right arm and the rest of her body is waiting Lobna, so she can be able to handle the daily tasks. The retraining will be in form of physiotherapy and strength training.


Why?

”From thoughts to words” – it´s not always easy!

It´s difficult for Lobna, more than we can imagine. The result of this aphasia is not just the fact, that she has difficulties when it comes to speaking, but at the same time a psychological wall, which she runs into every single day. It´s not easy for her to explain herself, most of the time impossible and this eats away her energy psychologically. It´s a struggle and doesn´t get easier with the weakness on her right side, that make it hard and sometime impossible to do basic daily things. We hope that this period will be shorter than excepted, but it seems like Lobna is going to undergo a long retraining in form of physiotherapy, psychotherapy and of course speech therapy. She won´t be able to work for sure the next year.

What Lobna needs beside a huge amount of patience and good mood is financial support, so she can handle life. She will have expenses for everything from rent, food and medicine to therapy expenses, transport and phone/internet. Until now she got support from her family and close friends, but now after 4 months of which the first one was in intensive care unit, the second in the bed unit of the hospital, where she got heavy medical treatment and the last two at her sisters home, where her family took care of her, she needs long term financial support for her treatment and retraining respectively in Istanbul and Berlin. She is going to be in Istanbul for a while, because the doctors who operated her twice previously will make the final surgery to put the skull back on place. After this the journey continues to her new home in Berlin, where the retraining will continue.


NB! Beside mentioned perks Lobna will write thank you messages on her facebook wall and twitter with names of everybody who supported the campaign!


_______________________________________________________________________

TÜRKÇE

Hadi Lobna, şarkı söyle ..

”Düşüncelerden kelimelere” – her zaman kolay değil!


Kim?

Lobna Allamii 34 yaşında, Ürdün doğumlu, Filistin kökenli Türk vatandaşı. 14 yaşında Türkiye ye yerleşti ve yine 6 ay önce Berlin de yeni bulduğu iş ve ev ile, yeni bir hayata başlamak için adım attı.

Yaklaşık 15 senesini geçirdiği Ankara´nın Orta Doğu Teknik Üniversitesinden (ODTÜ) felsefe mezunu ve yine aynı üniversitede yüksek lisansını ”eğitimde insan kaynaklarını geliştirme” üzerine yaptı. Yüksek seviyede Türkçe, Arapça ve İngilizce konuşan Lobna daha yeni Almanca öğrenmeye başlamıştı.

Lobna son 3 yıldır müzik piyasasında menajer, booker ve agent olarak çalışıyor. İş gereği Avrupa’nın ve Orta Doğunun bir çok ülkesine giden Lobna ayrıca Brezilya ve Tayland´a da bir süre bulundu.

Lobna eşittir hayat sevinci, sosyalleşme ve bilgi. Çoğu zaman tebessümle dolaşır ve güneyin mizacı ondan asla eksik olmaz. Gezmeyi, yeni insanlarla tanışmayı ve her kiminle ne hakkında olursa olsun hiçbir tartışmayı kaçırmayan Lobna daha önce de yazdığımız gibi filozofun ta kendisidir.


Ne oldu?

31 Mayıs 2013 Türkiye Saati 13.30 civarlarında, İstanbul Taksim meydanında Gezi Parkıyla ilgili bir konuşmayı dinlerken Lobna´nın başına polisin attığı gaz kapsülü isabet etti. Berlin den yeni gelmişti ve İstanbul’da henüz 5nci günüydü. Lobna tatil yapmak ve aile ve arkadaşlarını görmek için Türkiye ye gelmişti. Yaralandığı günün öncesinde Lobna ağaçlar için bir kaç kez parka gitmiş ve oradaki topluluğun içinde seslerden biri olup parkı yıkımdan kurtarmak istiyordu. Lobna sadece güzel ve iyi niyetlerle 31 Mayıs gününe kadar daha henüz 100-150 kişiyi geçmeyen bir topluluk içinde bulunup, barışçıl bir şekilde yürüyen gösterilere katıldı. Lobna´nın sağ duyusuyla katıldığı bu gösterilerde amacı 6 yıldır yaşadığı şehrin kalbindeki son yeşil alanlardan birini kurtarmaktı. Ödülü başına isabet eden bir gaz kapsülü oldu.

Gaz kapsülü Lobna´nın kafasının sol tarafına isabet ettiği için, sağ tarafında güç kaybı (felç) ve iletim afazisi sendromu teşhisi hastanede yattığı süre içinde kondu.

Hastanede yattığı ilk 2 günde 2 kez beyin ameliyatı geçirdi. İlk ameliyat, darbeyi sol tarafına aldığı için, beynin sol tarafına yapıldı ve ikinci ameliyat sol tarafa aldığı darbe den dolayı tıp dilinde “contrecoup” olarak bahsedilen efektten dolayı sağ tarafında oluşan kanamaya müdahale etmek amacı ile yapıldı. İlk ameliyatta kafatasının sol tarafından, beyin üzerindeki basıncı azaltmak için bir parça kemik alındı ve şimdi Lobna´yı bu parçanın yerine takılacağı bir ameliyat daha bekliyor. Henüz bu ameliyat için tarih verilmedi ama doktorlar Lobna´nın durumunun en fazla 3 ay içinde istenilen stabilizeye ulaşacağını öngörüp, bu süreci bekleyip ameliyatın risksiz bir şekilde yapılacağını söylüyorlar.


İletim afazi sendromu hakkında kısa bilgiler: Bu afazi (konuşma bozukluğu) beynin iki konuşma merkezi arasındaki bağlantıların zarar görmesiyle oluşan bir konuşma bozukluğudur – konuşma kavrayış merkezi veya bellek diye adlandırabileceğimiz “Wernicke” ve konuşma üretim merkezi diye adlandırabileceğimiz “Brocca” arasındaki kopukluktan dolayı görülen bir konuşma bozukluğudur. Bu afazi sendromu Lobna´nın günlük hayatını bir çok açıdan etkiliyor, zira duyduğunu anlıyor ama hem sözlü hem yazılı olarak kendini ifade etmeye çalışınca çok zorlanıyor. Wernicke merkezinde söylemek istediği şeyi aklına getirebiliyor ama bağlantılarda kopukluk olduğu için sinyalleri ulaştıramıyor, yani aklına getirdiği sözcükleri konuşma üretim (Brocca) merkezine ulaştıramadığı için asıl söylemek istediği şeylerin dışında, başka şeyler söylediğini görüyoruz. Diyaloglar en yakınlarıyla bile çoğu zaman tahmin oyununa dönüşüyor. Lobna kendi konuşma bozukluğunun ve ağızından çıkan kelimelerin aslında istediği kelimeler olmadığının gayet farkında ve bundan dolayı çoğu zaman susuyor, içine kapanıyor, konuşmamayı tercih ediyor, çünkü bu durum onun moralini bozup, çıkmaza sürüklüyor.

Doktorlar Lobna´nın başkalarıyla sorunsuz bir şekilde iletişim kurabilmesi için uzun sürecek bir iyileşme sürecinden geçeceğini öngörüyorlar. Bu sürecin 1 seneyi bulması çok olağan ve eski seviyesine kavuşması için seneler geçebilir. Açıkçası hangi sonuç doğuracağını bilmediğimiz uzun, yavaş ve sancılı bir süreç olacağı kesin. Her gün yapılan konuşma, okuma ve yazma egzersizleri ölen beyin hücrelerinin (nöronlar) yerine başka hücreleri Wernicke merkeziyle Brocca merkezi arasındaki bağları yeniden oluşturmak için kodlayacak ve Lobna yeniden eski haline kavuşacak. Beyin hücreleri ölünce yerine yenileri gelmiyor, doğumla gelen beyin hücreleri dışında beyinde yeni hücreler oluşmuyor, dolayısıyla tedavi, terapi ve egzersizlerle mevcut olan hücreler ölen hücrelerin yerini doldurmak ve görevlerini üstlenmek için kodlanırlar.


Sağ taraftaki güç kaybı hakkında kısa bilgiler: Beynimizin sağ tarafı vücudumuzun sol tarafını, beynimizin sol tarafı da vücudumuzun sağ tarafını kontrol ettiği artık bir çok kişi tarafından bilinen genel bir bilgi. Lobna sol tarafından darbe aldığı için vücudunun sağ tarafı yoğun bakım ünitesinde yatarken tamamen felçti. Doktorlar uzun süre bu felcin kalıcı olmasından endişe duydular ama yoğun bakımdaki sürenin sonlarına doğru Lobna´nın sağ bacağının hareket ettiği tespit edildi. Bu doktorlar tarafından pozitif bir gelişme olarak değerlendirildi ve bizlere en ufak fonksiyon belirtisinde bile fizik tedavi ile çok yol kat edilebileceğini söylediler – çok ama hakikaten çok sevindik.

Lobna bugün kendi başına yürüyor ama sağ kolunu hareket ettirmesine rağmen çok güçsüz, kalem tutmakta bile zorlanıyor. Günlük hayatında bu durum onu çok zorluyor ve bir o kadar da üzüyor, çünkü kıyafet giyip çıkarmak yada kaşık, çatal veya bıçak kullanmak gibi düşünmeden yaptığımız temel günlük hareketler onun için neredeyse imkânsız hale geliyor.

Lobna´yı, vücudunun sağ tarafını güçlendirip günlük hayatındaki temel hareketleri yapabilmesi için zor ve uzun bir iyileşme süreci bekliyor. İyileşme sürecinde Lobna´ya yoğun bir şekilde fizik tedavi uygulanacak ve daha ilerde kuvvet çalışmalarına da başlayacak.


Neden?

”Düşüncelerden kelimelere” – her zaman kolay değil!

Lobna´nın durumu görünenden ve sandığımızdan daha da zor. Bu afazinin sonucu sadece konuşma bozukluğu değil, aynı zamanda her gün yine ve yine içine düştüğü psikolojik bir çıkmaz. Kendisini ifade etmekte çok zorlanıyor, çoğu zaman imkânsız bir hal alıyor ve bunun sonucunda psikolojik olarak çok sarsılıyor. Lobna için hâlihazırda çok zor bir savaş ve sağ tarafındaki güç kaybı, günlük temel ihtiyaçlarını karşılamasında zor anlar yaşatarak bu durumu daha da ağırlaştırıyor. Lobna ve yakınları bu zorlu sürecin mümkün olduğunca kısa olmasını ümit ediyor ama öyle görünüyor ki Lobna uzun süre fizik-, psiko-, ve konuşma terapisi görecek, dolayısıyla önümüzdeki 1 sene boyunca çalışamayacak.

Sabır ve moral dışında Lobna´nın şu an ve ilerisi için ihtiyacı olan şey maddi destek. Günlük yaşamsal ihtiyaçlar ve ilaç giderlerinden başlayarak terapi, tedavi, üçüncü ameliyat masrafları, ulaşım ve telefon/internet gibi giderleri karşılaması için desteğe ihtiyacı var. Lobna şu ana kadar ailesinin ve yakın arkadaşlarının yardımıyla geçindi. Olayın üzerinden 4 ay geçti, bunun ilk ayı yoğun bakım ünitesinde, ikinci ayı ağır ilaç tedavisi gördüğü hastanenin servis bölümünde ve son aylarda ise ailesi tarafından bakımı sağlanan Lobna´nin bundan sonra çalışamayacağı öngörülen uzun bir süreçte ve İstanbul ile Berlin arası tedavilerini sürdürebilmesi için maddi desteğe ihtiyacı var. Lobna bir süre daha Türkiye’de kalacak, çünkü kafatası kemiğinin takılacağı ameliyatı İstanbul’da ilk iki ameliyatı yapan doktorlar yapacaklar. Bu ameliyattan sonra ise en gelişmiş fizik tedavi ve konuşma terapi uygulamaların bulunduğu Almanya´ya gidip tedavilerini sürdürmeyi planlamaktadır.


NB! Belirtilen perks ler (katkı ödülleri) dışında Lobna facebook duvarına ve twitter a bu kampanya ya destek olan herkesin adının geçtiği teşekkür mesajları yazacak!


_______________________________________________________________________

DANSK

Syng Lobna, syng ..

”Fra tanker til ord” – det er ikke altid lige nemt!


Hvem?

Lobna Allamii er 34 år, tyrkisk-palæstinenser, født i Jordan, flyttede til Tyrkiet som 14-årig og videre til Berlin som 34-årig, hvor hun lige var begyndt hendes nye tilværelse med nyt job, ny bolig, nyt liv.

Hun er uddannet filosof med kandidat i ”human ressource development in education” fra Middle East Technical University (METU) i Ankara/Tyrkiet, hvor hun også har tilbragt næsten 15 år af hendes liv. Hun kan flydende tyrkisk, arabisk og engelsk og var lige begyndt med at lære tysk.

De sidste 3 år har Lobna arbejdet i musikbranchen, som manager, booker og agent. Ifm. hendes jobs har hun rejst meget i Europa og i Mellemøsten, og har også været i Brasilien og Thailand.

Lobna er lig med livsglæde, socialisering og visdom. Hun har for det meste et smil på læben og det sydlige temperament mangler ikke. Hun elsker at rejse, møde nye mennesker og står aldrig tilbage når det gælder om at debattere omkring et hvilket som helst emne. Som før nævnt er hun filosof, så det er ikke mærkeligt, at Lobna har en mening om alt og alle.


Hvad?

D. 31. Maj 2013 omkring klokken 13.30 (tyrkisk tid), fik Lobna en tåregasbombe i hovedet, som politiet affyrede, da hun sad og lyttede til en tale der omhandlede Gezi Parken på Taksim torvet i Istanbul. Det var ikke mere end 5 dage siden hun kom til byen fra hendes nye hjem i Berlin. Hun var i Istanbul på ferie og for at se hendes venner og familie. Dagene op til var Lobna i parken for træernes skyld og for at være én blandt de mange stemmer der ville redde parken fra nedrivning. Lobna bragte kun gode intentioner med sig, da hun deltog i de fredelige demonstrationer, hun ville blot vise sin støtte til den by hun havde boet i de sidste 6 år og redde én af de få grønne arealer i byens hjerte. Hun blev belønnet med en tåregasbombe!

Det er konstateret, at Lobna har konduktion afasi syndromet og er svækket i hele hendes højre side, da tåregasbomben har skadet hendes venstre hjernehalvdel, som netop styrer alle vores bevægelser på højre side.

Hun blev opereret 2 gange i løbet af de første 2 dage. Første gang i venstre hjernehalvdel, da tåregasbomben ramte hende på venstre side og anden gang i højre hjernehalvdel, da en såkaldt contrecoup effekt forårsagede en blødning i højre side. Et stykke af hendes kranie på venstre side blev taget ud ved første operation for at lette trykket på hjernen og der venter hende nu en operation mere, hvor dette stykke skal sættes på plads. Der er endnu ikke sat dato på operationen, men lægerne regner med at Lobnas tilstand når den forventede stabilitet i løbet af de næste 3 måneder, så operationen kan udføres uden nogen risiko.


Kort om konduktion afasi syndromet: Denne afasi opstår ved at man får skadet forbindelserne/ledningerne mellem hjernens to talecentre – Wernicke, som er centret for taleforståelse og Brocca, som er centret for taleproduktion. Rent praktisk betyder det for Lobna, at hun forstår hvad hun hører, men har store vanskeligheder når hun selv skal udtrykke sig både mundtligt og skriftligt. I Wernicke centret kan hun godt ”danne billedet” af det hun vil sige, men da der er skader på forbindelserne når disse signaler ikke centret for taleproduktion (Brocca) og vi oplever derfor, at hun siger noget andet end hvad der er hendes intention. Det bliver tit en gætteleg, selv når hun snakker med hendes nærmeste. På samme tid er hun godt klar over, at det der kommer ud af hendes mund ikke er det hun ville sige og denne bevidsthed gør tit, at hun helt opgiver at tale, da hun let bliver frustreret over, at hun ikke kan sige de ting hun har i tankerne.

Lægerne forventer, at det kommer til at tage lang tid og meget genoptræning før hun når et niveau, hvor hun kan kommunikere med andre uden problemer. I hvert fald 1 år og der kan gå flere år, før hun når sit gamle niveau. Det er et langsommeligt proces man egentlig ikke ved hvor ender. Hun skal træne sit sprog og skrift hver dag og på den måde omdanne andre hjerneceller (neuroner) til at varetage opgaven om at forbinde Wernicke centret til Brocca centret, i stedet for de døde celler. Når hjerneceller dør, kommer der ikke nye til, vi har kun dem vi har fået ved fødslen, men andre hjerneceller kan blive kodet til at overtage de døde cellers opgaver med genoptræning.


Kort om svækkelsen på højre side: Det er efterhånden almen viden, at højre side af hjernen styrer venstre side af kroppen og venstre side af hjernen styrer højre side af kroppen. Lobna blev ramt på venstre side, hvilket har resulteret i, at hele højre side af kroppen var lammet da hun var på intensiv afdeling. Lægerne var bange for, at hun ville forblive lam, men den sidste tid på intensiv afdeling begyndte der at vise sig en smule funktion på højre ben. Vi fik at vide, at det var en positiv udvikling, da det kunne betyde, at hun efterhånden ville kunne bevæge højre side af kroppen, selvom der til at begynde med ikke var liv i hendes arm og kun lidt på benet.

I dag er Lobna på benene og kan gå uden andres hjælp, dog er hendes højre arm fortsat meget svækket. Hun kan bevæge den, men har ikke engang styrke nok til at holde en blyant. Det giver hende store vanskeligheder i hverdagen og frustrationerne følger med, da selv det at tage tøjet af og på eller bruge en ske, gaffel eller kniv er en kamp for hende.

Der venter Lobna en hård og lang genoptræning ift. at få styrket hendes arm og resten af kroppen, så hun kan klare de daglige opgaver. Genoptræningen bliver i form af fysioterapi og styrketræning.


Hvorfor?

”Fra tanker til ord” – det er ikke altid lige nemt!

Lobna har det sværere end vi kan forestille os. Resultatet af denne afasi er ikke kun det faktum, at hun har talebesvær, men det er samtidig en psykisk mur, som hun støder ind i hver evig eneste dag. Det er ikke nemt for hende at formulere sig korrekt, for det meste helt umuligt og dette tærer på hendes kræfter rent psykisk. Det er en hård kamp og det bliver ikke nemmere af, at hendes svækkelse på højre side gøre det svært, nogen gange forhindrer hende i at udføre mange basale ting i dagligdagen. Vi håber denne tid bliver kortere end forventet, men det ser ud til, at der venter Lobna en længere genoptræningen i form af fysioterapi, psykoterapi og ikke mindst taleterapi. Hun vil ikke være i stand til at arbejde det næste års tid.

Hvad Lobna har brug for udover en pæn portion tålmodighed og godt humør er økonomisk støtte, så hun kan klare tilværelsen. Hun kommer til at have udgifter til alt lige fra leje, mad og medicin, til terapi omkostninger, transport og telefon/internet. Indtil videre har hun klaret sig med familiens og hendes nære venners hjælp, men nu efter 4 måneder hvoraf den første var på intensiv afdeling, den anden i hospitalets sengeafdeling, hvor hun fik tung medicinsk behandling og de sidste to hjemme hos hendes søster, hvor hendes familie tog sig af hende, er der nu brug for en længerevarende finansiel støtte til resten af hendes behandling og genoptræning i henholdsvis Istanbul og Berlin. Hun kommer til at være i Istanbul det næste stykke tid, da operationen, hvor kraniet skal sættes på plads, skal laves af de samme læger der opererede hende de to første gange. Derefter går turen videre til hendes nye hjem i Berlin, hvor hendes genoptræning skal fortsætte.


NB! Udover de nævnte perks (belønninger for bidrag) vil Lobna skrive takke beskeder på hendes væg i facebook og twitter med navne på alle dem som har bidraget til denne kampagne!
story_txt:
Turkish and Danish text below!
Türkçe kampanya metni aşağıda! / Dansk beskrivelse af kampagnen er længere nede!
_______________________________________________________________________
LINKS
Taksim´s `lady in pink´
Lobna in German Bild
Interview with Lobna´s sister (turkish)
_______________________________________________________________________
ENGLISH
Sing Lobna, sing ..
”From
thoughts to words” – it´s not always easy!

Who?
Lobna Allamii is 34 years old, turkish-palestinian, born
in Jordan, moved to Turkey at the age of 14 and then to Berlin at age 34, where
she just started her new existence with new job, new house, new life.
She graduated as philosopher and took a master in
”human resource development in education” from Middle East Technical University
(METU) in Ankara/Turkey, where she had spent almost 15 years of her life. She
can speak Turkish, Arabic and English fluently and was just started to learn German.
The last 3 years Lobna had worked in the music business
as manager, booker and agent. In connection to her jobs, she had travelled a
lot in Europe and Middle East, and had also been in Brazil and Thailand.
3 words that will describe Lobna in some extent are
joy, socialization and wisdom. Most of the time she has a smile on her lips and
the southern temper is not lacking at all. She loves to travel, meet new people
and never stands back when it comes to debating about any issue. As mentioned
before she is a philosopher, so it´s not strange that Lobna has an opinion
about everything.

What?
The 31 of May 2013 around 1.30 pm (local time in
Turkey), Lobna got a gas canister on her head, that the police fired, as she
was sitting and listening to a speech about Gezi Park at the Taksim square in
Istanbul. It was not more than 5 days ago Lobna arrived to the city from her
new home in Berlin. She was in Istanbul on vacation and to see her family and
friends. Lobna was in the park the days up to May 31th for the sake of the
trees and to be one of the many voices that wanted to save the park from
demolition. Lobna had just brought good intentions with her when she attend the
peaceful demonstrations, she just wanted to show her support to the city she
lived in for 6 years and save one of the few green areas in the heart of the
city. She got rewarded with a teargas bomb!
Lobna is now diagnosed with Conduction Aphasia
Syndrome and has lost strength on the whole right part of her body, as the gas canister
damaged the left brain hemisphere, that controls all the movements on the right
part of our body.
She had two brain surgeries during the first two days.
First one on the left hemisphere, as she got the gas canister on the left side
of her head and second one on right brain hemisphere, as a so-called contrecoup
effect caused a bleeding on right side. The doctors took out a part of her
skull on the left side in the first surgery to relieve the pressure on the
brain and now one more surgery is waiting her, where this part will be put on
place. We still don´t know the date for this surgery, but the doctors are
counting on that Lobna´s condition will reach a stabile point within the next 3
months, so the surgery can be done without any risk.

Short about conduction aphasia: This
aphasia is a result of damages in the connections between our brains two speech
centres – Wernicke, centre for speech comprehension and Brocca, centre for
speech production. Practically it means for Lobna, that she understands what
she hears, but has difficulties when it comes to express herself both orally
and written. In Wernicke she is able to ”form the picture” of what she wants to
say, but since there are damages on the connections the signals doesn´t reach
Brocca efficiently and we therefore experiencing, that she is saying something
else than what she actually intents to. It often gets a game of guessing even
when she talks with her nearest. At the same time she is aware in the very
moment she use words or sentences she actually don´t want to say and most of
the time this awareness about lack of control makes her frustrated and she simply
give up and don´t want to talk.
The doctors expect, that it´s going
to take long time and a lot of retraining before she will get to a level, where
she can communicate efficiently with others. For sure 1 year and it may be several
years before she can reach her old level. It´s a slow process you actually don´t
know where ends. She is going to practice her language and writing every day
and transform other brain cells (neurons) to carry the task to connect Wernicke
to Brocca, instead of the dead cells. When brain cells die, new cells will not be
created, we just have the cells we got in birth, but other brain cells can be coded
to take over the dead cells tasks with retraining.

Short about the weakening on right side: It´s
by now general knowledge, that the right part of the brain is controlling the
left part and the left part of the brain controls the right part of the body.
Lobna got the canister on the left side of her head, with the result that the
right part of her body was paralyzed when she was in intensive care unit. The
doctors were afraid of chronical paralysation, but the last days in intensive
care unit a bit of function appeared on her right leg. This sign of function
was good news, as it could mean that she would eventually be able to move and
use the right side of her body, even that to begin with there was just a little
movement on her leg and none on her arm.
Today Lobna can walk without
help from anybody, but her right arm is still weak. She can move her arm but do
not even have strength enough to hold a pen. It gives her difficulties in her
daily routine and a lot of frustrations, because even to get dressed or use a
spoon, fork or a knife is a battle for her.
A long retraining to strengthen
the right arm and the rest of her body is waiting Lobna, so she can be able to
handle the daily tasks. The retraining will be in form of physiotherapy and strength
training.

Why?
”From thoughts to words” – it´s not always easy!
It´s difficult for Lobna, more than we can imagine. The
result of this aphasia is not just the fact, that she has difficulties when it
comes to speaking, but at the same time a psychological wall, which she runs
into every single day. It´s not easy for her to explain herself, most of the
time impossible and this eats away her energy psychologically. It´s a struggle
and doesn´t get easier with the weakness on her right side, that make it hard
and sometime impossible to do basic daily things. We hope that this period will
be shorter than excepted, but it seems like Lobna is going to undergo a long
retraining in form of physiotherapy, psychotherapy and of course speech
therapy. She won´t be able to work for sure the next year.
What Lobna needs beside a huge amount of patience and
good mood is financial support, so she can handle life. She will have expenses
for everything from rent, food and medicine to therapy expenses, transport and phone/internet.
Until now she got support from her family and close friends, but now after 4 months of which the first one was in intensive care unit, the second in the bed
unit of the hospital, where she got heavy medical treatment and the last two at
her sisters home, where her family took care of her, she needs long term financial
support for her treatment and retraining respectively in Istanbul and Berlin. She
is going to be in Istanbul for a while, because the doctors who operated her
twice previously will make the final surgery to put the skull back on place. After
this the journey continues to her new home in Berlin, where the retraining will
continue.



NB! Beside mentioned perks Lobna will write thank you messages
on her facebook wall and twitter with names of everybody who supported the campaign!


_______________________________________________________________________
TÜRKÇE


Hadi Lobna, şarkı söyle ..
”Düşüncelerden
kelimelere” – her zaman kolay değil!

Kim?
Lobna Allamii 34 yaşında, Ürdün doğumlu, Filistin kökenli
Türk vatandaşı. 14 yaşında Türkiye ye yerleşti ve yine 6 ay önce Berlin de yeni
bulduğu iş ve ev ile, yeni bir hayata başlamak için adım attı.
Yaklaşık 15 senesini geçirdiği Ankara´nın Orta Doğu
Teknik Üniversitesinden (ODTÜ) felsefe mezunu ve yine aynı üniversitede yüksek lisansını
”eğitimde insan kaynaklarını geliştirme” üzerine yaptı. Yüksek seviyede Türkçe,
Arapça ve İngilizce konuşan Lobna daha yeni Almanca öğrenmeye başlamıştı.
Lobna son 3 yıldır müzik piyasasında menajer, booker ve
agent olarak çalışıyor. İş gereği Avrupa’nın ve Orta Doğunun bir çok ülkesine
giden Lobna ayrıca Brezilya ve Tayland´a da bir süre bulundu.
Lobna eşittir hayat sevinci, sosyalleşme ve bilgi. Çoğu
zaman tebessümle dolaşır ve güneyin mizacı ondan asla eksik olmaz. Gezmeyi,
yeni insanlarla tanışmayı ve her kiminle ne hakkında olursa olsun hiçbir tartışmayı
kaçırmayan Lobna daha önce de yazdığımız gibi filozofun ta kendisidir.

Ne oldu?
31 Mayıs 2013 Türkiye Saati 13.30 civarlarında, İstanbul
Taksim meydanında Gezi Parkıyla ilgili bir konuşmayı dinlerken Lobna´nın başına
polisin attığı gaz kapsülü isabet etti. Berlin den yeni gelmişti ve İstanbul’da
henüz 5nci günüydü. Lobna tatil yapmak ve aile ve arkadaşlarını görmek için
Türkiye ye gelmişti. Yaralandığı günün öncesinde Lobna ağaçlar için bir kaç kez
parka gitmiş ve oradaki topluluğun içinde seslerden biri olup parkı yıkımdan
kurtarmak istiyordu. Lobna sadece güzel ve iyi niyetlerle 31 Mayıs gününe kadar
daha henüz 100-150 kişiyi geçmeyen bir topluluk içinde bulunup, barışçıl bir şekilde
yürüyen gösterilere katıldı. Lobna´nın sağ duyusuyla katıldığı bu gösterilerde amacı
6 yıldır yaşadığı şehrin kalbindeki son yeşil alanlardan birini kurtarmaktı.
Ödülü başına isabet eden bir gaz kapsülü oldu.
Gaz kapsülü Lobna´nın kafasının sol tarafına isabet ettiği için, sağ
tarafında güç kaybı (felç) ve iletim afazisi sendromu teşhisi hastanede yattığı
süre içinde kondu.
Hastanede yattığı ilk 2 günde 2 kez beyin ameliyatı geçirdi.
İlk ameliyat, darbeyi sol tarafına aldığı için, beynin sol tarafına yapıldı ve
ikinci ameliyat sol tarafa aldığı darbe den dolayı tıp dilinde “contrecoup”
olarak bahsedilen efektten dolayı sağ tarafında oluşan kanamaya müdahale etmek
amacı ile yapıldı. İlk ameliyatta kafatasının sol tarafından, beyin üzerindeki basıncı
azaltmak için bir parça kemik alındı ve şimdi Lobna´yı bu parçanın yerine takılacağı
bir ameliyat daha bekliyor. Henüz bu ameliyat için tarih verilmedi ama
doktorlar Lobna´nın durumunun en fazla 3 ay içinde istenilen stabilizeye ulaşacağını
öngörüp, bu süreci bekleyip ameliyatın risksiz bir şekilde yapılacağını
söylüyorlar.

İletim
afazi sendromu hakkında kısa bilgiler: Bu afazi (konuşma
bozukluğu) beynin iki konuşma merkezi arasındaki bağlantıların zarar görmesiyle
oluşan bir konuşma bozukluğudur – konuşma kavrayış merkezi veya bellek diye adlandırabileceğimiz
“Wernicke” ve konuşma üretim merkezi diye adlandırabileceğimiz “Brocca” arasındaki
kopukluktan dolayı görülen bir konuşma bozukluğudur. Bu afazi sendromu Lobna´nın
günlük hayatını bir çok açıdan etkiliyor, zira duyduğunu anlıyor ama hem sözlü
hem yazılı olarak kendini ifade etmeye çalışınca çok zorlanıyor. Wernicke merkezinde
söylemek istediği şeyi aklına getirebiliyor ama bağlantılarda kopukluk olduğu
için sinyalleri ulaştıramıyor, yani aklına getirdiği sözcükleri konuşma üretim
(Brocca) merkezine ulaştıramadığı için asıl söylemek istediği şeylerin dışında,
başka şeyler söylediğini görüyoruz. Diyaloglar en yakınlarıyla bile çoğu zaman
tahmin oyununa dönüşüyor. Lobna kendi konuşma bozukluğunun ve ağızından çıkan
kelimelerin aslında istediği kelimeler olmadığının gayet farkında ve bundan dolayı
çoğu zaman susuyor, içine kapanıyor, konuşmamayı tercih ediyor, çünkü bu durum
onun moralini bozup, çıkmaza sürüklüyor.
Doktorlar Lobna´nın başkalarıyla
sorunsuz bir şekilde iletişim kurabilmesi için uzun sürecek bir iyileşme
sürecinden geçeceğini öngörüyorlar. Bu sürecin 1 seneyi bulması çok olağan ve
eski seviyesine kavuşması için seneler geçebilir. Açıkçası hangi sonuç doğuracağını
bilmediğimiz uzun, yavaş ve sancılı bir süreç olacağı kesin. Her gün yapılan konuşma, okuma ve yazma
egzersizleri ölen beyin hücrelerinin (nöronlar) yerine başka hücreleri Wernicke
merkeziyle Brocca merkezi arasındaki bağları yeniden oluşturmak için kodlayacak
ve Lobna yeniden eski haline kavuşacak. Beyin hücreleri ölünce
yerine yenileri gelmiyor, doğumla gelen beyin hücreleri dışında beyinde yeni
hücreler oluşmuyor, dolayısıyla tedavi, terapi ve egzersizlerle mevcut olan
hücreler ölen hücrelerin yerini doldurmak ve görevlerini üstlenmek için kodlanırlar.

Sağ
taraftaki güç kaybı hakkında kısa bilgiler: Beynimizin
sağ tarafı vücudumuzun sol tarafını, beynimizin sol tarafı da vücudumuzun sağ tarafını
kontrol ettiği artık bir çok kişi tarafından bilinen genel bir bilgi. Lobna sol
tarafından darbe aldığı için vücudunun sağ tarafı yoğun bakım ünitesinde
yatarken tamamen felçti. Doktorlar uzun süre bu felcin kalıcı olmasından endişe
duydular ama yoğun bakımdaki sürenin sonlarına doğru Lobna´nın sağ bacağının
hareket ettiği tespit edildi. Bu doktorlar tarafından pozitif bir gelişme
olarak değerlendirildi ve bizlere en ufak fonksiyon belirtisinde bile fizik
tedavi ile çok yol kat edilebileceğini söylediler – çok ama hakikaten çok
sevindik.
Lobna bugün kendi başına yürüyor
ama sağ kolunu hareket ettirmesine rağmen çok güçsüz, kalem tutmakta bile zorlanıyor.
Günlük hayatında bu durum onu çok zorluyor ve bir o kadar da üzüyor, çünkü kıyafet
giyip çıkarmak yada kaşık, çatal veya bıçak kullanmak gibi düşünmeden yaptığımız
temel günlük hareketler onun için neredeyse imkânsız hale geliyor.
Lobna´yı, vücudunun sağ tarafını güçlendirip
günlük hayatındaki temel hareketleri yapabilmesi için zor ve uzun bir iyileşme süreci
bekliyor. İyileşme sürecinde Lobna´ya yoğun bir şekilde fizik tedavi uygulanacak
ve daha ilerde kuvvet çalışmalarına da başlayacak.

Neden?
”Düşüncelerden kelimelere” – her zaman kolay değil!
Lobna´nın durumu görünenden ve sandığımızdan daha da zor.
Bu afazinin sonucu sadece konuşma bozukluğu değil, aynı zamanda her gün yine ve
yine içine düştüğü psikolojik bir çıkmaz. Kendisini ifade etmekte çok zorlanıyor,
çoğu zaman imkânsız bir hal alıyor ve bunun sonucunda psikolojik olarak çok sarsılıyor.
Lobna için hâlihazırda çok zor bir savaş ve sağ tarafındaki güç kaybı, günlük
temel ihtiyaçlarını karşılamasında zor anlar yaşatarak bu durumu daha da ağırlaştırıyor.
Lobna ve yakınları bu zorlu sürecin mümkün olduğunca kısa olmasını ümit ediyor
ama öyle görünüyor ki Lobna uzun süre fizik-, psiko-, ve konuşma terapisi
görecek, dolayısıyla önümüzdeki 1 sene boyunca çalışamayacak.

Sabır ve moral dışında Lobna´nın şu an ve ilerisi için
ihtiyacı olan şey maddi destek. Günlük yaşamsal ihtiyaçlar ve ilaç giderlerinden
başlayarak terapi, tedavi, üçüncü ameliyat masrafları, ulaşım ve telefon/internet gibi giderleri karşılaması için
desteğe ihtiyacı var. Lobna şu ana kadar ailesinin ve yakın arkadaşlarının yardımıyla
geçindi. Olayın üzerinden 4 ay geçti, bunun ilk ayı yoğun bakım ünitesinde,
ikinci ayı ağır ilaç tedavisi gördüğü hastanenin servis bölümünde ve son aylarda ise ailesi tarafından bakımı sağlanan Lobna´nin bundan sonra
çalışamayacağı öngörülen uzun bir süreçte ve İstanbul ile Berlin arası
tedavilerini sürdürebilmesi için maddi desteğe ihtiyacı var. Lobna bir süre daha Türkiye’de kalacak, çünkü kafatası
kemiğinin takılacağı ameliyatı İstanbul’da ilk iki ameliyatı yapan doktorlar
yapacaklar. Bu ameliyattan sonra ise en gelişmiş fizik tedavi ve
konuşma terapi uygulamaların bulunduğu Almanya´ya gidip tedavilerini sürdürmeyi
planlamaktadır.



NB! Belirtilen perks ler (katkı ödülleri) dışında Lobna facebook duvarına ve twitter a bu
kampanya ya destek olan herkesin adının geçtiği teşekkür mesajları yazacak!


_______________________________________________________________________
DANSK


Syng Lobna, syng ..
”Fra tanker til ord” – det er ikke altid
lige nemt!

Hvem?
Lobna
Allamii er 34 år, tyrkisk-palæstinenser, født i Jordan, flyttede til Tyrkiet
som 14-årig og videre til Berlin som 34-årig, hvor hun lige var begyndt hendes
nye tilværelse med nyt job, ny bolig, nyt liv.
Hun
er uddannet filosof med kandidat i ”human ressource development in education”
fra Middle East Technical University (METU) i Ankara/Tyrkiet, hvor hun også har
tilbragt næsten 15 år af hendes liv. Hun kan flydende tyrkisk, arabisk og
engelsk og var lige begyndt med at lære tysk.
De
sidste 3 år har Lobna arbejdet i musikbranchen, som manager, booker og agent.
Ifm. hendes jobs har hun rejst meget i Europa og i Mellemøsten, og har også
været i Brasilien og Thailand.
Lobna
er lig med livsglæde, socialisering og visdom. Hun har for det meste et smil på
læben og det sydlige temperament mangler ikke. Hun elsker at rejse, møde nye
mennesker og står aldrig tilbage når det gælder om at debattere omkring et
hvilket som helst emne. Som før nævnt er hun filosof, så det er ikke mærkeligt,
at Lobna har en mening om alt og alle.

Hvad?
D.
31. Maj 2013 omkring klokken 13.30 (tyrkisk tid), fik Lobna en tåregasbombe i
hovedet, som politiet affyrede, da hun sad og lyttede til en tale der omhandlede
Gezi Parken på Taksim torvet i Istanbul. Det var ikke mere end 5 dage siden hun
kom til byen fra hendes nye hjem i Berlin. Hun var i Istanbul på ferie og for
at se hendes venner og familie. Dagene op til var Lobna i parken for træernes
skyld og for at være én blandt de mange stemmer der ville redde parken fra
nedrivning. Lobna bragte kun gode intentioner med sig, da hun deltog i de
fredelige demonstrationer, hun ville blot vise sin støtte til den by hun havde
boet i de sidste 6 år og redde én af de få grønne arealer i byens hjerte. Hun
blev belønnet med en tåregasbombe!
Det
er konstateret, at Lobna har konduktion afasi syndromet og er svækket i hele
hendes højre side, da tåregasbomben har skadet hendes venstre hjernehalvdel,
som netop styrer alle vores bevægelser på højre side.
Hun
blev opereret 2 gange i løbet af de første 2 dage. Første gang i venstre
hjernehalvdel, da tåregasbomben ramte hende på venstre side og anden gang i
højre hjernehalvdel, da en såkaldt contrecoup effekt forårsagede en blødning i
højre side. Et stykke af hendes kranie på venstre side blev taget ud ved første
operation for at lette trykket på hjernen og der venter hende nu en operation
mere, hvor dette stykke skal sættes på plads. Der er endnu ikke sat dato på
operationen, men lægerne regner med at Lobnas tilstand når den forventede
stabilitet i løbet af de næste 3 måneder, så operationen kan udføres uden nogen
risiko.

Kort om konduktion afasi
syndromet:
Denne afasi opstår ved at man får skadet forbindelserne/ledningerne mellem hjernens
to talecentre – Wernicke, som er centret for taleforståelse og Brocca, som er centret
for taleproduktion. Rent praktisk betyder det for Lobna, at hun forstår hvad hun
hører, men har store vanskeligheder når hun selv skal udtrykke sig både
mundtligt og skriftligt. I Wernicke centret kan hun godt ”danne billedet” af
det hun vil sige, men da der er skader på forbindelserne når disse signaler
ikke centret for taleproduktion (Brocca) og vi oplever derfor, at hun siger noget
andet end hvad der er hendes intention. Det bliver tit en gætteleg, selv når
hun snakker med hendes nærmeste. På samme tid er hun godt klar over, at det der
kommer ud af hendes mund ikke er det hun ville sige og denne bevidsthed gør
tit, at hun helt opgiver at tale, da hun let bliver frustreret over, at hun
ikke kan sige de ting hun har i tankerne. 
Lægerne forventer, at det kommer til at tage lang tid og
meget genoptræning før hun når et niveau, hvor hun kan kommunikere med andre
uden problemer. I hvert fald 1 år og der kan gå flere år, før hun når sit gamle
niveau. Det er et langsommeligt proces man egentlig ikke ved hvor ender. Hun
skal træne sit sprog og skrift hver dag og på den måde omdanne andre hjerneceller
(neuroner) til at varetage opgaven om at forbinde Wernicke centret til Brocca
centret, i stedet for de døde celler. Når hjerneceller dør, kommer der ikke nye
til, vi har kun dem vi har fået ved fødslen, men andre hjerneceller kan blive
kodet til at overtage de døde cellers opgaver med genoptræning.

Kort om svækkelsen på
højre side:
Det er efterhånden almen viden, at højre side af hjernen styrer venstre side af
kroppen og venstre side af hjernen styrer højre side af kroppen. Lobna blev
ramt på venstre side, hvilket har resulteret i, at hele højre side af kroppen
var lammet da hun var på intensiv afdeling. Lægerne var bange for, at hun ville
forblive lam, men den sidste tid på intensiv afdeling begyndte der at vise sig
en smule funktion på højre ben. Vi fik at vide, at det var en positiv udvikling,
da det kunne betyde, at hun efterhånden ville kunne bevæge højre side af
kroppen, selvom der til at begynde med ikke var liv i hendes arm og kun lidt på
benet.
I dag er Lobna på benene og kan gå uden andres hjælp,
dog er hendes højre arm fortsat meget svækket. Hun kan bevæge den, men har ikke
engang styrke nok til at holde en blyant. Det giver hende store vanskeligheder i
hverdagen og frustrationerne følger med, da selv det at tage tøjet af og på
eller bruge en ske, gaffel eller kniv er en kamp for hende.
Der venter Lobna en hård og lang genoptræning ift. at få
styrket hendes arm og resten af kroppen, så hun kan klare de daglige opgaver. Genoptræningen
bliver i form af fysioterapi og styrketræning. 

Hvorfor?
”Fra
tanker til ord” – det er ikke altid lige nemt!
Lobna
har det sværere end vi kan forestille os. Resultatet af denne afasi er ikke kun
det faktum, at hun har talebesvær, men det er samtidig en psykisk mur, som hun
støder ind i hver evig eneste dag. Det er ikke nemt for hende at formulere sig
korrekt, for det meste helt umuligt og dette tærer på hendes kræfter rent
psykisk. Det er en hård kamp og det bliver ikke nemmere af, at hendes svækkelse
på højre side gøre det svært, nogen gange forhindrer hende i at udføre mange
basale ting i dagligdagen. Vi håber denne tid bliver kortere end forventet, men
det ser ud til, at der venter Lobna en længere genoptræningen i form af
fysioterapi, psykoterapi og ikke mindst taleterapi. Hun vil ikke være i stand
til at arbejde det næste års tid.
Hvad
Lobna har brug for udover en pæn portion tålmodighed og godt humør er økonomisk
støtte, så hun kan klare tilværelsen. Hun kommer til at have udgifter til alt
lige fra leje, mad og medicin, til terapi omkostninger, transport og
telefon/internet. Indtil videre har hun klaret sig med familiens og hendes nære
venners hjælp, men nu efter 4 måneder hvoraf den første var på intensiv
afdeling, den anden i hospitalets sengeafdeling, hvor hun fik tung medicinsk
behandling og de sidste to hjemme hos hendes søster, hvor hendes familie tog sig
af hende, er der nu brug for en længerevarende finansiel støtte til resten af
hendes behandling og genoptræning i henholdsvis Istanbul og Berlin. Hun kommer
til at være i Istanbul det næste stykke tid, da operationen, hvor kraniet skal
sættes på plads, skal laves af de samme læger der opererede hende de to første
gange. Derefter går turen videre til hendes nye hjem i Berlin, hvor hendes
genoptræning skal fortsætte.



NB! Udover de nævnte perks (belønninger for bidrag) vil Lobna skrive takke beskeder på hendes væg i facebook og twitter
med navne på alle dem som har bidraget til denne kampagne!

story:
An introduction...

For the last 7 years my family and I have struggled, argued, fought and (in small measures) won against the BC government, Lyme disease, employers and ourselves. Our daughter Xander was beset by a strain of Lyme Disease that left her crippled and requiring medical treatment.  How she became infected we will never know but the symptoms surfaced after an accident at a friends house.  I wish the Lyme disease was the only problem we had.  The initial diagnosis was in fact only a symptom and the treatment for it was extremely harsh for a 3 year old and (we were told by the recommending doctor) it could kill her.  Given what we now know, if it didn't kill her, it would not have actually cured the underlying problem, but rather possibly have made it worse.
In the time since then she's given more blood, been poked and prodded endlessly, had countless massages and thousands of doctors appointments.  It wasn't until this past  year that we finally had confirmation for Lyme Disease from an independent Lab in Calgary, AB.
Now we need to give her the treatment she needs, the treatments that will cure her of the underlying disease, not just the symptoms.  The treatment that will keep her ALIVE and happy like any normal 11 year old.

A longer story....

In May of 2006, it all began with my daughter visiting a friend for a play date. One of the kids climbed the TV, and it all crashed onto Xander. That night she awoke paralysed and in pain. 9 months of Dr. visits, lab tests and gallons of blood, we were directed to an arthritis specialist, who in turn demanded a treatment so severe, that she actually told us we may lose our daughter to the treatment.
We didn't trust that the diagnosis was correct, and told the specialist as much.  She responded with "who were we to tell her how to do her job?!" and a couple other choice epitaphs.  Going so far as to say that without her recommended treatment, our daughter would be non-ambulatory in the next few months with irreparable damage thereafter.


We denied the treatment based on the available facts, and were charged by the Ministry of Child and Family at the Specialists behest, with "Failure to comply with a doctors treatment". At that time we were issued a subpoena to appear in court. 
We won the case, and the right to Xanders care...and the bills.
I cant even remember the names of all the different Doctors and their practices or all their treatments, but there were Chinese holistic, Lymphatic draining, homoeopaths and naturopaths, chiropractors, physiotherapists, osteopaths, oncologists, 2 separate children's hospitals in different provinces not to mention the litres of blood for labs....
On and on and on.


My wife gave up her job 6 years ago to be available for Xander if she had issues at school.  When the teachers would leave my daughter lying in the dirt after being knocked down at recess, my wife started home schooling her. She would sit on my daughters bed all night massaging her, in the hopes of easing the pain and inflammation in her joints. For 7 years she has given her whole life to making Xander more comfortable.


I cant really explain the strain on our family, or the confusion that becomes rage and fear after 7 years, but to have a diagnosis that may take away my daughters pain, and give her the opportunity at a complete life after so long... Only to be held back by the hurdles placed before us by a group of people that have the doctrine "We shall do no harm" and are constitutionally protected, even when you prove them wrong...


Well, you get the point. The facts are, that Xander will get the proper treatment if we get her to a Doctor who is willing and able to treat Lyme disease. Apparently Canada doesn't have any, but we were recommended to one in Connecticut.  The treatment recommended is of unknown duration because of the length of time she's had Lyme Disease. She will be prescribed antibiotics, additional and continuing practitioner visits, as well as 200+ hours in an Oxygen chamber to help eradicate the parasite. This will all be coming from private funds because we have no health insurance in the USA.  On top of this there will be living expenses while we are there and flights back and forth between treatments.

There is no way that I could explain everything we have gone through since May 2006, so forgive me if I did or didn't seem to go on....

I do not ask for this lightly. I am an honest and hard working man, who used to take pride in providing for my family. At the same time, I HAVE to ask because my daughter can get the help she needs if I do. 

Thank you for reading.


What We Need...

We require $15,000 to get Xander to Connecticut and pay for her treatments, lodging and travel expenses.  These include but are not limited to; housing rental, vehicle rentals or taxis, antibiotics, practitioner visits, travelers insurance, oxygen chamber fees, meals, holistic/naturopath medicines & supplements and flights between Connecticut and B.C for 3 people.

What We Can Give You....

I'd love to be able to say that we'd give anyone who donated a game console or something extravagant, however we are not people of those means.  That being said for everyone that donates we will give gifts ranging from recent pictures of Xander after treatments to giant cards, coloured and glittered by my family... take that as you will.  

What This Means To Us...

Your donation regardless of amount means everything to us, because it is helping Xander to get the care she's needed for so long.  You'd literally be giving hope to an entire family.  

Other Ways You Can Help...

We understand that not everyone will be able to donate.  That's fine.  What we would ask is this:  Share this campaign with all your friends, on Facebook, Twitter and any social media platform you use.  Please help us get the word out.  Please help us get the help she needs.

Additionally we would like to say a few things that we learned along the way.  

DO NOT PUT YOUR TELEVISIONS (ESPECIALLY CRT'S) ON TOP OF DRESSERS ETC IN YOUR CHILDRENS ROOMS.  ESPECIALLY IF THEY ARE UNSECURED.

IF YOUR DOCTOR ISN'T SOLVING YOUR PROBLEM GET CHECKED FOR LYME DISEASE.  IT CAN MIMIC 3000+ DISEASES!

Thank you for reading this far, take care and play safe.

story:
The Acupuncture Bus was born as a creative and innovative solution to increase access to a form of medicine that is out of range for many people - both financially and physically. By offering affordable sliding scale prices and showing up where we're needed most, we hope to to be available to serve a whole community that is currently underserved by acupuncturists in the Boulder-Denver region. We were looking for a fun and interesting way to express our belief in social justice and equality- now we’re driving the healthcare (r)evolution. There are plenty of food trucks out there, but what about the other kinds of nourishment our bodies and spirits need - we're here to deliver.



Next stop - balance


The bus will be highly visible at a number of locations in the community, generating curiosity and awareness about the efficacy, flexibility, ease, and value of acupuncture as a healing option that utilizes the body's innate capacities to heal itself. With the work of our design team, walking into the bus will be like walking into a warm and welcoming home, so it will be both a clean and safe environment where medical treatment can be accessed and a place where one can feel relaxed and comfortable. As always the acupuncture treatments will be tailored specifically for what the patient needs whether it’s pain, digestive unease, or insomnia.


Next stop - health


This project is a prototype of a model of care that can spread across the country and increase access both in isolated urban and rural areas, similar to the "Barefoot Doctors" in 1930's China who were trained to go into towns and villages and bring medicine to those who had little or no access. Eventually, we hope to play a part in transporting healthcare to states and cities from coast to coast. And, in addition to serving the local communities on an regular and ongoing basis, we plan to make ourselves available for special events, such as sports races and music festivals. We’re also planning to find ways to play a role in supporting fundraising events throughout the region.



Next stop - wholeness


We have managed to raise funds for the purchase of the actual bus separately, but we need to transform it into The Acupuncture Bus. From painting the bus to retrofitting the insides into a place for healing to developing a warm and inviting signature look, you can help us turn this dream of a homey mobile healing center into a reality.


Funds Breakdown:

$9k - Exterior paint job and graphic wrap

$6k - Interior renovations (all reclaimed materials and beetle-kill pine when possible) - We’re looking to install wood flooring as well as some shelving units, a small desk, and privacy screens and you’ll be able to watch the progress of the transformation process on our website with ongoing updates.

Take action towards affordable healthcare, support our grassroots effort - be a part of the healthcare (r)evolution.
story_txt: The Acupuncture Bus was born as a creative and innovative solution to increase access to a form of medicine that is out of range for many people - both financially and physically. By offering affordable sliding scale prices and showing up where we're needed most, we hope to to be available to serve a whole community that is currently underserved by acupuncturists in the Boulder-Denver region. We were looking for a fun and interesting way to express our belief in social justice and equality- now we’re driving the healthcare (r)evolution. There are plenty of food trucks out there, but what about the other kinds of nourishment our bodies and spirits need - we're here to deliver.Next stop - balanceThe bus will be highly visible at a number of locations in the community, generating curiosity and awareness about the efficacy, flexibility, ease, and value of acupuncture as a healing option that utilizes the body's innate capacities to heal itself. With the work of our design team, walking into the bus will be like walking into a warm and welcoming home, so it will be both a clean and safe environment where medical treatment can be accessed and a place where one can feel relaxed and comfortable. As always the acupuncture treatments will be tailored specifically for what the patient needs whether it’s pain, digestive unease, or insomnia. Next stop - healthThis project is a prototype of a model of care that can spread across the country and increase access both in isolated urban and rural areas, similar to the "Barefoot Doctors" in 1930's China who were trained to go into towns and villages and bring medicine to those who had little or no access. Eventually, we hope to play a part in transporting healthcare to states and cities from coast to coast. And, in addition to serving the local communities on an regular and ongoing basis, we plan to make ourselves available for special events, such as sports races and music festivals. We’re also planning to find ways to play a role in supporting fundraising events throughout the region.Next stop - wholenessWe have managed to raise funds for the purchase of the actual bus separately, but we need to transform it into The Acupuncture Bus. From painting the bus to retrofitting the insides into a place for healing to developing a warm and inviting signature look, you can help us turn this dream of a homey mobile healing center into a reality.Funds Breakdown:$9k - Exterior paint job and graphic wrap$6k - Interior renovations (all reclaimed materials and beetle-kill pine when possible) - We’re looking to install wood flooring as well as some shelving units, a small desk, and privacy screens and you’ll be able to watch the progress of the transformation process on our website with ongoing updates.Take action towards affordable healthcare, support our grassroots effort - be a part of the healthcare (r)evolution.

story:
In January 2014, I will be returning to Uganda with a group of around 18 people to do medical work in rural villages.  We work with the Anthill Foundation and the Rotary Club and organize medical "camps" to provide basic care to people who have very little. 

Last year I was able to raise around 600 dollars which went to purchising medications that we provide for free to these Ugandan villagers.  Common medications we provide are Tylenol, Ibuprofen, anti-malarial medications, antacids, and antibiotics. 

My goal is to more than double my fundraising this year to continue to fund this work.  Your donation is tax deductable through Anthill Foundation.

story:
Thank you so much for helping, everyone! Didn't quite make the 'goal,' but there is new hope!

 

 

MY SITUATION

Hi... I'm not good at asking for help. I really, really hate this.


I've been fighting an 11 year battle against chronic Lyme Disease and coinfections, which have left me debilitated and insolvent. My symptoms are many, and include excruciating muscle, joint, and bone pain, cognitive and memory issues, severe headaches, extreme fatigue, difficulty breathing, sleep disorder, depression, and more. I am often unable to fully utilize my left leg, I am regularly in a state of panic, and I am soooo tired.. physically, mentally, and emotionally.


Living in an area where most businesses close in winter, there are few year round jobs, and I am required to change health insurance providers every 5-6 months, with waiting periods in between. My PCP, who won't administer long-term Lyme treatment due to related politics and controversy, doesn't accept my summer/fall insurance. My Lyme specialist, who used to accept my summer/fall and winter/spring insurances, no longer accepts EITHER, nor does ANY other Lyme specialist.


I have recently had to put my health above all other basic needs because the stop-start treatment is quite literally killing me. It was a nasty trade that will result in my electricity being turned off for non payment in mid March when the winter shut-off moratorium ends. I am also faced with the choice of keeping either my apartment or my car, both of which I am now at risk of losing. I will have to keep and live in my car, because I cannot work without it, and without either work or proper medical insurance I'll be as good as dead. I am fortunate that I have a job that does not require me to get out of my car (which I often CAN'T do) or to work when I am feeling too sick. 


The only family I know is my father, who has Alzheimer's and no longer knows me. My friends each have their own problems, and they have all done all that they can for me. I'm on my own.

 


HOW YOU CAN HELP

Even the smallest contribution can help to change my life. 
 

I have paid a deposit toward the filing of a bankruptcy petition, which will relieve me of the financial burden that has resulted from the Lyme Disease, and free me of garnishment issues, but I have no way of paying for the rest of it. Your contribution will help to get the bankruptcy petition filed, which will save my home, electricity, and car, and enable me to pay monthly premiums on decent, private medical insurance. 


Your contribution will will also help to pay for an appointment with my Lyme specialist, which should carry me through until my new insurance is in effect.


If I get the bankruptcy petition filed within 2 weeks, I may win this fight. If not, I will hit rock bottom. It is painful for me to have to present myself as a 'charity,' but I need help. I can't do it alone.


NO CONTRIBUTION IS TOO SMALL, and I will somehow pay each forward.


IndieGoGo accepts all major credit cards. 


THANK YOU!

 

 

PLEASE SHARE

Please share this campaign with your social network. Sharing my campaign on Facebook, Twitter or even via email is simple, thanks to the share tools that IndieGoGo has implemented! 


I request also that you actually view the video that I posted above, that you read this symptoms list, and that you help to spread truthful information about Lyme Disease, which is dangerously misunderstood, including by most of the medical community.

story:
Our Story

Andrea DeFreitas had  a stroke after having her second child.  She suffered a rare complication of bleeding into her brain 1 weeks after giving birth. She was left with paralysis on her right side and difficulty speaking.  Angie is only 27 years old and has 2 children under the age of 6.  LIke all too many Angie had medicaid insurance which will not cover her rehabilitation.  She needs this rehab to help her learn how to care for herself and her family again. Rehabilitation will help her relearn the very basics.  In rehab she will learn how to feed herself, how to bathe herself and her children. Her rehab facility costs 2,000 a day. A charitable organization has given her 1 month financing.  Now we, her friends and family, can rally to help make sure she is able to get the full 3 months of rehabilitation that she needs.


The Impact

This campaign will allow a young woman to have a future in which she can care for herself and her family. 


What We Need & What You Get

Basically 2,000 a day for 1 month is 60,000.  For 2 months 120,000


Other Ways You Can Help

1  Spread the word on the campaign.  2.  call Angie   3. Cherish every minute of life for it is precious

story:
Who We Are

My name is Homayon Ghassemi and along with my partner Roger Voter, we have decided to collaborate on an applied project that investigates the efficacy of mobile healthcare facilities in improving access to medical care in developing nations, namely Ecuador. We are both seniors at The Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, MD.

Our Project

In 2008, I traveled to Quito, Ecuador to volunteer with a non-profit, non-governmental organization, known as UBECI which stands for United to Benefit Ecuadorian Children, International (www.ubeci.org). UBECI is an organization that serves low-income children and their families in Quito and in surrounding rural communities in Ecuador. By engaging experienced educators, social workers and international volunteers, UBECI provides recreational actives, educational resources and mentorship for at-risk children and adolescents many of whom began working in the streets markets at a young age.

Despite a national health care system in Ecuador, many of the children that UBECI works with have a fundamental lack of access to even basic healthcare and wellness resources. In rural areas and among indigenous populations, access to regular medical care is even less common.

By leveraging UBECI's exisiting presence in Ecuador, we strive to implement temporary and fully-staffed mobile clinics to provide vital medical care to populations already served by UBECI.  This project will be carried out in three phases:

Phase 1:    Primary Care and Wellness

Phase 2: Secondary Care and Basic   Diagnostics

Phase 3: Multi-Disciplinary Care   and Advanced Diagnostics

 

•  Providing annual physical  exam to identify serious/life-threating abnormalities

•  Staffed by volunteer doctors from United States

• Hygiene lessons lead by UBECI’s non-medical volunteers

• Follow up conducted by local, public hospitals

 

 

•  Basic diagnostic testing to screen for malaria and other opportunistic diseases

•  Vaccinations provided for common diseases

• Volunteer doctors, medical consultants and nurses recruited from Ecuador

 

•  Advance diagnostic testing including x-ray capabilities

•  Comprehensive medical and dental services

•  Volunteer dentists and dental assistants recruited from Ecuador and United States

 

What We Need

The primary purpose of our fundraising efforts is to purchase necessary supplies for our mobile clinics:

  • Three basic tents which will serve as mobile examination rooms
  • Basic medical supplies and equipment
  • Hygiene products for patients (toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap etc)
  • All money will go directly towards helping improve medical access for Ecuadorian children and their families

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!
  • Refer qualified doctors that are willing to volunteer in Ecuador!

story:
Each year in the U.S. there are approximately 13,400 children between the ages of birth and 19 who are diagnosed with cancer. In 1998, about 2500 died of cancer, thus making cancer the most common cause of death by disease for children in America according to the American Childhood Cancer Organization.

In August of 1999 Pat Bowman's father, John Phillip Bowman was diagnosed with Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML). He completed his first round of Chemotherapy at Mayo Hospital in North Phoenix which put his AML in remission. John eventually lost his battle on July 28, 2003. Pat was 19 years old with 2 siblings.  After extensive research and soul searching, I found the help we can provide would be best served to a local cause doing GREAT work. Childhood cancer is not only heartbreaking, but unbelievably stressful to the families, many of which are unprepared for the long road ahead. All of the proceeds raised from this tournament are being donated to the Center for Cancer & Blood Disorders at Phoenix Children’s Hospital.  

What We Need & What You Get

Please join us in a day of fun at the exclusive Gainey Ranch Golf Club with fabulous giveaways & prizes donated by our sponsors. The most rewarding part is the money will be going towards Phoenix Children’s Hospital to help out families with loved ones fighting cancer. 

******* Golf **** Food **** Fun **** Prizes ******* Help a child and their Family *******

Gainey Ranch Golf Course on May 9th, 18 holes, check in 6:30am

Other Ways You Can Help

No time to golf?  Please feel free to donate without golfing.  

Hole Sponsors needed.  See the picture in the Gallery for pricing.

Contact Patrick Bowman 480-452-2712 or pbowman@peoplesmortgage.com

Can’t contribute? Want to help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • We could use volunteers the day of the tournament
  • Help us get Sponsors and Prizes donated.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to look at this page. This fundraiser is dedicated to my good friend Chris.

Over the years, Chris was told to try several different treatments and drugs like Accutaine and Humaria but they did not work.  He was diagnosed officially with Hidradenitis suppurativa in 2011, a disease which is fairly common but poorly studied. He is at a stage 4, the highest stage of this disease. Wikipedia states, "Hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) is a skin disease that most commonly affects areas bearing apocrine sweat glands or sebaceous glands , such as the underarms, under the breasts, inner thighs, groin and buttocks." When it affects these areas, large inflammation and infections happen. As you can see, it is a pretty uncomfortable condition. So uncomfortable, that most daily tasks such as showering or standing for long periods of time are painful. Even trips to the grocery store has left Chris exhausted.

After many doctor visits, the conclusion has been made for Chris to undergo surgery in 2014. (Chris has confirmed the date of January 2nd.) The surgery itself will be a very simple procedure, however, the healing process is estimated 3-4 months.

Chris has left his job and has very little savings. Having this surgery will help Chris gain back a part of his life he has lost due to this disease and help him look forward.

To ensure a healthy recovery, Chris would like to reach a goal of 2,500 dollars. The healing process will be very painful & we would love to see Chris not worry about bills and have other areas of stress. We have 60 days to come together and help him out! 


If you can't make a donation, please send this page along to your friends. Although we would like to see a success with his donation, another big goal is to spread awareness of HS.  You can read about HS : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hidradenitis_suppurativa  or watch the video posted!
* There is also a great book about first hand experience with HS called: The Hidden Plague by Tara Grant.



Thank you for reading & your donation!

story:
Dear family and friends,

I am very compelled to register as a Tsunagu runner for the next Tokyo Marathon on Feb 23, 2014 because of the message that I want to voice while running my first marathon. I have been running and enjoying the activity in the past 1 year. While doing that, I got the opportunities to make wonderful friends and people who share the same passion like I do in running. What I feel the most is the solidarity feeling among runners in every races that I attended. Given this will be my FIRST marathon ever, I want to make it even more meaningful by participating as a Tsunagu runner, where I can also give back to an organization that I feel strongly to while also inviting my family and friends to use the opportunity to help as well. 

The organization where I like to contribute my donation is: 

Solaputi Kids' Camp, where they can simply be children and not having to worry about the other children and adults nearby (click to this link for further details: http://www.tokyo42195.org/2014en/charity/donation.html)

From my experience dealing with my mom's (RIP) cancer disease, I understand the stress and the agony of having a close family member being sick while we know that we have a limited fund to treat the disease. I hope the children with intractable disease will be able to live a normal happy childhood and have camp experiences that are memorable for them. 

Sincerely,

Sara
