story:
Hi Everyone!

My name is Jackson Cofer and I live in Lexington, KY. Born in North Carolina and raised in Jupiter, FL I have been a Kentuckian for the past 9 years. More importantly, I have discovered my true self as an activist, advocate and voice for the LGBTIQQA community.

In 2008, I came out to my close friends and partner as transgender. A year later I was going by my chosen name of "Jackson", quit smoking and began binding. One year after that, I began hormone therapy.

I have just celebrated 2 years of hormone therapy and I now fully pass as male. While the state of Kentucky and the rest of the country will technically not acknowledge that, I am perfectly happy explaining my trans-maleness to any authority figure and as long as I have my testosterone injections, my legal name change and all around well being, I don't mind one bit.

So here we are, at my FINAL stage of transition! I have no desire to transform myself beyond top surgery and so it is now that I ask for the help of my loved ones, colleagues, friends and communities.

I have found a doctor in Cleveland and have completed my evaluation. The cost of surgery with everything included will be $6,000.00. The additional $1,000.00 is for travel, stay, food and paying my rent and bills while I am briefly out of work, recovering.

A bit about my fiancial situation: I am a full-time student at the University of Kentucky in the Arts Administration program. In addition to that I do part-time Standardized Patient work for the College of Medicine, am the Sales & Grants Director at WRFL 88.1 FM and a part-time receptionist for LexArts, a United Arts Fund.

I have paid off my credit card debt as of 3 years ago, do not own a car and live as modestly as I can. I cannot afford this surgery.

Ideally, this surgery would have happened a long time ago, of course and the simple truth is that I can no longer wait for it. My binder, a sort of modern day corset is a kind of necessary evil. I cannot get around without it as I have a substantial  breast size. Because of this, I am having back problems. I cannot maintain my once perfect posture, my ribs ache and my muscles are overall being uneccessarily strained daily.

Also, I just want to be able to swim in a public pool, wear a tank top in the summertime, be able to lounge around my house without worrying who may drop by and simply feel okay with my body. I am 27 years old and I haven't loved my body. Ever. It has made it very hard for me to love myself.

I understand that these are hard times for all of us financially and your generosity will not go unnoticed. Please take a look at the perks I have listed. I really tried to think of things I could give within reason that I felt were unique to who I am and my relationship to my community.

If you have any questions, I am always down to talk. Top surgery can be a sticky topic for folks no matter how supportive they feel about transitioning. I get that and am always open to those discussions. Contact me anytime at

jackcoferguitar@gmail.com
story_txt:
Hi Everyone!
My name is Jackson Cofer and I live in Lexington, KY. Born in North Carolina and raised in Jupiter, FL I have been a Kentuckian for the past 9 years. More importantly, I have discovered my true self as an activist, advocate and voice for the LGBTIQQA community.
In 2008, I came out to my close friends and partner as transgender. A year later I was going by my chosen name of "Jackson", quit smoking and began binding. One year after that, I began hormone therapy.
 I have just celebrated 2 years of hormone therapy and I now fully pass as male. While the state of Kentucky and the rest of the country will technically not acknowledge that, I am perfectly happy explaining my trans-maleness to any authority figure and as long as I have my testosterone injections, my legal name change and all around well being, I don't mind one bit.
So here we are, at my FINAL stage of transition! I have no desire to transform myself beyond top surgery and so it is now that I ask for the help of my loved ones, colleagues, friends and communities.
I have found a doctor in Cleveland and have completed my evaluation. The cost of surgery with everything included will be $6,000.00. The additional $1,000.00 is for travel, stay, food and paying my rent and bills while I am briefly out of work, recovering.
A bit about my fiancial situation: I am a full-time student at the University of Kentucky in the Arts Administration program. In addition to that I do part-time Standardized Patient work for the College of Medicine, am the Sales & Grants Director at WRFL 88.1 FM and a part-time receptionist for LexArts, a United Arts Fund.
I have paid off my credit card debt as of 3 years ago, do not own a car and live as modestly as I can. I cannot afford this surgery.
Ideally, this surgery would have happened a long time ago, of course and the simple truth is that I can no longer wait for it. My binder, a sort of modern day corset is a kind of necessary evil. I cannot get around without it as I have a substantial  breast size. Because of this, I am having back problems. I cannot maintain my once perfect posture, my ribs ache and my muscles are overall being uneccessarily strained daily.
Also, I just want to be able to swim in a public pool, wear a tank top in the summertime, be able to lounge around my house without worrying who may drop by and simply feel okay with my body. I am 27 years old and I haven't loved my body. Ever. It has made it very hard for me to love myself.
I understand that these are hard times for all of us financially and your generosity will not go unnoticed. Please take a look at the perks I have listed. I really tried to think of things I could give within reason that I felt were unique to who I am and my relationship to my community.
If you have any questions, I am always down to talk. Top surgery can be a sticky topic for folks no matter how supportive they feel about transitioning. I get that and am always open to those discussions. Contact me anytime at
jackcoferguitar@gmail.com

story:
Kayden's Story

Just 3 weeks after celebrating his second birthday, a large tumor was found on Kayden's liver.  He is now currently receiving care at Children's Mercy Hospital in Kansas City, along side both his parents, Kerry and April. Kayden was diagnosed, via biopsy and CT scan, to have a hepatoblastoma, which is an uncommon, cancerous liver tumor that occurs in infants and children. While surgical removal of the tumor is ideal, it is unfortunately too close to a main artery in the liver. His doctors plan on using chemotherapy to shrink the tumor's size, then attempting to remove it. A liver transplant is also anticipated for optimal treatment and a successful recovery. In an effort to show Kayden and his family the love and support to help them cope and deal with this hard time, Kayden's Kampaign was created. 

Where the money will go:

The money raised will go directly to the medical costs related to Kayden's recovery.  Every dollar raised will positively impact Kayden on this difficult journey we are currently taking. 

Here is a linke to the news story: http://www.hdnews.net/Story/toddlercancer100312

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate!  But there are other ways you can help us.  Please consider linking our page your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ account, etc. Help us spread the word!  Maybe you have a friend, family member or acquaintance who can relate to us  We appreciate you taking the time to read our story.  Kayden appreciates it too.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matt Montalvo and I am a professional MMA competitor. I have been a professional since 2011. I plan to start up a mixed martial arts gym and nontraditional fitness center in Bryan, OH by February 1st, 2014. I want to start the gym because I have showed potential to be competitive in the sport of MMA but have never had the opportunity to train full time so that I can be a serious and successful competitor. MMA has worked wonders in my life and has led me to better my character, strengthen my belief in God, and create the start to a lasting legacy . I not only feel that my talent and record will improve, but that I can grow a successful business and better the lives of others through affordable fitness classes. At the start of this business I will offer a unique means of fitness to Bryan, OH. Offered will be membership to an all participation based fitness center. This center will function on a schedule that offers several classes back-to-back throughout the day. These classes will include MMA Technique, MMA Fitness, LIVE MMA Sparring and Grappling, MMA Srength and Jiu-Jitsu. All classes will be offered to men and women, youth through adult. It is my goal to help instill quality of life to members who join the gym. These fitness classes will make it affordable to obtain physical fitness. With this unique format of operation, members will receive quality attention and personal training at no added expense. This will keep members engaged in wellness and promote healthiness and happiness through the means of nontraditional fitness and mixed martial arts. This gym will help transform the lives of members by creating a blueprint for success through physical fitness. At this gym we encourage and uplift one another for the betterment of all who share the same passion for fitness.

What We Need & What You Get

Matt Montalvo will need $8,000 for the start up cost of a mixed martial arts and nontraditional fitness center. New mats, wall pads, heavy bags, stand up bags, Thai pads, boxing gloves, shin pads, body pads, kettle bells, jump ropes, heavy rope, pull up bar mount, sledge hammer, tractor tire, mma gloves, headgear, hand wraps, mat cleaner, mat mop, start up costs, advertising, and New League Fitness gym apparel will need to be purchased. To ensure the cleanliness and safety of the gym it is necessary to purchase all stated items. New League Fitness apparel will advertise sponsors who contribute to Matt "Mean Bean" Montalvo and or to New League Fitness. The perks in which I am offering include an autographed picture of Matt "Mean Bean" Montalvo, New League Fitness T-Shirt, General Admission Tickets to a professional MMA event Matt Montalvo competes in, VIP tickets to a professional MMA event Matt Montalvo competes in, and finally the sponsorship perks. See perks for details. Contributors can choose from the dates Matt Montalvo has a fight scheduled within one calendar year of the end of this campaign. It is my goal to achieve my career goals so that sponsors can receive international publicity. If the entire goal is not met then the use of funds will still go towards these costs. The funds will be used strategically to ensure a promising opening and future of the business. 

The Impact

This business 's goal is to enrich the lives of all those who seek to obtain ideal physical fitness by means of nontraditional workouts and mixed martial arts.  The gym will allow me train full time in efforts to compete on the most elite of stages such as the UFC and Bellator (giving sponsors maximum exposure.) Also this gym will be a place of growth. This gym will give members a sense of belonging. It is my effort to show that success can be learned. I plan to be held accountable by all contributors, members, and sponsors in efforts to achieve my personal goals of fighting in bigger and more notable MMA promotions. I am making an honest effort of bettering my own life so that I can help others seek happiness and wholeness as well. I want to be a leader and lead by example. Through mixed martial arts and nontraditional fitness classes, lives can change and be transformed for the better. It is my goal to achieve my dreams in the midst of so many people so that others can see that nothing is impossible. Through faith, persistence, and a great outlook and attitude in life, anything can be achieved. A blueprint for success will be created when each member sees their personal fitness goals being achieved through the fitness classes New League Fitness offers. I want to show people that anything can be done and that they themselves can be the ones who do it. I am in a position where I can administer to the youth of the community and spread positive ideals through the avenues that the popularity of mixed martial arts has created. I feel that because mixed martial arts is so popular and because it attracts a younger demographic, that it creates the perfect opportunity to make a positive impact in the lives of children. I have been blessed to have worked with teens before and plan on teaching youth classes at this gym as well. I am in the process of a two year sobriety goal in which I keep my network of friends, family, and fans updated on via social media, holding me accountable to the completion of it. I plan to set goals like this continually so that I may lead by example. I have been able to accrue a list of over 40 people who would join New League Fitness at its time of start up and it is believed that more will join at New League Fitness's official and legitimate opening. I believe that by helping others and providing a good value and service, that I in turn will be blessed with the time and energy it will take to accomplish my professional career goals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Promote this campaign via any means of social media and word of mouth. And please use your indiegogo share tools as well!

story:
UPDATE

The Milano Meneghins are NOT going to World Cup

Hello everybody!

Yesterday night I sent an email to Logan Anbinder from the IQA to tell him that, sadly, we won’t be able to be there.

We have tried until the very last moment to make the impossible possible in this little amount of time and, despite still being very distant from the goal we set for ourselves on this campaign, we have been, two or three times, on the verge of saying yes to the World Cup. Thanks a billion to everyone in the IQA who tried until the very last to have us at WCVI!

We can’t be present, and we won’t be able to meet most of you in person as soon as we would have liked to, but we are happy you could get a glimpse of who we are. We are getting you your perks at the world cup anyway thanks to the friends that are willing to help us! That and having you there, you who supported us, will be our way to be somehow present at World Cup!

What will be left of your contributions after the cost of perks and shipping is deducted is going into travelling costs for the team in Italy and Europe: since we aren’t coming to Florida we will be concentrating our efforts on playing over here, getting better and helping quidditch grow where we live. And getting ready to kick ass at next World Cup ;)

So, thank you, thank you, thank you, and good bye for now!

P.S.: for those who chose the postcard, video or jersey, please let us know the details, so that you can get exactly what you want! For jerseys especially I will very soon get in touch with people I don’t have details for.

Long story short

We are the Milano Meneghins, and we play quidditch! Yes, the one with brooms. No, we don't fly. Yes, there is a Snitch. No, that one doesn't fly either.


The story a bit less short

Ok, let's try it again. We play quidditch, or muggle quidditch, an adaptation of the sport invented by J. K. Rowling in the Harry Potter series, that was born in 2005 in Middlebury College, Vermont.

The sport is a fun mix of rugby/european handball for some of the players (keepers and chasers), dodgeball (beaters) and tag (seekers with the snitch runner). 4 balls in play, well, 5 if you count the Snitch, which is tucked into the snitch runner's shorts, 7 players per side. It's a contact sport and fully co-ed, the rules state that every team must field at least 2 athletes not recognizing themselves in the same gender as the others, at all times.

And we use a broom. Why? Because it's fun, and an element that increases the importance of skills. And because it's quidditch, duh!

The idea slowly made its way to Europe, then Italy, and here's us!

 

The Milano Meneghins!

The team met for the first time in april 2012, in a public park where we still practice most of the times. We are a community team, ages ranging from 18 to 26, and our quidditch story so far includes winning the first Italian tournament in June 2012, being the first italian IQA official team shortly after that and getting the 3rd place in the first European Regional in Lesparre-Médoc, France.

The group is slowly getting bigger, and we're improving our game, while quidditch spreads in the rest of Italy too. We are looking forward to a final tournament with all the active Italian teams this June, where we hope to finally get to meet all the italian quidditch players we haven't met thus far.

Quidditch has brought together all of us, despite us coming from really different backgrounds and having different ideas, and all our new players have seen how they can feel like they belong even only after one game. Sports in general are awesome, but this one has something inexplicable to it that makes it (you already know the word I'm going to use: sorry!) magical!

 

What We Need...

Despite not qualifying immediately, we were very recently offered a spot at World Cup VI as the 3rd classified team at the European Regional. We are absolutely determined to be present at this extraordinary event, and ready to dig into our savings, but even that wouldn't be enough for some of us.

We still don't know exact prices for the tickets, because we are in contact with All About Group Travel and waiting to hear more from them about flights. If that isn't going to help, we will be paying

  • $700 approx. : plane ticket
  • $25: registration fee
  • $110 approx. : passport (for some of us)
  • Plus expenses for food and some transportation once in the U.S.A.

Plus an hypothetical extra of

  • $70: afterparty

which would be a great occasion to meet even more quidkids from around the world if we could afford the expense.

So, even if we don't reach our goal, you will still be helping us by making the costs a bit less harsh. In the hopefully unlikely event that our presence at the Cup won't become a reality, all the money raised will be used to give us the chance of being present at as many tournaments in Italy and Europe as we can, so that we can spread quidditch around the world!

... & What You Get

We are currently figuring out what kind of perks we can offer you so far, but here is what we have in store for you:

  • small gadgets (pins, mugs, keychains, ...)
  • jerseys (full kit, shirt simple/customized)
  • t-shirts with our logo and t-shirts created by one of our players
  • stickers of our whole team
  • some really special thank you cards
  • a place to stay in Milan without additional costs if you plan on visiting Europe in the next future, including any additional benefit we will be able to add for you (guided tour of the city, parties, transportation, ...)

And in addition to that, we have some nice video ideas ready to be translated into reality!

Also, HUGS! LOTS OF HUGS! (Assuming we are meeting you at WCVI, in Milan, or wherever.)

What impact does it have?

Being at the World Cup would give us an opportunity to play quidditch in its highest form and so bring this sport a little step forward towards its real internationalization. This implies an increased acknowledgement of the sport in America as well.
You will make some (extremely grateful) friends in Italy, and let's be honest, who doesn't want that? :)

Even more impact: we will try to shoot a videodiary of our trip to WCVI, with the intention of taking it to a TV program in Italy that would grant us a lot of visibility on a national level. So, once more, you would be contributing to the expansion of our sport everywhere.

 

What more can you do?

We understand that not everyone is able to make donations. We all have our own expenses, and these years are not the best to decide to spend even more money.
But if you can't help us directly, you can still help us make this campaign reach every corner of the web!
Use the tools on indiegogo.com, share the link, tell people to help us!



Thank you so much to all of you, even only for taking the time to read all this!

story:
Our Story (short version):

My name is Jaimie Jurgensen. My wife and I have four lovely children. Around the last part of 2011 we began having problems in the duplexes we were renting. Moisture was appearing all throughout the house, every night. Mold began to appear as well. Before the mold began to appear, we contacted maintenence about the moisture. After numerous calls, the maintenence man came out and told me the place needed to be remodeled. These duplexes were old military housing that had been decommisioned and never fixed up. We did our best to keep our house dry, but a few weeks later, we began to get sick. I was vomiting and having breathing problems, my youngest children were both put on breathing treatments and inhalers as well. My wife and children had various illnesses during this as well.

One day my wife and kids were on our bed and I jumped in to the pile of love myself. As I did, the bed came away from the wall and we noticed that behind where the bed was on the wall, was huge patches of various colors of mold. Mainly a blackish color though. We went through the house looking behind things, checking closets, behind pictures, etc. We found mold over the house. Mainly concentrated in our bedroom though. We contacted the manager of our building, demanding something be done, our clothes and things replaced, and were denied. We were told our renters insurance should cover these items, but the insurance stated that since it was a preexisting condition of the duplexes, it was THEIR responsibility to do this. I contacted the manager again and asked for cleanup and a mold test to be done. They came and did their alleged cleanup and test. We had to go stay in hotels during this, draining our dwindling finances further, we were not allowed to stay at the house. After the alleged cleanup, I asked to see copies of the mold report, worried about what was in our house. Especially since my littlest ones were sick and my wife and I were also having bad problems. We were given the round around so bad, it got to the point that I contacted another company and had them come in and do a mold test. During this process, we noticed the moisture had come back, the mold was showing through on places they had painted. Where there was drywall, it was getting so wet it was falling out of the places they had patched. It was a nightmare. Adding to the nightmare, the mold report I commisioned came back showing HUGE amounts of toxic black mold in our bedroom and high levels elsewhere in the duplex. We complained about the problems contuining to managment and repeated the cleaning process at least 4 times more. During this, the managment told me their mold report came back clear, yet refused to allow me to see a copy of it.

By this time it was around February '12. We had had enough. The health concerns and problems were mounting. The whole family was being affected and we were getting no where with the managment of the duplexes. Something had to give, we were being lied to by people who are supposed to follow laws concerning this, but were not. We contacted many lawyers about this and while everyone told us we had a case, no one seemed to want to take it. I had our mold report, pictures, witnesses, the whole nine yards, but couldn't get anywhere for awhile. With no other choice, but to stay and get sicker, we put all our possesions into storage and went to stay with some of my wifes family in another town. During this period, I lost my job due to all the events occuring and my ongoing health problems. Things quickly fell apart from there, culminating in us bouncing around friend to friend and culminated in us being homeless. This went on for months. I was able to get another job and move us into a discounted rent situation. The landlord was absolutely horrible and odd, but beggars can't be choosers. I continued to work my butt off to rebuild our lives, when problems started occuring in my arms. I recieved tendon and ligment damage to both arms, landing me smack dab on disablity status at 31. I need corrective surgery to fix arms, long story short. My wife has found work, but we still aren't making ends meet. County aid is anything but, with being accepted then cut off. Red Cross and Salvation Army don't help people, that are victims of this. We've tried everything we could. We are paying out of pocket for our medical, no insurance. Nightmare city.

Through this horrid patch, we did get a lawyer interested in our case though. He commended me for the evidence I had collected, moving out, putting things in storage, etc. and is trying to help us now. While I have done most things right and made smart moves concerning a lawsuit, due to our health problems, we need to see a specialist in L.A. to go further with our case and get our problems documented, which leads to why I am here, asking for your help and prayers. We have lost everything. My children have been through so much, my wife as well. I am now disabled and useless and we are just not able to make things work. The strain on our lives and marriage is tremendous. We have very little family or friends and they have helped as much as they possibly could. Our backs are up against a wall and we are left with no where else to turn.  

What we are asking for and why:

We are asking for $20,000 (holy s**t that's a lot, I know). The testing and visit to the specialist in L.A. is $5,000 a head. "But wait, you're only asking for $20k and there are 4 of you..." Yes, we know. Our main concern is getting my wife and youngest daughter tested, since they stayed in the room, with the highest concentration of the spores and suffer the most problems. Next up is my second youngest, due to her problems health wise. That's $15,000 right there. The other $5k would go to paying our outstanding bills, putting food on our table (at the time of writing this, I have literally 4 dinners left to make us), helping us outfit the kids for school (supplies and some decent clothes, backpacks, etc.), putting gas in my wifes vehicle, so she can get to work and other everyday expenses.


Getting us tested by this doctor is the puzzle piece we are missing in going after these people for what they've done to us and getting justice for my family and all that we have lost. It's not about getting a huge settlement, it's about making right on all we've lost and what we've suffered due to this. Imagine losing it all. Everything from when you were a baby on up. Imagine it happening to your kids. All they're favorite toys and books, all of it, gone. The health problems and expenses. The lies fed to you and your family.....

The rest of the money as I said, goes to us living decently for a short while. It's been a long time since that's happened and I want to see my babies smile again. I want my wife to be happy and I'd like to also be a little happy. Being disabled and being shot down left and right for everything, this all I can think to do now.

What happens if you beat the goal?

Anything we make beyond the goal, goes to the rest of the children and myself, being tested. 6 people = $30k for all of us to be tested. After $30k and up to $40k, goes towards paying dow our debts and bills, putting food on the table, taking care of the kids and replacing their things. Now, if we somehow manage to make more than $40k, what we are planning to do with the money after that is starting a foundation for those in situations like ours.

A foundation?

Yes. We are not the only suffers of toxic black mold. We aren't the only family out there with health problems, getting shot down for aid left and right. We all know things aren't easy these days and if we make more than our goal, we want to help out others like us. Helping them with mold tests, visiting doctors, paying hotel/rent expenses, bills, food, etc. Whatever we can do to pay it forward. The best way we think to do that, is setup a foundation, to help people in similar circumstances.

How does this story end?

We don't know. We are trying to go after the company that did this to us, hence this campaign to help us with the testing and possibly food and bills. Our situation is dire, but we are doing everything we can. Despite being disabled, I am still fighting to recieve, actual disability payments from SSI, I am out hunting for jobs that don't really require my hands and as you can imagine, that is not easy. My wife is working and as I said above, we still can't make the ends meet. The medical expenses, prescriptions, bills and everything else, have driven us into debt, when before we were doing alright. If we can get the help we need, we can get over this mountain of a hump and start rebuilding. We just need some breathing room and to get these tests done, so we can hopefully recoup our losses from the company that managed the duplexes. If the lawsuit doesn't work, then at least we have the breathing so I can maybe find work and we can start putting into savings again, instead of always taking out until it's past dry, like it is now.

 If you can't donate, please tweet the link for this, tell your friends, notify your news channel, email co-workers, please help our story get out and expose these people. Thank you.
story_txt:
Our Story (short version):
My name is Jaimie Jurgensen. My wife and I have four lovely children. Around the last part of 2011 we began having problems in the duplexes we were renting. Moisture was appearing all throughout the house, every night. Mold began to appear as well. Before the mold began to appear, we contacted maintenence about the moisture. After numerous calls, the maintenence man came out and told me the place needed to be remodeled. These duplexes were old military housing that had been decommisioned and never fixed up. We did our best to keep our house dry, but a few weeks later, we began to get sick. I was vomiting and having breathing problems, my youngest children were both put on breathing treatments and inhalers as well. My wife and children had various illnesses during this as well.
One day my wife and kids were on our bed and I jumped in to the pile of love myself. As I did, the bed came away from the wall and we noticed that behind where the bed was on the wall, was huge patches of various colors of mold. Mainly a blackish color though. We went through the house looking behind things, checking closets, behind pictures, etc. We found mold over the house. Mainly concentrated in our bedroom though. We contacted the manager of our building, demanding something be done, our clothes and things replaced, and were denied. We were told our renters insurance should cover these items, but the insurance stated that since it was a preexisting condition of the duplexes, it was THEIR responsibility to do this. I contacted the manager again and asked for cleanup and a mold test to be done. They came and did their alleged cleanup and test. We had to go stay in hotels during this, draining our dwindling finances further, we were not allowed to stay at the house. After the alleged cleanup, I asked to see copies of the mold report, worried about what was in our house. Especially since my littlest ones were sick and my wife and I were also having bad problems. We were given the round around so bad, it got to the point that I contacted another company and had them come in and do a mold test. During this process, we noticed the moisture had come back, the mold was showing through on places they had painted. Where there was drywall, it was getting so wet it was falling out of the places they had patched. It was a nightmare. Adding to the nightmare, the mold report I commisioned came back showing HUGE amounts of toxic black mold in our bedroom and high levels elsewhere in the duplex. We complained about the problems contuining to managment and repeated the cleaning process at least 4 times more. During this, the managment told me their mold report came back clear, yet refused to allow me to see a copy of it.
By this time it was around February '12. We had had enough. The health concerns and problems were mounting. Red Cross and Salvation Army don't help people, that are victims of this. We've tried everything we could. We are paying out of pocket for our medical, no insurance. Nightmare city.
Through this horrid patch, we did get a lawyer interested in our case though. He commended me for the evidence I had collected, moving out, putting things in storage, etc. and is trying to help us now. While I have done most things right and made smart moves concerning a lawsuit, due to our health problems, we need to see a specialist in L.A. to go further with our case and get our problems documented, which leads to why I am here, asking for your help and prayers. We have lost everything. My children have been through so much, my wife as well. I am now disabled and useless and we are just not able to make things work. The strain on our lives and marriage is tremendous. We have very little family or friends and they have helped as much as they possibly could. Our backs are up against a wall and we are left with no where else to turn.

We are asking for $20,000 (holy s**t that's a lot, I know). The testing and visit to the specialist in L.A. is $5,000 a head. "But wait, you're only asking for $20k and there are 4 of you..." story:
Please share this on Twitter and Facebook:

 

Short Summary

My wife Rachelle, has been diagnosed with Chronic Sclerosing Osteomyelitis (CSO) which is a very rare and delibitating/painful bone infection--and is in need of a 5th major surgery on her jaw in the past year and a half. 

She is headed to Miami in July to have the right side of her lower jaw removed and replaced with a titanium chain (Wide Jaw Resection). This type of surgery is typically reserved for cancer patients, but according to the doctors, is the only way to remove the infection and allow her to resume her normal live.
 
She will have to remain in/near the hospital following surgery for at least 9-12 days to ensure she is recovering correctly. Her surgery is being performed by the world-renowned Dr. Marx, who actually played a key role in discovering this extremely rare chronic bone infection.
 
Six months to a year after the first surgery, she will fly back to Miami to undergo a bone graft to restore her jawbone with bone from her leg/hip. Once the bone graft has taken place, her jaw will be wired shut for roughly 6 weeks. The overall recovery time following the second surgery is 4-6 months. 

More about Rachelle

As Rachelle has not been able to work on her fashion collection for two years because of this chronic illness, we are finally able to see the light at the end of the tunnel. Albeit a long a grueling 12-18 month recovery period following her surgery in July, she is expected to fully recover and be able to pursue her dreams moving forward.
 
As a Fashion Designer and Entrepenuer, Rachelle achieved immediate success and was on her way to showing her collection in major fashion events throughout the world, including New York Fashion Week. She has dressed celebrities ranging from Miss Universe to Carrie Fisher, and was eager to build her fashion empire when she became chronically ill.
 
Additionally, Rachelle has been apart of several charitable projects and has donated to many different causes over the past three years. She's in a difficult position because she's usually the one donating goods and services, but now she's the one who needs assistance.

What We Need 

The money raised will be used for medical and other expenses not covered by insurance. A breakdown on how these funds will be used:

• Deductibles
• Co-Payments
• Not Covered Benefits and Medications
• Travel Costs (airplane tickets, hotels, food, gas, etc...)
• Supplements and therapy

The Impact

As mentioned above, Rachelle is fighting an extremely rare and painful bone infection and we need all the help we can get. We've seen a dozen doctors in Austin and at the Mayo and finally found a doctor who could correctly diagnose the condition.

Once Rachelle has the next two major surgeries and is hopefully back on her feet, she plans to write a book and share her tramatic experience with as many people as she can.

The doctor who diagnosed this condition stated that more and more people have been affected by this issue but have gone undiagnosed. Rachelle hopes to develop a support system for people dealing with chronic pain and to educate the general public and medical professionals about this condition.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone cannot financially assist us and that is perfectly fine. Please share this page with your friends and family so we can try to meet our goal.

Also, your thoughts, prayers, and words of encouragement for Rachelle are needed just as much as the funds!

Thanks and God Bless.

P.S. Rachelle has created a blog to keep everyone updated on how is she feeling and coping, along with fashion trends and more. Check it out! http://rachellebriton.blogspot.com

story:
Please Be An Angel Donor!

Landon lives with his father who is enabled by a broken family court system to deny him any access to his mom. His father refuses to comply with any court order which would allow phone calls, e-mails and visits with Landon's mom. 

Landon has chosen to hire his own attorney. He is the youngest child to do this in the state of New York. As an Angel Donor, you will enable Landon to continue his fight for his civil rights and gain access to his mother.

A donation to Landon's fund is your chance to help a young boy feel his mothers kiss goodnight. He should not be denied the ability to say " I Love you mom" whenever he wants to tell her.

Landon is being punished by the family court, his father, the Law Guardian assigned to him by the court, and his fathers Attorney. Landon is being forced to live with his abusive father by the very courts that are suppose to protect him and his civil rights. Without your help Landon will not be able to continue to retain the Attorney that a childs rights advocate group hired for him. Landon is in a battle that no child should have to experience. The only chance Landon has to have a normal relationship with his mother is through your financial assistance.

Please find it in your heart to donate at least $10 to Landon's Fund.

story:
Who We Are:    

The Video is a great example of the community and space we are trying to build in Fairfield.

Boom Fitness is a collective of dedicated trainers brought together by the belief in the foundations of CrossFit. The stimulus provided is always varied and the results are dramatic. The atmosphere is one of support and camaraderie to anyone willing to put in the work. The coaching is supportive, enthusiastic and welcoming to anyone who is willing to focus and put in the work. We offer group and private training.

We believe that better movement and increased range of motion are the cornerstones of fitness and that quality coaching is a pivotal part of your experience in becoming a healthier human being. We are here to help our clients become the happiest, healthiest, and most capable people possible.

Boom Fitness aims to be a community of diverse individuals. We currently have elite athletes, students, programmers, and lawyers. We have moms, dads, brothers, and sisters. We have clients who are old, young, and everywhere in between. The things they share are motivation, hard work, honesty, and desire to be better. These are the fundamental characteristics that we are going to build our business and our community here in Fairfield upon. Those who join our community will be guided and nourished. Our personal measure for success is to bring out the best in you, through fitness. 

What We Do:

Boom Fitness will coach Crossfit style workouts. Crossfit is an empirically driven, clinically tested and community developed strength and conditioning program. We are an assembly of dedicated trainers who want our clients to become stronger, leaner, faster, and more coordinated. We help mold our clients into better functioning beings with the broadest goal of promoting health. We mix gymnastics (body control), weightlifting (control of external objects), and cardiovascular training in as many ways as possible. Crossfit has quickly gained popularity across demographics from NFL quarterbacks to soccer moms because simply, it works. 

The workouts are always challenging and never boring. All classes or private trainings are coached by a Crossfit Certified trainer. Each workout is scaled by load and intensity but not by kind. All fitness levels from elite athletes to grandmothers can participate in the same class. 

CrossFit is not your ordinary workout. But it is for ordinary people looking for dramatic results.

Our Story:

Ti Liptak and Jeffrey Stone are looking to share their passion for fitness and health with Fairfield. We both grew up in Fairfield and spent many hours of our lives playing sports. What fuels our passion is the positive impact that active living has had on our lives and in the lives of the people that we coach. In order to provide the best experience for our clients we need our own space and the best equipment available.

About Our Space:

Boom Fitness is located at 210 West Lowe in Fairfield (near Everybody’s and BP Gas). When you enter our 2400 square foot space, you will quickly realize we are a very different workout experience. In place of workout machines that isolate muscles, you will find Olympic bars, free weights, kettlebells, medicine balls, pullup bars, and jump ropes by Rogue Fitness. This is the same gear used in the Reebok / ESPN’s Crossfit Games. In line with the Crossfit style of efficient functionality, you won’t find mirrors or televisions. What you will quickly find is that we have everything you need to get in phenomenal shape. You can use your mirror at home for verification.

Soon after opening, we plan to add equipment to hold martial arts and yoga classes at Boom Fitness... 

The Impact:

Fairfield is a unique and very health conscious town, yet there is still no facility that caters to specialized training. What we will do is simple, make our clients happier, healthier, and live more active lives through smart functional training. The strongest communities we feel are formed around healthy people, our gym will become a hub for a full range of fairfield citizens to get together and share life. 

What We Need & What You Get:  

We are asking for $2,000. All of this money will go towards initial operating expenses and to add equipment. If we don't reach our goal we will still be opening the space in the middle of December. What your financial contribution will do is increase our chances of becoming a successful business by lightening our initial financial pressure. Your contribution will go toward utilities, rent, and equipment (Weights, paint, wood, jump ropes, etc...)

 

LOOK ON THE RIGHT TO SEE WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING   >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share our project. Talk to your friends and family and post our link on your social media sites. We can always use your hands or materials. Wood, paint, nails, power tools, etc. 

Equipment we would love to have: (Contact us if you have any equipment that you are not using)

 

Olympic bars

Dumbbell

Benches

Rowing machine

Treadmill

Bumper plates

Sandbags

Sledgehammers

This is the same gear used in the Reebok / ESPN’s Crossfit Games. In line with the Crossfit style of efficient functionality, you won’t find mirrors or televisions. What you will quickly find is that we have everything you need to get in phenomenal shape. You can use your mirror at home for verification.
Soon after opening, we plan to add equipment to hold martial arts and yoga classes at Boom Fitness... 
The Impact:
Fairfield is a unique and very health conscious town, yet there is still no facility that caters to specialized training. What we will do is simple, make our clients happier, healthier, and live more active lives through smart functional training. The strongest communities we feel are formed around healthy people, our gym will become a hub for a full range of fairfield citizens to get together and share life. 
What We Need & What You Get:  
We are asking for $2,000. All of this money will go towards initial operating expenses and to add equipment. If we don't reach our goal we will still be opening the space in the middle of December. What your financial contribution will do is increase our chances of becoming a successful business by lightening our initial financial pressure. Your contribution will go toward utilities, rent, and equipment (Weights, paint, wood, jump ropes, etc...)
 
LOOK ON THE RIGHT TO SEE WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING   >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
 
Other Ways You Can Help:
Please share our project. Talk to your friends and family and post our link on your social media sites. We can always use your hands or materials. Wood, paint, nails, power tools, etc. 
Equipment we would love to have: (Contact us if you have any equipment that you are not using)
 
Olympic bars
Dumbbell
Benches
Rowing machine
Treadmill
Bumper plates
Sandbags
Sledgehammers

story: 4 years ago my mom lost her job due to high blood pressure. Without having a job and a little source on help from the government she couldn’t afford to pay for her bills and give a life she wanted to give to my brother and I. She had to move to Iowa to live with her mom (my grandma) while my brother and I stay in California with my dad and new step mom. After 3 years of struggling working 2 minimum wage jobs she finally was able to pay off her medical debt. She was given a job last October for a marketing company and had her life back on track until this May. She had pain in her upper ride side in her stomach and it hurt for her to eat and even stand at times. After many doctor visits and getting ultrasounds, nuclear scans, CT scans upper and lower GI scans, and the doctors cannot find any reason for the pain. Because she was at the doctors multiple times a month getting tests, her company laid her off and said they were “changing their marketing procedures”. So once again 4 years later she is out of a job and has paid thousands of dollars in medical expenses. Today, July 30th, she had exploratory surgery and removed her gallbladder which her insurance would not cover because all the tests came back negative. She is recovering now but I know the medical problems and expenses are taking a huge toll on her financially and physically.

story:
My name is James Boyce, President and CEO of Dentures Online.  Dentures Online has been serving the United States since 2006, fitting thousands of people with custom full and partial dentures without ever leaving their home.  Over the years, we have come across many people who struggle with affording the high cost of dental care. The video above describes our goal of partnering with you through matching donations to provide up to 25 people with dentures at no cost to them.

We’re excited to hit as close to our goal of $15,000 as possible to provide custom fitted dentures to as many low income individuals as we can. Many of us personally know of someone struggling in this economy—or those who live below the poverty level on the streets. Please help us bring dignity and smiles back to their lives.

Our first participant is Patrick, a disabled Gulf War veteran, who feels like he has completely lost himself and his confidence due to his missing teeth. Although trained in good oral practices as a child, Patrick found as an adult that anything less than diligent and persistent dental care sufficed. Today, Patrick rarely leaves his home because of fear of being ridiculed and says this program would greatly change his life by restoring his confidence and self worth. With Patrick's previous dedication to our country, his committed attitude towards improving his dental care, and his situation in life, we have selected him as our first Denture Assistance Program participant. We are dedicated to seeing his case through and we hope you are moved to spread the word about this worthy cause and contribute to it. Please partner with us to give many deserving people a new smile and life!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $15,000 dollars for dental material, shipping, and one on one consultation with the patient.  We are beginning the process with our first patient, Patrick, in good faith that you will be as excited about this as we are.

We will update our page on the process of every patient. We want you to know these individuals and how you have helped them get their smiles back. 

Everyone who donates $25 will recieve 10% off any product on Dentures Online.

Everyone who donates $50 will recieve 20% off any product on Dentures Online. 

Finally, a $100 donation will get you 30% off of any product. 

 

The Impact

Imagine how your life would be different if you had an accident that destroyed your teeth. Your whole world would change—what you could eat, how you would look, and even interaction with others and the embarrassment and self-consciousness of your smile. Losing teeth, whether partial or all, causes a loss of dignity and respect. Add to that the enormous cost of dentistry, and it becomes even more of a painful, humiliating experience.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise! (Facebook/Twitter/MySpace/Anything-You-Can-Think-Of)

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you or someone you know would like an application for the Denture Assistance Program, please email DenturesOnlineDAP@gmail.com.

story:
So, what do we want to do?

We are trying to raise enough money to support two superbly bred Thoroughbred horses on the race track for one year.  We need a top notch trainer.  Please help us give RC and Tsu a chance to race!

Meet the Team!

It is essential to handle young horses in a patient and caring manner.  By building trust, the horse will be more easily managed on the track, and just as importantly, after their racing career is complete.  We recognize these essentials, and have spent over 20 years together developing an effective system to take yearlings into training and teach them the rudiments of disciplined and safe behavior.

Meet the horses! RC and Tsunami

Team RC Royal & Tsunami City have been breeding and training horses for over twenty years.  Through research and matching of winning bloodlines, we have produced the highest quality bloodlines, specifically engineered to complete in classic thoroughbred races- RC and Tsu are ready to race and WIN! 

   

Using purposefully selected champion pedigrees and proven breeding principles, we have produced a competitive bloodline. The team has studied master breeders such as J.R. Keene, August Belmont, The HH Aga Khan, Leslie Combs, Ogden Phipps, Arthur B. Hancock, Federico Tesio and other greats to develop these champion racers.  RC and Tsu are the culmination of those years of careful breeding and study.

Click to check out the pedigree for RC and Tsu!

In the long run!

Some of those who retire from the racetrack and don’t become part of the breeding program will be retrained and used for equestrian-based programs. Team RC and Tsunami’s beautiful and well-trained athletes would make an excellent addition to horse therapy and urban youth equestrian programs that rehabilitate, build self esteem and teach crucial life skills.   Horses have been partners with human kind for thousands of years and with your help, we can pass on the joy of horsemanship to future generations.

                  


More about the Perks!

story:
Short Summary

Thanks to all the backers of my campaign - we've shipped our magnet sets all over the world! As a special thanks we've reduced the price of the magnet sets to £5 as there's only 67 rounds left in the season!


Hold on - What race are we up to? Who's winning the championship?

The Formula Legend World Championship Fridge Magnet Set is the ultimate F1 accessory! Every time you grab a beer from the fridge you'll be fully informed about the current state of the championship, and the upcoming races.

I'm Nathan, the creator of Formula Legend - the ultimate F1 Management Simulation Game for iOS & Android. The game has generated hundreds of thousands of downloads from F1 fans, and millions of race simulations.

I'm passionate about the sport, and I created this magnet set to keep track of the world championships. There's a big grid magnet with positions for cars, and 18 individual car magnets - after each race just move the cars around to make sure it's up to date.

I don't own the rights to the real cars & drivers, so I've created this magnet set based on the Formula Legend 2015 game - you can follow your favourite drivers throughout the year - will Hamcheese get his Mercury to the top of the table again this year? How will Vellet go in his new Stallion? Will Frank's get a win?

Regardless of the names, you can use it to mirror the real world championship!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £1000 for the design & first production run of magnet sets. Each set is created using high quality printing onto strong magnets, and consists of:

  • A world championships standings grid magnet measuring 11cm x 44cm, featuring positions for each of the cars, and the 2015 race calendar
  • 18 individual car magnets measuring 1.5cm x 3cm - each hand crafted (not really!) based on the cars from the Formula Legend 2015 game. Move them around after each race to keep them up to date. If Manor makes the grid we'll even throw in another 2 cars and extend the grid ;-)

Note that these photos feature our hand cut prototype - the final version will feature rounded machine cuts. The eagle-eyed will see that the cars have not yet been updated for 2015 - this will be completed before the product is finalised (the same applies to the cars featured in the other perks below).


Use your magnet set at home on the fridge (fits on most freezer doors), in the office on your whiteboard, or anywhere good magnets stick.


We've also created some pretty special one of a kind perks that you won't find anywhere else - including cool new die cut car stickers and 46cm x 46cm throw pillow covers that look amazing (printed fabric, not a dodgy iron-on) - just let us know your favourite car to be featured (photos below are not to scale - the pillow cover is bigger than an iPad!).



Risks & Challenges

While we've had success bringing products to market, and distributing them to hundreds of thousands of users, there are always risks with any product development.

We've worked hard to develop fully functional prototypes and trialled them extensively - every time we get a beer from the office fridge ;-) We're confident that we'll be able to distribute high quality magnets anywhere in the world.

The magnets are not designed for under 5s, or anyone that puts that sort of thing in their mouth - keep them out of their reach.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we know that F1 fridge magnets aren't for everyone, you can still help spread the word by letting your F1 loving friends know about our campaign - we'll be eternally grateful if your talk, tweet, post, like, favourite or just write about it!

story:
Learn more at: mobyconnect.co

 

What we are building

In the US, there is a doctor for every 400 people. In Sierra Leone, there is a doctor for every 50,000 people. The WHO has called for the deployment of 2 million community health workers (CHWs) in Africa to close the existing gaps in the healthcare workforce. Moby wants to help equip these CHWs with the tools they need. Moby is a SMS chatbot that CHWs use to triage common illnesses like malaria and pneumonia, record patient interactions and manage stock levels.  

CHWs loved using Moby during our pilot, with an average rating of 4.5/5. The goal is for Moby to scale quickly as CHWs recognize how Moby saves them time, provides on-the-job support and is 100% free to use. Our low-tech solution combined with modern analytics will be a powerful decision-making tool once we reach critical mass. You can learn more details in our pitch deck.

 

Who we are

We are a team that's deeply passionate about community health and the power of data to improve decision-making, with backgrounds in programming, health data science, business and clinical care. Our advisor network includes the Chief Innovation Officer of Sierra Leone, and the Social Enterprise Director at the Harvard Innovation Lab as well as experts in last mile health and mHealth technologies. 

 

What we need 

Our goal of $10,000 USD will support the next phase of product development to incorporate additional analytics & alert capabilities, and help us to scale Moby to the 900+ CHWs in Kono district and prepare the groundwork for nation-wide adoption. The funds will be managed by the Moby team, who have been working on this passion project over evenings & weekends for two years.

 

How you can help

If you want to support Moby but don't feel you can contribute monetarily, there are still ways to get involved;

  • Get the word out and share this campaign with friends, colleagues or family members you think may be interested in Moby and supporting a social mHealth enterprise

  • Give Moby a try by texting “hello” to +1 201 742 822 and let us know what you think

  • Subscribe to our mailing list at mobyconnect.co

 

Have questions, feedback or want to learn more? Feel free to reach us at mobyconnect.co@gmail.com

story:
H20 Stop the Flow - The Revolutionary Plug & Play device that will STOP water loss and save your pressure pump

Our pressure pump controller is a “Smoke detector for your Water System” and is vital for anyone who uses a pressure pump to move water from tanks, river or dams.

Water is vital for our existence,  everywhere you look there are more & more stories of drought.  Communities, farmers, families, livestock, pets, crops are personally affected, or know someone who is, by the quality and amount of water available.   We want to do something to help.

We cracked the water loss puzzle now we need your help!

What is the Problem?

I have found first hand that pump and water suppliers have NO interest in you protecting your pump and water, their revenue is tied to your loss.

If a pressure pump water system develops a leak caused by ‘damage to the pipes’ or ‘taps left on’ or other loss of pressure then the water pump will continue to pump, spilling out your water supply and if not stopped, causing damage to your pump.  Significant water loss can damage dwellings, property, cause injury or disadvantage to families and their livestock.

There are existing technologies which will stop/protect your pump but this is only after all of the water has been spilled out and lost

“H20 Stop The Flow” is a patented device that monitors the flow of water; if there is a loss of pressure from pipe damage or a tap is left on it stops the pump automatically after a predetermined amount of time.  You protect your water supply, your pump, your livestock, family and mental health and happiness.

Our product has been developed and tested in a wired version and it is now being developed in a Plug & Play version which will take 15 seconds to install on most standard ground level tanks and once fitted the water supply attached to that pump is PROTECTED.

*Note:  Elevated tank systems needing one additional item fitted past the pump, which can be fitted easily by a DIY handy person, to stop the siphoning effect.

H20 stop the flow ‘Hard wired’ version has been tested in homes and farms around Australia.   A hard wired version for Town water systems has also been developed and is certified EMS.  For information on this system visit our website.  http://www.h2ostoptheflow.com.au/products/town_flow_stopper

Your assistance will help us……
  1. Complete the development phase of the Plug and play model,
  2. Manufacture the 1st production run
  3. Set up direct sales marketing campaign (bypassing those with a vested interest in seeing people waste water, break pumps)
When we reach $40,000 we WILL be manufacturing,  at $60,000 it will kick start our direct sales and marketing campaign allowing us to reach the people that really need this technology.    

All of our early bird supporters will secure their own Plug and Play controller at a ridiculously low cost.  If we do not reach the $40,000 milestone all early bird contributors will receive their money back. 

Smaller donations will receive their perks and their donations will thankfully continue to support our efforts and those of CHARITY: WATER 



An AMAZING, WONDERFUL Charity. (See 'Other Ways You Can Help' below for more information).

This is possible thanks to YOU, your vision and assistance, whether by donating, spreading the word,  giving us feedback or joining our team.   Every single contribution is precious and appreciated.   Please HELP

Planned date of Production will be: FEBRUARY 2016

Please Join us in our journey and be part the solution on water responsibility.


The Impact

CORPORATE GREED - Pump Resellers Vs. Consumer (You & I)

I have contacted Pump manufacturers and suppliers thinking that this would be a great asset in saving water and headaches/heartaches of anyone on not reliant on town water.  To my surprise I have learned first hand of corporate greed, people happily making money on our pump failures and water wastage.

I have been advised that pump sales are more important than saving water.  Upwards of 50% of pump sales made by manufacturers are due to problems caused by running pumps dry.  One pump manufacturer told us “Pumps consume copper steel plastic and once damaged well….. we just sell another one”

Other comments from Pump manufacturers and repairers:

“Great Idea but we would sell fewer PUMPS”.   

“Repair or sale of pumps is a great part of my business selling this would more than half my turnover, your controller is NOT A PRODUCT FOR US”

Pump and water supply companies benefit when you waste water or damage pumps.  You can probably think of others that benefit from your loss as well.

The cost to the consumer can be almost unbearable in some circumstances.  

  • Loss of tank water and the cost to replace       
  • Repairs, need to fix pump as soon as possible         
  • Cost of new pump.
  • Loss of stock and/or difficulties faced by families with no water

if we can make this technology available to everyone not only drought stricken areas but all areas to enable responsible water protection then I will feel like we have done something worthwhile.

The Biggest Risks that we face are with overcoming Corporate Greed and in Marketing our technology.   We would also love to hear from like minded people who would be interested in working with us on either of these points above.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:  Here are some things you can do.

1. Get the word out!! make some noise about this campaign. on facebook, twitter or any social media and channels that you use.

2.  Share your water saving ideas,  These will be posted on our Facebook page.

3. Share your ideas on the best plants for drought/low water areas with such of us around the world.  The best of these will also be posted on our Facebook page.

4.  Give us your feedback!  we would love like minded people to come on board.

5.  Please check out Charity: Water (http://www.charitywater.org/).   Start a campaign of your own!   They are an amazing group of people making a real difference in a fun an innovative way.




History

Hi my name is Robert Porter-Coote and a number of years ago my wife and I operated a commercial pig farm in NSW Australia.  Our water was sourced from a fresh water creek pumped up to the Piggery and home via a pressure pump on the creek bank and a water tank to augment home use.  

Our pig building was about 100 meters long with over 200 hundred water pipe connections plus the water troughs.  Night or day the pigs would play with the water system and create leaks & sometimes more than one. (they are very smart)

I soon became aware of a problem in the way basic water pressure pumps work.  Simply, when you turn a tap on the water flows and the pump runs.  If you don't know that the tap has been turned on (or in our case leaks in the water system from the piggery) the pump continues to run pumping water happily.  

If you have a limited amount of water, you can, in the space of about 2 hours lose up to 10,000litres of your precious clean water. If you run out of water the pump runs dry and eventually this can damage your pump.

We could not let this happen. Since our creek was feed by rain fall it had limited capacity and we ran the risk of running out of water not to mention other farmers who would be at a disadvantage and understandably angry.  

I talked to local pump companies in the area and we were told that the best thing to do was to change to a no flow pump that would shut off when the water flow ceased.

  1. The pump will stop when you have used all of your water supply.  (If you are running at 5 thousand litres an hour in 2 hours you will have emptied a 10 thousand litre tank.
  2. The pump is not designed to run for hours.
  3. Your power bill might be a rude shock.  

None of this sounded like a good solution to me……………….
We moved out of the pig industry before we solved the problem, however, I continued to work on a solution as I believe it is a PROBLEM THAT NEEDS TO BE SOLVED as it affects all water users.

For 8 Years I could not find a device that would stop the water loss from a water Pressure Pump, let alone a town water supply or a gravity fed system,  if the delivery line was left open or broken causing pressure loss.

Then I had a brainstorm which resulted in the development of the “H20 Stop the flow” device.

My initial device works on town water systems.  This patented system is certified and has been tested in Australia.

The “Town Water Saver” (this works on any town supply not pressure pumps) requires a plumber or a DIY handy person to install and is hardwired into your home water system. It has been tested in every state in Australia and we have not had a failure to date.

I have now turned my attention to the Pressure Pump version.  Adopting what I have learned I created a device that works on pressure pumps but in a wired version that takes about 15 minutes to install and some know-how on connecting wires.  I wanted to make it so easy that anyone who could plug in a toaster could use so I created a plug and Play version that attaches directly to the power for your pressure pump and it works a treat.

And here we are today!
story_txt:
H20 Stop the Flow - The Revolutionary Plug & Play device that will STOP water loss and save your pressure pump
Our pressure pump 
controller is a “Smoke detector for your Water System” and is vital for 
anyone who uses a pressure pump to move water from tanks, river or dams.
Water is vital for our existence,  everywhere you look there are more & more stories of drought.  Communities, farmers, families, livestock, pets, crops are personally affected, or know someone who is, by the quality and amount of water available.   We want to do something to help.
We cracked the water loss puzzle now we need your help!What is the Problem?

I have found first hand that pump and water suppliers have NO interest 
in you protecting your pump and water, their revenue is tied to your 
loss. If a pressure pump water system develops a leak caused by ‘damage to the pipes’ or ‘taps left on’ or other loss of pressure then the water pump will continue to pump, spilling out your water supply and if not stopped, causing damage to your pump.  Significant water loss can damage dwellings, property, cause injury or disadvantage to families and their livestock.
There are existing technologies which will stop/protect your pump but this is only after all of the water has been spilled out and lost 

“H20 Stop The Flow” is a patented device that monitors the flow of water; if there is a loss of pressure from pipe damage or a tap is left on it stops the pump automatically after a predetermined amount of time.  You protect your water supply, your pump, your livestock, family and mental health and happiness.Our product has been developed and tested in a wired version and it is now being developed in a Plug & Play version which will take 15 seconds to install on most standard ground level tanks and once fitted the water supply attached to that pump is PROTECTED.

*Note:  Elevated tank systems needing one additional item fitted past the pump, which can be fitted easily by a DIY handy person, to stop the siphoning effect.
H20 stop the flow ‘Hard wired’ version has been tested in homes and farms around Australia.   A hard wired version for Town water systems has also been developed and is certified EMS.  For information on this system visit our website.  http://www.h2ostoptheflow.com.au/products/town_flow_stopperYour assistance will help us……
Complete the development phase of the Plug and play model,
Manufacture the 1st production run
Set up direct sales marketing campaign (bypassing those with a vested interest in seeing people waste water, break pumps)

When we reach $40,000 we WILL be manufacturing,  at $60,000 it will kick start our direct sales and marketing campaign allowing us to reach the people that really need this technology.     All of our early bird supporters will secure their own Plug and Play 
controller at a ridiculously low cost.  If we do not reach the $40,000 
milestone all early bird contributors will receive their money back.  
Smaller donations will receive their perks and their donations will 
thankfully continue to support our efforts and those of CHARITY: WATER    An AMAZING, WONDERFUL Charity. (See 'Other Ways You Can Help' below for more information).This is possible thanks to YOU, your vision and assistance, whether by donating, spreading the word,  giving us feedback or joining our team.   Every single contribution is precious and appreciated.   Please HELPPlanned date of Production will be: FEBRUARY 2016Please Join us in our journey and be part the solution on water responsibility.

The Impact
CORPORATE GREED - Pump Resellers Vs. Consumer (You & I)I have contacted Pump manufacturers and suppliers thinking that this would be a great asset in saving water and headaches/heartaches of anyone on not reliant on town water.  To my surprise I have learned first hand of corporate greed, people happily making money on our pump failures and water wastage. I have been advised that pump sales are more important than saving water.  Upwards of 50% of pump sales made by manufacturers are due to problems caused by running pumps dry.  One pump manufacturer told us “Pumps consume copper steel plastic and once damaged well….. we just sell another one”Other comments from Pump manufacturers and repairers:
“Great Idea but we would sell fewer PUMPS”.   “Repair or sale of pumps is a great part of my business selling this would more than half my turnover, your controller is NOT A PRODUCT FOR US”

Pump and water supply companies benefit when you waste water or damage pumps.  You can probably think of others that benefit from your loss as well.The cost to the consumer can be almost unbearable in some circumstances.  

Loss of tank water and the cost to replace       
Repairs, need to fix pump as soon as possible         
Cost of new pump.
Loss of stock and/or difficulties faced by families with no water


if we can make this technology available to everyone not only drought stricken areas but all areas to enable responsible water protection then I will feel like we have done something worthwhile.
The Biggest Risks that we face are with overcoming Corporate Greed and in Marketing our technology.   We would also love to hear from like minded people who would be interested in working with us on either of these points above.



 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:  Here are some things you can do. 1. Get the word out!! make some noise about this campaign. on facebook, twitter or any social media and channels that you use.
2.  Share your water saving ideas,  These will be posted on our Facebook page.
3. Share your ideas on the best plants for drought/low water areas with such of us around the world.  The best of these will also be posted on our Facebook page.
4.  Give us your feedback!  we would love like minded people to come on board.
5.  Please check out Charity: Water (http://www.charitywater.org/).   Start a campaign of your own!   They are an amazing group of people making a real difference in a fun an innovative way.
  


  History
Hi my name is Robert Porter-Coote and a number of years ago my wife and I operated a commercial pig farm in NSW Australia.  Our water was sourced from a fresh water creek pumped up to the Piggery and home via a pressure pump on the creek bank and a water tank to augment home use.  Our pig building was about 100 meters long with over 200 hundred water pipe connections plus the water troughs.  Night or day the pigs would play with the water system and create leaks & sometimes more than one. (they are very smart)I soon became aware of a problem in the way basic water pressure pumps work.  Simply, when you turn a tap on the water flows and the pump runs.  If you don't know that the tap has been turned on (or in our case leaks in the water system from the piggery) the pump continues to run pumping water happily.  If you have a limited amount of water, you can, in the space of about 2 hours lose up to 10,000litres of your precious clean water. If you run out of water the pump runs dry and eventually this can damage your pump.We could not let this happen. Since our creek was feed by rain fall it had limited capacity and we ran the risk of running out of water not to mention other farmers who would be at a disadvantage and understandably angry.  I talked to local pump companies in the area and we were told that the best thing to do was to change to a no flow pump that would shut off when the water flow ceased. 
The pump will stop when you have used all of your water supply.  (If you are running at 5 thousand litres an hour in 2 hours you will have emptied a 10 thousand litre tank.
The pump is not designed to run for hours.
Your power bill might be a rude shock.  

None of this sounded like a good solution to me……………….We moved out of the pig industry before we solved the problem, however, I continued to work on a solution as I believe it is a PROBLEM THAT NEEDS TO BE SOLVED as it affects all water users.For 8 Years I could not find a device that would stop the water loss from a water Pressure Pump, let alone a town water supply or a gravity fed system,  if the delivery line was left open or broken causing pressure loss.Then I had a brainstorm which resulted in the development of the “H20 Stop the flow” device.My initial device works on town water systems.  This patented system is certified and has been tested in Australia. The “Town Water Saver” (this works on any town supply not pressure pumps) requires a plumber or a DIY handy person to install and is hardwired into your home water system. It has been tested in every state in Australia and we have not had a failure to date.I have now turned my attention to the Pressure Pump version.  Adopting what I have learned I created a device that works on pressure pumps but in a wired version that takes about 15 minutes to install and some know-how on connecting wires.  I wanted to make it so easy that anyone who could plug in a toaster could use so I created a plug and Play version that attaches directly to the power for your pressure pump and it works a treat.And here we are today!

story:
Hi Guys, This is the page I've set up to help raise funds for Natashas Recovery and aftercare. We currently have a page going and we are selling raffle tickets and getting some quite nice prizes for the raffle donated from local businesses. If you want to get involved and aren't able to get a ticket or you just want to contribute then this is the way.

We have a target of around £2,000 which may sound a lot but there's a lot to do and use it for. We have raised almost £1,000 already with the help of Michael Sullivans Family Fundraiser page plus our Asda bag-packing event which means we only need to make £1,000 more. Any more than that is a great bonus.

The funds will go toward the cost of travel (already spent and future travel) back and fore including putting it toward the cost of a car in the long run and anything needed when she eventually comes home.

Thank you to everyone in advance who take the time to use this facility and, of course to everyone who are already contributing financially or otherwise. Don't forget to share this page. x x

story:
Short Summary

We are a specialized clinic that uses the latest treatment options for treatment of chronic pain with our focus is on peripheral neuropathy, which affects millions of people.  We are currently researching the use of Cannabis for treatment of neuropathy and chronic pain.  The use of narcotics and other pain medications often have bad side effects and cannot treat the pain effectively.  We are passionate about helping people get well when possible but also managing their pain in the safest and best way possible.  We also have some simple surgical solutions to some difficult problems.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least 500K to allow us to treat patients and design research projects and studies so that we can publish our data and show that Cannabis is not only a safe and effective treatment for chronic pain but it is also the best treatment available.  We want to break the stigma that it has in the eyes of most medical professionals and the government.  What you get is access to our website and updates on our progress and if you want to visit our facility we can try and arrange this for you.

    The Impact

    If we can reach our goal and beyond we can literally change the lives of people.  If you know someone who is affected by chronic pain you know how devastating it can be.  Pain causes depression and interferes with every aspect of ones life.  People who are advocates for legalizing marijuana are also going to benefit from our research.

    Risks & Challenges

    There is little risk involved with our research but certainly our challenge will be providing data that will convince the public both of the safety of Cannabis and effectiveness in the treatment of different medical issues.  We are also hoping to create our own strains in order to target specific problems and this also will be costly.
