story:
ABOUT ME

Mr. Starr is an Entrepreneur who formerly was a Professional Model, and currently runs a Not-For Profit organization.  This group, I Am Who I Am Who Are You, helps kids and teens who are experiencing bullying in their lives.  As a Model, Mr. Starr traveled extensively throughout Europe and the United States, growing his experience in the world and with other people and cultures.  These skills allow Mr. Starr to be the professional he is today when dealing with other people and businesses.  As an Entrepreneur, Mr. Starr hopes to run several successful business ventures, the first being Dart Battles, Inc.


WHAT IS DART BATTLES?

Dart Battles offers Family Fun & Entertainment services to the  Metro Area.  These services will initially be offered through Nerf Dart & Disk wars.  While similar in effect and environment to the sport of paintball, these darts and disks do not cause injury or harm to those playing with them.  This allows for a safe and very fun environment where children can team up with each other to attack fellow friends or set up competitions to compete against other groups. But don’t be mistaken, Dart Battles is not only limited to kids.  Dart Battles is perfect for adults as well as corporate groups, team building workshops, and numerous other adult oriented activities, NURF ON!

What We Need & What You Get

The company is seeking $80,000 in funding for the start-up phase and its initial operations. This funding will cover the purchase of equipment, marketing, lease of property, utilities, and other miscellaneous expenses.

Dart Battles will use the latest generations of modern Nerf guns, darts, and disks.  This will allow kids and families to play with the newest toys “just seen on TV”, without having to bear the cost of purchasing these items themselves.

If we meet our funding goal we will be inviting the top donating family to come out and play at our new building, plus a free t-shirt with our logo, and they will also get a shout out on our Facebook page.  If we don't meet goal we will be donating all the money collected to the  I am who i am who are you charity.

The Impact

Dart Battles will provide complete Family Fun and Entertainment services in order to meet growing needs and demands for the younger population. At Dart Battles, our philosophy is one that emphasizes safe and family focused alternatives, and a realization that effective communication within the family element is a key component to our business. The company also realizes that in a competitive environment, flexibility and professionalism will help maintain that leading edge. 

Our motto is PLAY BY THE RULES OR DO NOT PLAY AT ALL! 

HERE AT DART BATTLES WE WORK WITH KIDS BY TEACHING THEM ABOUT HONESTY, TRUST, TEAMWORK AND SPORTSMANSHIP.

Q: what kinda games will you have?

 1) Mission Impossible 

2)  V.I.P :vary important person 

3) Survivor: last person standing 

4) Capture the flag 

5) Total elimination

6) Glow night

Risks & Challenges

As with any startup business, we recognize that our biggest challenge will be spreading the word about Dart Battles.  We plan on a wide advertising campaign including mailers, flyers, coupons, and extensive use of social media to let people know what a great experience Dart Battles is.  Mr. Starr will utilize his network of fans and followers from his Modeling Career to help carry that message.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If Dart Battles sounds like a place you would like to visit get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Indiegogo offers a variety of share tools, and you can post our campaign information on your Facebook or twitter page to lend a hand.

story:
Tribble™ is your new device for your home and family. You can monitor everything that happens in your house right from your mobile device, change ambient music, take photos or control your computer and phone remotely. In addition, you can use Tribble™ to track your luggage, car or home pets. Tribble™ is also your irreplaceable companion that will always cheer you up in a moment of solitude. 

Tribble™ is equipped with a sensor display and is absolutely user friendly. Moreover, Tribble™ is very compact and complements any home interior. 

Security mode workflow is straightforward. At any given moment, you can connect to Tribble™ and survey your home from your mobile phone. Besides, Tribble™ tracks sounds and movement and sends instant notifications to your phone in case of a disturbance, for example the creak of a door or a sudden noise. The app allows you to call emergency services, the police or ask Tribble™ to restrain your pet with a sound or phrase that you can speak into your mobile device.


Tribble™ recognizes sounds and noise level oscillations in your home. If it senses an uncommon sound in your house, it sends instant notifications to your mobile device.

Anytime you may connect to Tribble™ through your mobile device, you can activate the SAY SOMETHING mode and announce to your pet any command or phrase. For instance: Spunky! Get off the couch, now!

You can receive notification of incoming emails or messages from your friends right on Tribble™.

You will always recognize type of incoming notification or call, it will indeed simplify your life even if your computer or mobile phone is not near you.

You can dictate a reply message to Tribble™ and instantly respond to your interlocutor.


Call answering is extremely easy with Tribble™. You don’t need to search for your phone or run after it upstairs. Just slide to the right on the device if you want to put your incoming call on speaker or slide to the left of the screen if you want to decline.

Your luggage is now safe and under constant control. Put Tribble™ together with your belongings in the traveling bag before checking it in at the airport, activate Tracking mode for easy and fast GPS location right from your mobile device.

Data storage is now easier then ever. Connect Tribble™ to any cloud service (Dropbox iCloud Google Drive etc.)  and safely store all photos and videos. Your video registrations are password protected and cannot be erased even if Tribble™ is stolen.

With the help of Tribble™ you don’t need selfiesticks anymore, just group with your friends in front of Tribble™ and press Photo on your mobile phone. The picture will be stored right away on your iCloud or Google Drive.

Additionally you can record your birthday 24/24 without any concern about storage space on your video camera. Afterwards, all unnecessary data can be erased from the archive.

Controlling your music is much more convenient now with Tribble™. Navigate through music tracks, with just a tap of the finger, slide up or down for volume control and audio scrub with clockwise or counterclockwise finger movements. We selected the best music services for you, integrated with Tribble™.


The most outstanding and interesting feature of Tribble™ is Cheer up mode. Whenever you are not interacting with Tribble™ for over two hours and your mobile device is at least 30 yards away from it, Tribble™ is programmed to welcome you back with a friendly greeting and raise your mood. It boosts you up every morning when passing by Tribble™ you will hear kind words of motivation for the whole day. 

You may use Tribble™ as a platform for advertising deals. Just install Tribble™ at the front desk of your shop or restaurant and it will automatically send your promotional deals review to all bypassing customer’s mobile phones. This method is particularly convenient for you and your clients. You can upload unlimited ads to Tribble™ through your computer.

Use Tribble™ as a navigation device for your bike. Just build the route on your mobile phone and switch it to Tribble™. It’s easy and practical, besides you can see incoming calls and texts hands free right on the road. Thanks to the bright display, you can use this feature during night traveling.   



At this time Tribble™ is available for shipping in the US, Canada, the EU (all 28 countries), Norway, Switzerland, Australia, New Zealand, China, Taiwan, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Peru & Mexico. 

International shipping dates may vary depend on certification in country.

How long it takes to charge Tribble?

Usually it takes up to 1 hour for full battery charge.

How long Tribble works with full battery?

It all depends on how you are using it. There are a lot of modes and in different modes is different energy consumption. Its up to you in stand by Tribble may work up to 4 weeks.

How can I charge my Tribble™?

It's very simple, you charge it like you regular phone or tablet in the box you have magnetic based wireless charger and cable.

Where can I find Tribble tech spec?

You may find it in technical specs section on our indiegogo campaign page.

Is Tribble™ durable?

Yes it is durable.

How long I will be able to record video?

As long, as you like. You may use direct video cloud repository and shoot video 24/7.

How many Photos I will be able to shoot with Tribble™?

As many as you like. The same situation is with video take a look on previous question.

Am I able to put Tribble™ anywhere?

Yes you are able to attach it to any surface you like anywhere and anytime.

Tribble™ has video history?

Yes you will be able to reach it on your cloud or on local storage.

Tribble™ has alert summary?

Yes. All alert on video are marked, so you wont be able to miss thing.

Tribble™ has active zones?

Yes. Highlight the areas you care about and get alerts when something happens there.

May I share my stored videos and photos?

Yes you may share it anywhere.

Am I able to set Tribble to look for something in special?

Yes please take a look on question "Tribble™ has active zones?"

Tribble™ has night vision?

Yes. He detects the absence of light and automatically start running video recording in night vision mode.

When are you going to ship my Tribble?

Indiegogo isn't like Ebay or Amazon or any other online store. When you contribute for Tribble. you are funding all of our engineering, software, manufacturing and shipping. Everything that is needed to make a real product. Estimated national and international shipping date is August 2016.

What if i have changed shipping address since i backed your project and i need it amended?

No problem,when the survey arrives you will be able to amend and verify the shipping address then.

If you have additional question or you have genius idea on how to make Tribble, better feel free to contact us anytime!

story:
My name is Connor and I'm a ftm trans man.

I made this campaign to try and achieve a very big goal in my life. When first transitioning, things were manageable. I was able to get the testosterone needed and I'm currently 6 months in.

But with taking testosterone I've learned a lot about myself and my body. More importantly, just what dysphoria can do to someones mind.

As any trans person can agree on, dysphoria can come and go or linger and eat away at you. These last few months have been really hard on me in terms of that and it's because of feeling trapped with my female chest.

While pushing on to try and get a job, I'm fighting both my depression and dysphoria to make ends meet but still getting no where. It's to a point that I can't leave the house without being overwhelmed.

Having the funds to finally get somewhere with this surgery would not only free me of the dead weight on my chest, but also free me of the dysphoria and depression that's eating away at me.
What was tolerable has become a necessity for the sake of my mental health.

Upon reaching my goal I'll immediately seek out the nearest surgeon and book a time for the surgery. If in the case I receive more money than needed, it'll be donated to other trans people in need of surgery who are equally just as stuck as I am. 

While I don't have the money to give away cool t-shirts or bracelets in return for donations, I'm sending anyone who donates a thank you letter so long as their address is provided.
I can also draw semi-decently and would consider doing a commission in return!

Thank you for taking the time to read this and hearing me out. Any donations made have my fullest heartfelt appreciation!

story:
We are trying to provide FREE Yoga for the world!!! Help us publish 150 HD, Yoga videos per year, to our FREE YouTube channel!

Our first year, we published over 75  Yoga videos to our FREE YouTube Channel!!!  Now, entering our second year, we have been met with some hurdles, and have lost our filming space.  This Indiegogo campaign, was set up to fund a small filming space or yoga studio that we can film in over the next year, and begin paying our intructors a little, as well.

Our goal is simple…provide and help spread the word about Yoga to the world, for FREE!


- With your funding, we’re going to produce 150, HD, Full Yoga videos per year and publish them on our YouTube Channel! Since YouTube is FREE, and can be watched on virtually any device, it is the perfect place for us to publish our videos.


We will continue to make a variety of Yoga videos. If we reach our goal, we will publish FREE Yoga videos for you on our YouTube channel every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, with a mix of different aspects of Yoga, like:

  • Restorative Yoga Flows 
  • Yoga For Complete Beginners 
  • Advanced Yoga 
  • Yoga For Weight Loss 
  • Yoga For Depression, Anxiety, etc. 
  • Yoga For Energy, Relaxation, & Flexibility 
  • Pose Break-Downs 
  • Full Hour Long Yoga Flows

We also have other holistic video projects that we plan to explore and publish on YogaTX, like: 

  • Yoga Weight Loss Challenge 
  • 7-Day Yoga Detox 
  • Yoga For Injuries 
  • Meditation Series 
  • Massage, Thai Massage, and other types of Massage

- We are a group of individuals who have combined our skills to do whatever we can to provide FREE Yoga videos.  We’re just like you, we all work full-time jobs, but still want to help the world out :)

- We have really been blessed…and truly, YogaTX only exists so far, because of the generosity & kindness of some really great people, and businesses.  These people and businesses have pitched in from all over the US to support YogaTX through their services, location usage, time, music licenses and more. And all for FREE, so that we can provide FREE yoga videos.  Even our Yoga Instructors have gone unpaid for YogaTX!

Now, imagine what we could do if we had a little start-up funding…

- YouTube has a partner program that pays us a few cents every time our videos receive a couple thousand views or so. We currently have 75 published videos. If we reach our goal, we can produce 150 more, in 2015!

- If you help us reach our goal, then by the end of 2015 YogaTX will be a self-sustaining entity! This means we'll be able to pay for our studio rent, our instructors, production upkeep and other expenses with the money YouTube pays us.  

Help us meet our goal and keep the power of FREE yoga alive!

  • Yoga Studio 1-Year Lease
  • Instructor's Pay for 150 New Videos
  • Equipment Upgrades
  • Indiegogo & PayPal Fees

 

The PROBLEMS

It has become harder and harder to find Yoga Instructors who are willing to make these videos without payment. There are tons of people who want to share their knowledge, but time and finances are a major factor on whether or not making these videos is realistic. With your funding, we will have the backing to begin paying instructors at a per video rate. This will benefit everyone! It will help motivate the instructors that we already work with to come back and film more, and it will give us the opportunity to go out and scout for some of the BEST Yoga Instructors in the country, and get them featured on YogaTX!

We lost our studio space...our editor had to move out of his apartment, and it was at his complex that we were able to shoot our videos for free, for so long. Right now, YogaTX is basically going out and filming wherever we can; outdoor shoots, our living rooms, or donated time by local yoga studios. This has slowed down production greatly, and has us with our backs against the wall. But, with your funding we're finally going to be able to lease a little studio! A filming space that we can design ourselves. A space where we don't have to set-up and tear-down our camera/lighting equipment for every shoot, or worry about time restraints. A place that will let us feel a little more grounded, and a humble home to start making more powerful videos :)

We have a solid team of over 10 very dedicated Yoga Instructors & an Editor just ready to come in to a studio and film! The only hurdles standing in the way from us being able to create a self-sustaining entity from our channel, that will provide 150 FREE HD yoga videos a year, FOR YEARS TO COME, are the two above mentioned issues, that can EASILY be remedied with only 1 years funding.

Please, help in our cause to finally FREE Yoga...

story:
INTRODUCTION & SUMMARY

I’m Francesca Simonelli, a Certified Yoga Instructor, Healing Facilitator and Spiritual Guide. I also have my BA in English Literature and my multi-faceted skill-set enables me to facilitate life-transforming experiences for my clients.  I’m also a single mother of three boys and am passionate about supporting myself, my family and my entire global community by and through my God-Given-Gifts.  Branching out from the Yoga Path, my life work is based on an expansive model that I have created which includes a variety of workshops, classes and programs for men, women and children of all ages, stages and backgrounds.  Divine Freedom Yoga (LLC) & Tribe of Sisters (Nonprofit Org) will offer Interactive and exploratory practices in the following subject areas (although not limited to):  Creativity & Creative Arts; (music/art/writing/dance and more), Creating Harmonious Community/Effective Communication, Interdependence and Interconnection, Spirituality/Conscious & Abundant Living, Health & Wellness , Organic Gardening and Vegetarian Cooking.  The mission of these organizations is to provide people with a safe and sacred space where they can go to purify their minds, bodies and hearts and learn how to live a life of wholeness and wellness and of Joy, Love and Peace.  Divine Freedom Yoga Retreat is a space where clients can journey at their own pace to gain insight, clarity, a sense of community, and come away feeling inspired & empowered.  It is a place of great healing, transformation and awakening.

So many people are struggling and suffering, they are seeking peace, love and joy and no matter how hard they look, so many cannot seem to find any relief.  Many are lost, confused and experiencing loneliness, isolation, despair and an ongoing sense of separation even from themselves.  The disconnect between mind, body and spirit in our culture is prevalent among so many and It is my vision and mission to support others in their personal and collective homecoming.  My work leads clients on a journey from the inside out, beginning in the heart as they align with pure source.  I help participants enter into their own inner sanctuary, to recover their true self and to awaken to the ever present infinite Wisdom accessible to all.   I offer classes where participants gain experiential knowledge and deep healing occurs.  The tools they gain will serve them in living a life of Divine Freedom.  It is my life mission to support the journey of others in an inspiring and empowering way and to help them live a life of Expansive Love, Abounding Joy, Profound Peace and Absolute Fulfillment.

FUNDING

I'm Inviting Contributions to establish both the LLC (Divine Freedom Yoga) & The Non-Profit (Tribe of Sisters Org), as I will be offering services also to those who would not otherwise have the means (at-risk youth, abuse victims, teen moms, recovering addicts, etc).  Funds raised here are for the Completion of PHASE ONE of the inside & outside of the Yoga House & Retreat. To Get the space habitable and work-ready including; Reading Room/Library, Kitchen, 2 bathrooms, privacy fencing & landscaping around the circumference of the one-acre space, seated meditation garden, labyrinth & walking meditation garden, 2 outdoor yoga spaces (1 screened in and 1 open deck) as well as more intricate landscaping as funds allow and lastly a children’s indoor/outdoor area.

GIVE AS YOUR HEART GUIDES YOU & YOUR BUDGET ALLOWS

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still help:

Please get the word out and make some JOYFUL NOISE about my campaign.

Donate Building Supplies, Plants, Landscaping Supplies

You can use the Indiegogo share tools TO SPREAD THE WORD.

SUPPORT DIVINE FREEDOM FOR ONE AND ALL!!

Email: DivineFreedomYoga@gmail.com

story:
April Ball-Mohn has been fighting for her life against pancreatic cancer. Diagnosed in 2008, at 39 yrs young, with the same rare cancer as Steve Jobs, and given 15 months to live, April has persevered. She put's most of her energy into her 3 young girls, all while having a humorous attitude and zest for life.

April's business as a gifted 'faux finish' artist has significantly declined with her inability to work on a regular basis due to her illness. Being self employed, April did not have health insurance at the time of her diagnosis.

 After having undergone 'Whipple' surgery where doctors removed half of April's pancreas and rearranged her internal organs, April went through having her house in foreclosure, (it's safe now, only behind), her work truck repossessed, and living without air conditioning in the Arizona heat.(her a/c is clunking along for now.)

 Feb of 2010 the cancer reappeared in April's liver. Her cancer has metastasized beyond her liver, removing her from the liver transplant list. The persistent survivor, April is now on new chemo medicine that makes her feel as though she has the flu most days, but she knows that that's because it's working.

 Though April shines with great hope and joy for life she is gradually losing weight and is still not cancer free.

 Low stress

Your gift not only helps April catch up financially and to relax some, it frees April to focus on her health and build up her immune system. Giving her relaxed time with her children and family, now while she need this most.

 

Your contribution large or small helps an awesome person, giving her time to create a few more lasting memories with her girls.

Other Ways You Can Help

All help is appreciated. Spread the word. Post to your facebook and other social networks. Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.


Thank you!

story:
The young man in this video inspires me.

My name is Tim Hammond and I’ve been working on issues of genital integrity and children’s rights since 1989. My focus has always been on documenting the harm to men of childhood circumcision and creating ways to let their voices be heard.  Like many involved in social change movements, I’m a volunteer and live on limited income.

I need your help to tell an international audience that circumcision harms children and the men they become. I oversee the Global Survey of Circumcision Harm which documents this harm through an online survey, photo uploads and video testimonies like the one submitted by this young man.

The medical community has never studied this partly because, in author Warren Farrell’s words: ‘Society cannot hear what men do not say.’

Silence about circumcision harm is being broken as more men inform themselves about the functions and benefits of the foreskin and learn how to identify circumcision harm. They are overcoming denial about their harm as well as their fear of ridicule if they speak out.

For four days starting September 30,  at the 12th International Symposium on Law, Genital Autonomy and Children's Rights in Helsinki, Finland, an international audience has the opportunity to hear the results from the first year of the Survey, containing over 900 responses from circumcised men. In order to attend, I must raise funds for conference registration and air travel between Vancouver and Helsinki.

If I fall short of my goal, the amount I raise will be used to subsidize others attending the conference who can make the presentation on my behalf.

When parents understand that circumcision carries long-term harm to men, my hope is that they will protect the rights of their children to bodily integrity, genital autonomy and sexual self-determination.

story:
** EARLY BIRD SPECIAL (LIMITED TO FIRST 100) **

Thanks for checking out our campaign - we feel really strongly about personal privacy and gaming and wanted to come up with a solution that would make us feel comfortable with having the Xbox Kinect permanently placed in our livingrooms.

Update:

After looking over IFIXIT's tear down of the Kinect - its frightenly evident that the IR cameras and IR blasters are actually hidden behind the faceplate of the kinect. We will adjust our design to have the cover extend further down the device to block these cameras too.

Problem

With numerous examples this year of personal privacy being violated by various government agencies worldwide, having a camera and microphone of the sophistication of the Kinect 2.0 placed in the home creates a major potential security risk. The device could be hacked and turned on without the end user ever knowing. 



Design

We have custom created a cover that blocks not only the camera but also the microphone when the Kinect is not in use.

Complete Solution

The cover also has an additive in the polymer mixture to specifically block the wavelength of Infrared that the Kinect 2.0 is using. Some Infrared wavelengths can pass through certain materials and we wanted to be sure the camera will be blocked.

Perks!

All of our fantastic perks are a combination of the items below:

Supporter Pack


  • EAVEShield Online Security Ebook (48 pages) + our eternal gratitude!


Non-Gamer Supporter Pack


  • Online Security Ebook (48 pages) + our eternal gratitude!
  • Supporter T-Shirt

* Free USA Shipping please add $10 for International Shipping

Full Gamer Supporter Pack


  • Online Security Ebook (48 pages) + our eternal gratitude!
  • Supporter T-Shirt
  • 1 x EAVEShield Device

* Free USA Shipping please add $10 for International Shipping

Gamer Buddies Supporter Pack


  • 2x Online Security Ebook's (48 pages) + our eternal gratitude!
  • 2 x Supporter T-Shirt's
  • 2 x EAVEShield Device

* Free USA Shipping please add $10 for International Shipping


Party Pack!!


  • 4x Online Security Ebook's (48 pages) + our eternal gratitude!
  • 4 x Supporter T-Shirt's
  • 4 x EAVEShield Device

* Free USA Shipping please add $10 for International Shipping


Why we need your help!

We are post prototype stage and need help getting into full production. For full production, expensive molds need to be created for the injection molding process (around $10k).  We also need to conduct live testing on the device post November 22nd when our new Xbox arrives. We can then determine that actual wavelength of the active IR and what addictive will be required to block that camera. At this time we will make any design tweaks also to make sure the cover fits perfectly! All of these steps take time and money!

Other Ways to Help!

While the easiest way to support our campaign is through our perks, simple sharing the campaign through your social networks is also incredibly powerful. So please like our FaceBook page and feel free to share our content on Reddit, Twitter or email friends that will get behind EAVEShield.

We are also still not locked with a manufacturer in the US that we really love. So if you know someone who specializes in polymer injection molding - show them our campaign and we might be able to give them some business!

story:
About This Project

The remote-control lawnmower idea has seen fruition several times before, in fact, the pictures listed within this request are borrowed from an open source project where the product comes with full instructions for those with knowledge of electronics and radio control (credit to JD Warren of http://prototyperobotics.com). Additionally, several videos can be found on YouTube and articles on Google of other DIY'rs building similar products.

The reason that I'd like to have my chance to build the same platform is for it's use beyond the feeling of DIY accomplishment and providing my son with a reason to actually beg to cut the grass. I believe that this platform - built correctly and with various handicaps in mind - can provide a new level of freedom to those who otherwise could not push a lawnmower and at a much lower cost than a riding lawnmower, without the need for getting on and off of anything.


How Does it Work and What is a Prototype?

Since this idea is based specifically on getting remote-control lawnmowers in the hands of the physically disabled or those beyond the energetic stages of their youth; it stands to reason that the end-result for this product will be resale. For this to happen, I must build a functional (read: not pretty but working) prototype to base any future - more professional looking - models on. 

Because this lawnmower is to be controlled from a distance of at least 200' initially, on various types and levels of terrain, with unknown obstacles; the following upgrades must take place to the standard lawnmower in addition to remote-control:

  • Wheel size must be increased both in height and width to increase the lawnmowers ability to navigate holes, rough terrain and move over small obstacles. Additionally, consideration is given to rubber wheels with considerable grip opposed to the traditional plastic wheels with little traction.
  • Electronic (remote) engine start and stop must be integrated both for convenience and for safety. This will allow the owner to start and stop the movement of the lawnmower itself and the blades by the push of a button on the remote-controls.
  • A mounted camera is being considered either as a standard addition for safety reasons and remote viewing of what you're cutting, or as a separate component that may be offered as an add-on. The reason for the uncertainty at this time is the increased cost.
  • Front-wheel consolidation will be a consideration during development. Without the equipment to do proper testing, I am uncertain at this point what will work the best but a general concern of the surrounding metal box-frame is the reduction in cutting area. Having a frame that extends beyond the lawnmower itself restricts how close you can get to an object or landscaping.
  • The ability to control the movement of the lawnmower without the blades running is a necessity. We do not always have the luxury of storing our lawnmowers in a safe location with no obstacles between that location and your cutting area.
  • Zero-turn radius will also be established as a part of the package, allowing for more precise control of your lawnmower.
  • Grass-cut elevation controls will be made easier than the traditional per-wheel adjustment. The idea is to have a sliding rail that can be controlled at the lawnmower using a single method of adjustments across all wheels.
  • Top-loading buckets (like a wheelbarrow) are being considered as a standard or as an add-on. Like the mounted camera, this is a uncertainty of cost more than practicality. The idea is that above the lawnmower (blade) motor would be a bracket for a wheelbarrow style bucket to allow for remote-control dirt/debris hauling and automated dumping. 

and more...



Do people really want this?

Absolutely! When I initially saw the design that sparked this idea I thought it was cool. I thought that creating such a fun platform will be just that - fun! I immediately took to the Internet to search for videos and online communities to evaluate feedback before I began drafting my idea on paper.

What I learned was that while this may be a fun project, it also serves a real need. YouTube videos, forum posts and blog articles all cried out for a solution. Elderly, handicapped, war-wounded soldiers and others all stated a need and provided ideas that complimented this very idea. 

As stated originally, the remote-control lawnmower does exist. It exists both in DIY garages and commercially (albeit by a small margin) but to buy one commercially right now will cost between $2,500 and $50,000. I believe that a prototype can be built for $1,032 and that includes the purchase of several different approaches at some points, to evaluate what will work best for the consumer.

If that's the case and with no ambition of making this a Fortune 500 company, I believe that we can get this in the hands of our target audience for below $2,000. Maybe we can even work with support-services to establish programs that drop the price even further for those deemed disabled by their state (this is something that I have not researched yet, it's still early).


What do I Need?

I need a total sum of $1,032 by my calculation for parts only. I have a neighbor that does professional welding and I have years of electronics and radio experience. I also have two colleagues who have agreed to chip in free time and interest from a handful of friends. I even have a few testers that are willing to exercise their new found freedom in the backyard once it's ready.

$1,032 buys:

  • FM R/C Receiver
  • Arduino and Proper Shields
  • Movement Motors
  • Working but Used Power-Mower
  • 12v Batteries
  • Angle-Iron and Square-Tubing
  • Caster Wheels
  • Drive Wheels
  • Rods/Nuts/Washers for Frame
  • Sprockets & Chain
  • Electronics Components
  • Elevation Control Assembly
  • Countless Screws/Bolts/Supplies

I wouldn't be opposed to supplying an updated shopping and costs list on the updates page if it would make anyone more comfortable with contributing. Any overages will be used to further investigate additional potential.


Thank You in Advance!

I'd like to thank you in advance for even considering this idea. The possibility of helping others and the room for educational growth on my and my colleagues part is very exciting.

If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to ask. I am just a guy with an idea and believe that I have the knowledge and drive to make it happen.

story:
Introduction:

After being diagnosed with infertility and treated for two years, Uros's parents finally managed to get pregnant and thought that was the end of their troubles. But they were wrong...

The Condition:

Uros was born preterm in 2009. A couple of hours after his birth, he was diagnosed with cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection, which is highly dangerous, even deadly. For a month and a half his parents weren't allowed to visit him because of the strict policy of the Institute of Neonatology in Belgrade. He was receiving a CMV therapy for 47 days twice a day, but the virus began to affect all his organs, leaving him with severe cerebral palsy. Since his brain was also infected, there were high chances of him becoming blind, deaf, dumb or mentally challenged. One can only image the agony his parents were facing.

When he was only 3,5 months old, he had a serious brain surgery due to enlarged brain ventricles and just when the family thought the agony would soon end, 20 days after the first operation some complications occurred and he had to undergo another one.

Treatments:

Uros has undergone three surgeries so far (in 2010 in Belgrade, and in 2011 and 2012 at the Stammzellen clinic in Vienna). The first time he had a shunt placed and the other two involved a stem cell therapy. Now he's able to hold his head up, he regained some motor control in his right arm and, most important of all, he's sane and understands everything. But there's so much fight ahead of him.

Funding Goals:

Another two operations in the pipeline for 2013 and 2014 and follow-up treatments, especially the Therasuit therapies, should enable him to sit on his own, use both of his arms, talk, and, ultimately, walk. That's when he and his parents will actually begin to live normally.

But this chance for better life has a cost - USD 45,000, which is the amount they need to make those two surgeries and treatments happen and to buy necessary vitamins and nutritional supplements.

The Mission:

This family has been and will be fighting with all their hearts. If you can, help them win the fight. If you know someone who can help too, please spread the word.

PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY PHOTOS FOR:

1 - DETAILED ITEMS OF WHAT FUNDRAISING FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR;

2 - DONATION (FINANCIALS) METHODS

3 - FUNDRAISING INTITIATIVE TEAM

References:

Transforming Kids, Non Profit Organization, Delray Beach, Florida

http://transforming-kids.org/

It's My Play, Sports Network, Delray Beach, Florida

www.itsmyplay.com

Facebook Page

https://www.facebook.com/Uros.Pecinci?ref=ts&fref=ts

Additional Youtube Links:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=l62wVOjOLiI

News Links:

http://www.vesti-online.com/Dijaspora/drzava/Nemacka/Humanitarni-most/274408/Za-Urosevo-bolje-sutra

http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/naslovna/aktuelno.293.html:369945-Dve-operacije-spas-za-Urosa

story:
Dear family and friends,

This July 31st to August 9th 2014, I will serve as a volunteer on a Hands Across The Americas Medical mission in Cuzco, Peru. As you know I am from Lima, Peru and it has been my lifelong dream for me to go back to my home country and give back to those who are in need of some of the basic things we here in the U.S. may take for granted. What better way to give back than by doing what I love doing the most, Nursing. During this mission, we will provide health care where people have little or no medical assistance. Many will be traveling long, rugged roads to obtain these services. Please join me in contributing to provide these services that are much needed on a daily basis. Help me help others and make a difference. I want to assure you that 100% of all donated funds will be used towards medical supplies, medicine and equipment but most importantly, will help make a difference in their overall health and enforce preventative measures. I know not everyone may be able to help financially but you can still help me by spreading the word.

Thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart!

Here's the link to Hands Across The Americas: http://www.handsacrosstheamericas.org/index.html

Thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart!Here's the link to Hands Across The Americas: http://www.handsacrosstheamericas.org/index.html

story:
My name is Kimi Cece, I am the oldest of five girls and I am a "Military Brat". My dad is a retired SgtMaj of the Marine Corps and now teaches JROTC at Kapolei High School. I have played soccer my whole life and absolutely love being surrounded by the sport.

I am raising money for the U.S. Soccer Foundation's "Soccer for Success" by running the Marine Corps Marathon on October 27th, 2013. Running the Marine Corps Marathon will be a huge accomplishment but raising money for this amazing program will be an even bigger acheivement. Soccer has been and always will be, a very important part of my life and I want to share the importance of getting active and being healthy for kids of all ages. 

My goal is to raise $600 but I want to surpass that goal. Every penny raised will go straight to "Soccer for Success", the U.S. Soccer Foundation's free, soccer-based, after school program for children in under-resoucred urban communities. 

"Soccer for Success" is providing youth in underserved communities with the tools to live healthy and active lifestyles. For $330 – less than the average cost of a week-long summer camp – the U.S. Soccer Foundation provides each child with mentoring, soccer instruction and nutrition education for an entire academic year. Each Soccer for Success participant also receives a new soccer jersey and soccer ball.

Everyone has a passion in life and for me, it's soccer. To be able to help kids all over see the importance of a healthy lifestyle and that you can have loads of fun doing it, makes everything worth it.

Every little bit will help, whether it's a small donation or it's getting the word out, I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you so much for your time!

Now, let's get active!!

story:
Summary

My name is Polina Reynolds and I have been diagnosed with Maxillary hyperplasia and Mandibular hypoplasia (Class II malocclusion or improper tooth alignment).  Surgery promises to correct this functional growth deformity and resolve at least some of the associated symptoms. This condition requires Orthognathic (jaw) surgery to correct it (LeFort I Osteotomy on top and Bilateral Sagittal Split Osteotomy on bottom). This surgery will help me achieve my goals and I hope this website can reduce the financial burden. 

 

Why: My reasons for the surgery are:

1) Stop the chronic and significant pain in my jaw and neck, which also contributes to regular migraine headaches.

2) Prevent tooth damage and loss, as well as more general breakdown of jaw function.

 

I received the surgery July 23, 2013, am recovering well, and am now gathering donations to be able to pay the bills when they arive. You may view before/after X-rays in gallery.

 

More Info: For years, I have suffered from migraines and continuous jaw and neck pain. Due to my constantly tight jaw and neck, talking or standing for long periods of time is challenging and causes pain to extend to my upper back and remain for days afterward. My muscles have compensated somewhat for this improper tooth and skeletal alignment; they are constantly tight to bring my lower jaw into more proper alignment with the top when I chew. Yet this solution is neither sustainable nor complete, my teeth slide every time I bite down and I exert substantial effort to bring them together. Due to this ‘posturing’, my jaw muscles are constantly tense and painful. This compensation, tension, and pain extends to my neck and upper back muscles. At night, I end up sleeping with my mouth open and my neck contorted into an awkward position to relieve some of the built up tension. Prior to the recent braces, I wore a bite splint almost continuously for 2 months to assess the alignment of my jaw without posturing. During this time, my jaw muscles shrunk dramatically in size and my neck pain somewhat subsided, convincing me that jaw surgery would relieve my pain.

Even though my posturing and tooth sliding allows me to eat, I continue to bite down and chew with only a few teeth in my mouth (without braces, this was one molar pair on either side of my jaw). Jaw muscles that are stronger than usual due to constant compensation + biting that causes pressure to be concentrated on only a few molars = eventual tooth breakdown requiring crowns/root canals and leading to additional pain and loss of function. I have been told by every specialist I saw that surgery is the only way to avoid tooth problems and the sooner I get the surgery, the better.

History: I wore braces and various appliances for 5 years (from age 12 to 17) as a potential alternative to jaw surgery when it was discovered that my bite was improper. Wearing braces helped me be able to eat normally for the first time, such as being able to bite an apple (only my back teeth met so I had to either bite everything with my molars or cut food into smaller pieces prior to eating). However, bite and jaw problems came back within a couple of years of braces removal ((I am not sure if they ever went away; whatever the braces corrected was superficial and failed to address the underlying structural problem). According to an oral surgeon I saw, this is a sure sign of an unstable bite. Before deciding on this course of action, I was evaluated for splints and more conservative bite adjustments but found to have too severe of a problem for these methods to work. My condition is most likely genetic and early x-rays indicate the improper alignment of the skeletal structure of my jaw. 

 

What I Need

Cost:

Surgery: 15,400 (includes both surgeon fees and temporary splint)

Braces: 4250 (thanks to amazing generosity of my orthodontist and paid in monthly payments)

Pre-braces splint: 1500 (to evaluate severity of misalignment without muscle tension and posturing)

Anesthesiologist:  2160 - 864 (40% off for paying before surgery) = 1296 

Facility fee: 4911 - 1227.75 (25% off for self pay on day of procedure) = 3683.25

Titanium implants/plates: 5444 (for 40)

X-rays/Records: 300

Insurance coverage: 50 (covered portion of x-rays)

Total out of pocket cost: 31,823

Insurance coverage considers this a non-covered condition except on rare occasions, deeming it cosmetic unless I suffer from severe sleep apnea or can’t eat (no consideration of the prognosis, which suggest such problems are almost certain to arise if not prevented). The insurance company has denied my claim (refusing to cover even the facility and anesthesiologist fees) even after the doctor provided records confirming medical necessity. All five doctors I saw (2 orthodontists, 2 oral surgeons, and 1 prosthodontist) deemed orthognathic surgery necessary to improve my bite, reduce pain, and prevent tooth breakdown in 10-20 years (due to hitting on only one tooth on either side without braces on).

 

I have chosen to self-pay for the surgery due to the recovery being quite lengthy (6 weeks short term and 6 months long term) and thankfully having the time and health to have this surgery now. Any donations will greatly assist in paying for this life-changing surgery. My mother works part-time as a phlebotomist at a private hospital (with ‘great’ insurance that won’t cover the procedure) while I just graduated from college with student loans. In addition, my sister will be attending college in a couple of years, so our financial situation is very tight.

I have been working an extra job to be able to save for the surgery. I have paid for several expenses (necessary downpayments for surgery to happen) with my credit card but have now maxed it out. I need help paying for the rest of the expenses. Any amount will help. 

What You Get

I completed a BS in Molecular and Cellular Biology and have taken Calculus 2, Organic Chemistry, Biochemistry, and most biology classes. I have taught/tutored math and science to middle/high school and college students and am offering online tutoring sessions for your donations. Please let me know what you are interested in. 

The Impact

I just graduated from University of Colorado at Colorado Springs (UCCS) with degrees in Psychology, Analytic Philosophy, and Molecular Biology. I plan on pursuing further education and will be applying this fall to begin Fall 2014. I have an average amount of Federal student loan debt even after Pell Grants and hope to avoid significantly increasing this amount with credit card debt from medical expenses. As a first generation immigrant, money has always been tight in my family and we have no savings to be able to afford the surgery. Your assistance will allow me to more freely pursue my educational goals without worrying about paying bills until I complete my education (thanks to deferment available on my student loans). Thank you and I appreciate all of you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word whether or not you can donate. With your help, I can reduce the debt I have as a new college graduate.

story:
Moon Joggers is on a Mission

We have found a way to encourage people to get active, keep them accountable to their goal and help them connect with others throughout the world the have similar goals. Our mission is to promote healthier living and encourage thousands of people all over the world to take the Moon Jogger running challenge and travel with us to places that are out of this world.


Moon Joggers is the brainchild of two sisters (Angie & Ashley) and was originally formed to encourage them and a few fellow runners to reach their running goals by collectively “running to the moon.” In the matter of months the group went from a handful of runners to more than 1,400 runners in 40 countries. On May 23, 2013 we made our first successful “moon landing” by completing 238,857 miles. Along the way we managed raise more than $3,500 for charity* through a few of our virtual runs.

  • In 2014 our Moon Jogger mission is called Voyage to Venus and our goal is to run approximately 25 million miles to Venus. Along the way we hope to raise $50,000 for the Little Heroes Foundation, a nonprofit whose mission is to improve the mental and physical well-being of children throughout the world. We also will raise funds for other people and/or charities in need, through six virtual races that we’ll host in 2014. To get to Venus we need a team of 25,000 people to join us and log, on average, 1,000 miles each for the year. We invite you to sign up and join our Voyage to Venus crew!

  • We will not get to Venus, nor raise the funds we want for charity, without being able to promote Moon Joggers and reach those people who would benefit from being a part of our community. Our goal is to expand Moon Joggers, improve our interactive website (where each Moon Jogger logs their miles) and to change the lives of thousands of people – one mile at a time.  We are reaching out for help so we can reach our goal of making Moon Joggers a household name and getting thousands, and eventually millions of people, to join our Moon Jogger challenge each year. Not only will we encourage people to get fit, but through our program we will raise money for different charities around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down:

  • We need at least $10,000 to help us promote Moon Joggers and reach enough of an audience to get 25,000+ people to commit to our Moon Jogger challenge for 2014.  The money raised will go towards advertising Moon Joggers to targeted audiences throughout the world, sending out printed materials to different companies, schools and other organizations to get involved and to improving our interactive website which is where participants log their miles and connect with fellow Moon Joggers.
  • We have official Moon Joggers gifts to send to those of you that contribute to our fund.  Depending on the amount you donate you could get a Moon Joggers' window decal, an official MJ t-shirt, free full-package entry into our 2014 Voyage to Venus mission and/or an official MJ sweatshirt.

Make a difference

Your contribution will have a big impact on the success of Moon Joggers:

  • This project started out as a simple challenge between sisters and has become a life-changing experience for its creator. Many people have taken the challenge, improved their health and well-being through walking and running. You will be part of this change and the world will see positive changes as more and more Moon Joggers make positive changes in each of their lives.
  • This year our goal was 240 people and we ended up with more than 1,400, all through word of mouth.  Through virtual events throughout the year we were able to raise more than $2,500 for a seven year old boy, Adler, that is fighting kidney cancer and his family has no health insurance.  We also came together and raised more than $1,000 for a group of runners in Kenya in need of running shoes.


  • Your donation will help us to go out and help different individuals throughout the world that are in need of some extra help.  Not only will you help us raise money for different people and charities, but you will also help us to help others in their own personal journeys of becoming healthier, and happier, as they boldly run where no man has run before. 

Testimonials

 Wooh! Hello fellow Moon Joggers! I just ticked over the 1,000 mile mark, today! It seemed like such a huge number at the beginning of the year! I almost can't believe that I'm there already, and I feel like I'll definitely be able to do more next year! Along with my thousand miles, though, yesterday I also found out that I'd lost my 101st pound. Yep. I completely missed catching my 100th. It's been a long journey so far, and one that I began a little bit before I decided to become a Moon Jogger. But being a part of this group has been one of the things that has kept me motivated to keep doing more, and getting better as a runner! Running is such a pleasure now, and I can't imagine life without it! Have a silly-ish picture to go along with all of this! The left is before, the right is me, yesterday (fresh out of bed because I was too excited to take the time to do my hair) in the same clothes. --Ellen S., Eugene, OR

We will laugh with you, cry with you, comfort you, bolster you, praise you, give you pointers, answer your questions, celebrate with you, mourn with you...we don't HAVE to actually see your face to care. And knowing that we all care will make the paths we share smoother, easier and more fun!! --Carolyn G., New Orleans, LA

Yes we don't do this alone, no matter if we are - fast or slow, we walk or run, do trail or road, we are big or small, young or old, every person's mile or miles matters. As we do this to reach a destination we do it for ourselves and for those who can't or those who are in need, so we try and give what we can while spending time on open road or trail routes to do what we love. We all rise to the challenge! --Charl W., South Africa

Other Ways You Can Help

If now is not a good time for you to donate, or even if you do donate, there are other ways you can help us out:

  • Please help us get the word out about Moon Joggers and make some noise about our campaign.  Share this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, email and other social outlets.  You can even call or talk face to face with friends and family members, asking them to get involved and help us reach our goal.
  • Follow us on FACEBOOK
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

We are deeply grateful to you for taking the time to check out our campaign and donate to this program that has created a very soft spot in our hearts.  We love all of our current Moon Joggers and the unique talents and motivation and stories they bring to our group.  Each day is an adventure as fellow MJ's share their experiences, cheer each other on and walk, jog, run and even crawl to reach our goal and boldly run where no one has run before. 

Venus is waiting for us, please help us get there. THANK YOU!

story:
my name is taylor. i'm sixteen, from texas (howdy, y'all), and a distance swimmer. on the second of may, the texas high school state championship for open water swimming will take place. this 2K open water race will be held in austin, texas, and while serving as a state championship, the race also a pledge race to end prostate cancer. rather than sending in a donation from myself alone, i created this campaign to gain as many supporters and contributors as possible to end this deadly disease.

in the united states alone, nearly one in every six men will be diagnosed with prostate cancer. the funding generated by this campaign will go directly to Us TOO, a nonprofit organisation that provides assistance for and support for families affected by prostate cancer.

please help me help others - any and all donations help and will be greatly appreciated!!

story:
NOTE: Safiya had to be moved to a specialty hospital as her health condition got very complicated due to continuous seizures. Since the new hospital has world class amenities we are hoping to get the best care and attention from the best Pediatricians and Neurologists and ICU doctors and staff. All these procedures can be extremely expensive. So we have had to start another campaign to raise more money to support Safiya's medical expenses. Here is the new campaign link where you can donate:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/battle-for-7-year-old-safiya-s-healing-continues/x/12429721#/

For Indian donors that need TAX EXEMPTION may directly transfer funds to the following account by making a note saying "Designated to Safiya's medical fund".

South Indian Bank
Branch : Christ University , Bangalore, India.
Name of the Charity: Family Development Services
Savings Account No.: 0396053000041845
IFSC code: SIBL0000396

Safiya, 7 years old, a student sponsored by a donor of Building Blocks. She is on ventilator, is unconscious after a high fever. The doctors are saying that she has fluid in her brain. Some tests are being conducted to establish the reason. The doctors are saying its critical.

 Safiya's mother, Ayesha, is a single mother of three children and Safiya is the youngest studying in 2nd grade. It is a family struggling to educate the three children, Hajira, Mubarak and Safiya. When I went to visit the child in the hospital I could see that Ayesha is totally devastated to see her daughter in this condition. 

Safiya is having continuous fits and she needs constant  monitoring. We had a Neuro Surgeon visit her and has recommended that we give her better care than what she is receiving right now. So we are moving her right now to Paediatric hospital, the best available in Bangalore. 

At this moment, we are not sure the extend of treatment she would need and what the final expenses would come to. We will keep you posted daily on her progress. 

Please donate generously to save Safiya!!! Thank you!!

Click on the link below for Facebook updates:

https://www.facebook.com/buildingblocksin/posts...
story_txt:
NOTE: Safiya had to be moved to a specialty hospital as her health condition got very complicated due to continuous seizures. Since the new hospital has world class amenities we are hoping to get the best care and attention from the best Pediatricians and Neurologists and ICU doctors and staff. All these procedures can be extremely expensive. So we have had to start another campaign to raise more money to support Safiya's medical expenses. Here is the new campaign link where you can donate:https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/battle-for-7-year-old-safiya-s-healing-continues/x/12429721#/For Indian donors that need TAX EXEMPTION may directly transfer funds to the following account by making a note saying "Designated to Safiya's medical fund".
South Indian Bank
Branch : Christ University , Bangalore, India.
Name of the Charity: Family Development Services

story:
My story

 My name is Cecilia Auth and I have been a pediatric nurse for over 17 years, I've worked with many children who have required tube-feedings through their gastrostomy tubes.  Accessing the port can be very disruptive to a child, especially while sleeping. I have seen parents and other medical personnel struggle while attempting to access a child's G-Tube. This lead to my TUBESIE creation!  It is my goal to help make the feeding process much more bearable for children and their dedicated parents. We currently have demo Tubesies being used on babies  at the hospital I worked at for almost 6 years, and also have shared demos with families in their homes.  I am excited to say we have received positive feedback from all families! I'd like to share one of them with you:

 

Testimonial:

Meet Riley, she has been putting her TUBESIE to the test! She gives it a thumbs up! Riley enjoys wearing her TUBESIE while reading, playing and sleeping. It has allowed her to remain comfortable and happy during the times when Mom has accessed her G-tube.  This is what Mom had to say: 

"TUBESIES CHANGED THE WAY WE LIVE! WITH OUR OLD BODYSUITS WE WOULD HAVE TO UNDRESS OUR DAUGHTER COMPLETELY IN ORDER TO FEED HER. NOT ONLY DO TUBESIES OFFER EASY ACCESS, THE AREA IS KEPT CLEAN WITH THE GAUZE!" 

-  Christina S. , New Hampshire 


 

What will we do with the funds:

  • purchasing material
  • manufacturing
  • labeling
  • distribution to private individuals & hospitals

My dream is to be able to share Tubesies with every family in need of better access to their child's G-tube. Also, to share with medial personnel that care for children with feeding tubes.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to contribute financially, we would be grateful if you would consider sharing our link with those you are connected with via social media.  It's as simple as clicking the logos above!

Thank you ALL for taking the time to learn about my passion in helping children, parents and medical personnel!  I look forward to a successful campaign, so that we can quickly begin to help make families' lives a little bit easier! One TUBESIE at a time!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Tubesie Supporters:

Tiffany Krumins is the CEO, founder and inventor of Ava the Elephant, children's medicine dispenser.  She was the first person to strike a deal with Barbara Corcoran on the ABC TV show " The Shark Tank"!  I've had the amazing opportunity to be mentored by her.   She has helped me bring Tubesies to life!

 

 

Laurie Berkner is an award- winning singer & songwriter for children's music. Her music has inspired parents and their children around the world!  Laurie's music videos have been featured on the popular children's TV network "Nick Jr."  The Laurie Berkner Band has recently released a new CD called "Superhero"!  I have been inspired to share her uplifting music with other families.  She and I believe that all children are superheroes because they inspire others!

Thank you Laurie for sharing your AUTOGRAPHED CDs with our campaign project!!

story: As most of you are aware Becky and I have been together for a very long time now and we are at that point in our relationship and our personal lives where we are ready and wanting to start a family of our own. With Becky's illness (Multiple Scelorosis) time isn't on our side and asides from that we are not getting any younger. Yesterday we had our first consultation to look at our options for building our little "cheese" family (those close to us will detect the humour here). Anyway it was a day of great emotion. Knowing we are ready for this and that our future is in sight. However disempowered by the cost it would be to create just one life for us to together nurture. The treatment extends to £15k and potentially beyond dependent on how lucky we are. We work so hard and together have been able to save what we can although not even 25% of the goal. Instead we have begun to search alternative options to enable us to build the future we envisage; bank loans to date were not successful. This has brought us to this final option; cap in hand we are begging! This final action isn't one we've considered lightly. Highly embarassed we ask for support. In an ideal world we would be able to take responsibility for achieving our own family biologically and of course financially but unfortunately we are struggling. It is with great gratitude we ask our family, friends and anyone to assist us in making our dream a reality. In making a life our life!! Thank You!

story:
Vida is beloved member of our community and a mother who has been struggling with cancer for about two years. Unfortunately after over 30 chemotherapies and many painful procedures she is still fighting her cancer with a great unwavering desire to live. Due to Vida’s weakness, fifteen local lady friends have started to deliver home cooked meals to her house. They have been donating funds to Vida and has been actively asking their families and friends to help out. A few good family have taken on the task of helping Vida’s teenager son.

On her last visit to her Oncologists, she was informed that chemotherapies have not worked to her advantage and now Vida has decided to explore alternative medicine, which have worked for many others. 

A good friend of ours was diagnosed with stage 2 Breast cancer last October. Her Oncologist informed her that she needed 6 chemotherapies and many radiations in addition to the double mastectomy and hysterectomy. She walked out and started to look for an alternative ways to cure her cancer. She quickly learned that cancer is just a innocent tool that through it our body is telling us that we are contaminated and our system needs to be cleaned. 

She was introduced to Dr. Zermano and Dr. Benny. Together these two Doctors put her through a program which was mainly vitamin-ate her body, and getting rid of the acid in her system. This meant bringing her body to an Alkaline stage and reinforced her immune system while deepening cleansing at cellular level. Today, Haleh’s PET SC and CT Scans have demonstrated great results and she is declared cancer free. According to Dr. Zermeno “Her whole system is berating, oxygenated and no cancer cell can live in her body”. 

Dr. Zermano has shown confidence that Vida has a great chance of getting rid of her cancer through alternative medicine, it has sparked our desire and commitment to do more with intensity. She needs to be on a vegan diet and start her Vitamin C and Amino acid IV's and go at it aggressively, these treatments are not covered by Medi-Cal or any other insurance coverage while the cost could go well beyond tens of thousands of dollars. 

There is much more to her living condition and the pain Vida and her family is suffering. For the sake of being on target, focused and committed we will not dramatize it. But we need your help right now and along the way on her recovery. 

We are asking each and everyone of you to engage with your network of family and friends and direct them to this page and raise funds for Vida's treatment. 

At our very core as human beings we are kind, we are designed to help our kind, thus the words Human Kindness. Please join us in the fight to cure Vida and help her family. 

Thank You from the bottom of our heart's.

story:
The Technology Behind the Campaign

While access to clean and affordable drinking water is considered by many as a human right, nearly 1.2 billion of the world's poorest people, those earning US $2 a day or less, are without adequate water services and access to safe drinking water.  Drinking water, free of bacteria and pathogens (the number one cause of water related illness and death globally), is a human right that should made available to everyone affordably. 

Many organizations are trying to provide some of the world's poorest communities with access to clean water, but long-term success needs to be a unified and multifaceted response.  This is why CATIS-Mexico, a Mexican-based non-profit, has joined in the fight to provide a low-cost solution for clean water access through the realization of ceramic water filters.

Ceramic water filtration is being used around the globe as an inexpensive answer to potable water concerns. However, not all ceramic water filters are created equal. Engineers at iCATIS, one of CATIS-Mexico’s main partners, designed a ceramic water filter that is low-tech, affordable, low-maintenance, and can be made and distributed internationally.
 
One system using local materials and labor retails at $30-40 and will purify water for a family of 6 every day for 2-3 years.
 
                
 
The filters are made with local materials found anywhere in the world, namely: clay, sawdust (or similar material), and a small percent of colloidal silver (which is readily and inexpensively found in most markets).  The filters are fired in an ecological brick-kiln designed by iCATIS engineers (which reduces emissions by upwards of 80%) and can produce, on average, approximately 24 liters of water/day.  To put this into perspective, CATIS filters can reduce the cost of potable water from $0.10/liter to approximately $0.001/liter, or 100 times less expensive than the cost of standard drinking water in Mexico.  
 
 
 
                          

What We Need

I am looking to raise $2500 for CATIS-Mexico in order to ramp up the production of filters and start the local distribution process.  The longer it takes, the more severe the groundwater depletion problem in the state of Guanajuato becomes. Large agricultural producers are using disproportionately limited water resources which contribute to the overdraw of groundwater and increasing levels of arsenic and fluoride in the drinking water.  Your donation will help place these filters into homes sooner.

And So...

This Valentine's Day, consider giving someone the gift of water.  Your contribution will be directly impacting the health of economically vulnerable families who cannot afford to buy clean water. 

In return for your generous donation, you'll receive some extra PERKS that will hopefully sweeten the deal (pun intended).  All of these will be made by YOURS TRULY as a small token of my appreciation for your generous support.  Although Valentine's Day is here, the campaign will run until March 22nd: World Water Day! 

Further Impact

CATIS-Mexico sees the ceramic water filter not only as appropriate technology, but as an opportunity to create micro-businesses as well.  Working with local community groups, CATIS-Mexico is developing methodology to create local economic opportunities.  Long-term development of micro-enterprise opportunities for local communities include:

1)     In-home filter molding businesses,

2)     Community-based system maintenance and/or assembly businesses,

3)     Filter distribution,

4)     Filter replacement exchange program, and

5)     Increased economic opportunities for local brickmakers in the burning of raw filters.  

 

           

 

  

 

 

 

CATIS-Mexico has employed dozens of people from local campesino communities over the last five years, several of whom remain full-time with CATIS-Mexico.  As we scale up, we have identified part-time and seasonal workers we hope to offer full-time employment to quickly and who can act as trainers and supervisors for future production and education.

 

             

 

 

  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's ok, but perhaps you know someone who can!  If you are unable to contribute yourself, consider sharing this campaign with someone you know.  Every little bit helps.

For more information, please visit us at www.catis-mexico.org.

The CATIS-Mexico Vision

CATIS-Mexico works in partnership with economically-limited communities to build solid economies that achieve ecological stewardship, economic development and social equity. Built on a central research and training institute, CATIS-Mexico can improve the lives of marginalized rural communities by providing training and ongoing technical assistance in support of community driven use and development of sustainable building, agriculture and other appropriate technologies. CATIS-Mexico provides a continually expanding scope of sustainable development to the region and also provides opportunities for the international community to participate and learn from these experiences.

story:
Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony.

                   - Thomas Merton


Me 

Hello Friends! My name is Shelby Matussak. I just want to laugh, love, and make good art. I believe myself to be a Passionate and Creative individual. There are many things I am passionate about and these passions have a direct relation to my existence and it's fulfillment. Most of my passions are related to creative expressions. There is a sublime essence to an individual's freedom in natural creativity. The reward for such expression is one of great self accomplishment and often actualization.  Most of my passions also involve the outdoors and all it's delights. I achieve an incredible insurmountable amount of bliss through Nature's unsurpassed beauty and offerings. Being in touch with my natural planet physically and emotionally reciprocates an internal euphoria that allows me to enjoy my existence more fully and peacefully. I believe that all can share such ideals through Nature and it's rewards. 

Over the past two years one of the most influential activities has been Slacklining and all the fruitful lessons it has taught me. Slacklining exudes some very simple concepts that are easily relatable to life. What exactly is slacklining?  A slackline is a one inch piece of webbing stretched between two points with which one balances upon, walks, and poses. It takes an indescribable amount of focus and effort.  When on the line there is a complete disconnect with everything and at the same time just the opposite. The movement of the line, the movement of your body, and of your mind are all centering and simplifying. One empties their mind and becomes a fluid force with one's environment. It's about balance, breathing, and centering. It's meditative, physical, reflective, and connective. Here are some links that might help explain. 

A news piece on Highlining in Moab, UT

Slackline Yoga, Centering, Relaxing, Peace.

Some Highlining at Smith Rock 

Skyliners

Slacklining has taught me how slow down in life and become centered with my environment. It has showed me patience, balance, discipline, and peace. There's something special about being encompassed with practice in something so pure and beautiful such as slacklining while being surrounded by something so pure and beautiful such as Nature. 

My Campaign

I wish to journey across the West from Arkansas to the coast and back stopping at as many National Forests, Parks, and Monuments along the way. Throughout this journey I hope to spread exposure and knowledge about slacklining and it's valuable lessons to as many individuals as possible. I hope to influence others to find more simplicity, balance, peace, and grounding in their lives through slacklining and Nature as the most efficient tools. I hope to expose others and myself to the Natural beauties our phenomenal Nation has to offer and learn as many lessons as possible.  I have been searching for a journey as such for my whole life and now is probably the best time for me to accomplish it. I hope to come out of this experience with a greater value and understanding for life.

The best and safest thing is to keep balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man.
- Euripides

I graduated with a BA in 2010 and have since then waded about in various conquests for money to pay off the debt my education has supplied me and at the same time be as satisfied with my existence as possible. It has been really hard balancing the two. I will be saving as much as possible between now and March 2014 to cover the following monthly expenses:

  • $230   Student debt repayment
  • $150   Insurance 
  • $80     Connection to outside world (phone bill)
       $500ish total

All the actual costs of the trip is what I'm trying to raise. That's why I'm asking my family and friends to help me achieve this life goal. All funds raised will be going towards my trip. Meaning, I will go as far the contributions will allow. The bulk of this cost being gas with which to carry me about. The other main cost will be food. Beyond that I will be camping mostly and calling on the aid of good people for other sleeping arrangements. 

In return I've designed some fun perks! They're over there in the sidebar --------->

I am requesting your address for these perks primarily for the opportunity to possibly send you some sort physical gratitude at some point. 

Help me spread knowledge and understanding through simplicity. Help me teach others to be more in touch with their environment, with themselves. Help me spread importance of centering, grounding, and reflective/meditative peace. Help me experience a journey of a lifetime. Help me learn more about myself. Help me experience the Natural beauties this Nation has to offer while at the same time aiding others in sharing the experience. I understand if you can't contribute financially (hence the campaign). But, simply sharing my goal with others could also be a big help. Indiegogo is good with helping you share. 

We all are driven towards such goals and lessons. Now's my time. Thanks for your time and donations. Love you. Shelby
