fruitful lessons it has taught me. Slacklining exudes some very simple concepts that are easily relatable to life. What exactly is slacklining?  A slackline is a one inch piece of webbing stretched between two points with which one balances upon, walks, and poses. It takes an indescribable amount of focus and effort.  When on the line there is a complete disconnect with everything and at the same time just the opposite. The movement of the line, the movement of your body, and of your mind are all centering and simplifying. One empties their mind and becomes a fluid force with one's environment. It's about balance, breathing, and centering. It's meditative, physical, reflective, and connective. Here are some links that might help explain. 
A news piece on Highlining in Moab, UT
Slackline Yoga, Centering, Relaxing, Peace. 
Some Highlining at Smith Rock 
Skyliners
Slacklining has taught me how slow down in life and become centered with my environment. It has showed me patience, balance, discipline, and peace. There's something special about being encompassed with practice in something so pure and beautiful such as slacklining while being surrounded by something so pure and beautiful such as Nature. 



My Campaign
I wish to journey across the West from Arkansas to the coast and back stopping at as many National Forests, Parks, and Monuments along the way. Throughout this journey I hope to spread exposure and knowledge about slacklining and it's valuable lessons to as many individuals as possible. I hope to influence others to find more simplicity, balance, peace, and grounding in their lives through slacklining and Nature as the most efficient tools. I hope to expose others and myself to the Natural beauties our phenomenal Nation has to offer and learn as many lessons as possible.  I have been searching for a journey as such for my whole life and now is probably the best time for me to accomplish it. I hope to come out of this experience with a greater value and understanding for life.
The best and safest thing is to keep balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man.
- Euripides
I graduated with a BA in 2010 and have since then waded about in various conquests for money to pay off the debt my education has supplied me and at the same time be as satisfied with my existence as possible. It has been really hard balancing the two. I will be saving as much as possible between now and March 2014 to cover the following monthly expenses:


$230   Student debt repayment
$150   Insurance 
$80     Connection to outside world (phone bill)

       $500ish total
All the actual costs of the trip is what I'm trying to raise. That's why I'm asking my family and friends to help me achieve this life goal. All funds raised will be going towards my trip. Meaning, I will go as far the contributions will allow. The bulk of this cost being gas with which to carry me about. The other main cost will be food. Beyond that I will be camping mostly and calling on the aid of good people for other sleeping arrangements. 
In return I've designed some fun perks! They're over there in the sidebar --------->
I am requesting your address for these perks primarily for the opportunity to possibly send you some sort physical gratitude at some point. 


Help me spread knowledge and understanding through simplicity. Help me teach others to be more in touch with their environment, with themselves. Help me spread importance of centering, grounding, and reflective/meditative peace. Help me experience a journey of a lifetime. Help me learn more about myself. Help me experience the Natural beauties this Nation has to offer while at the same time aiding others in sharing the experience. I understand if you can't contribute financially (hence the campaign). But, simply sharing my goal with others could also be a big help. Indiegogo is good with helping you share. 
We all are driven towards such goals and lessons. Now's my time. Thanks for your time and donations. Love you. Shelby

Navigate Our Campaign

Perks

Timeline

Our Plan

 Ways You Can Help

The Strahlen Team

Empowering You

Risk and Challenges

FAQ

Improved ST-100

We made some modifications to the ST-100 and have removed ~4" from the length and ~2lbs of weight!

Introducing Strahlen

As filmmakers and photographers, we're constantly trying to do one thing - make our work better. And in doing so, we want to be using the best tools possible. This could be an updated camera body, or a new tripod, or - lights.

We've noticed a big problem in the lighting industry - people want LED lights, but everything on the market tends to be too expensive, poorly made, or difficult to modify.

Strahlen is the solution.

We began work in December of 2012 to create a new, high-output LED light made using three overarching principles:

  1. Flexibility
  2. Durability
  3. Value.
After nearly a year of developing, prototyping, and testing, we've created our first product - the ST-100 series. The ST-100 is unparalleled in its versatility and quality and offers some of the best value on the market. Let us introduce you to the Strahlen ST-100 and show you why it needs to be the next light in your arsenal!

(top)

Foot-candle Output (Tungsten - open face)

Foot-candle Output (Daylight - open face)

Colorimetry (Tungsten & Daylight)

(top)

(top)

(top)

(top)

(top)

Baby mount (5/8")
10-100%

16.5" x 7.5" x 5.5"
5.8lbs
90-305V AC, 47-63Hz
One year limited

Add-Ons

(top)

Chimera Mount (add $75)

The Chimera 6.5" mount attaches to the front of the ST-100 and gives you the best of both worlds - high quality Chimera modifiers and budget-friendly S-type modifiers, all in one light. The ability to modify the look of the ST-100 is practically limitless!

Dome Diffuser (add $60)

Turn the ST-100 into a bare bulb light! This add-on is perfect for photographers who are used to working with bare bulb strobes, or for anybody looking to create a smooth, 180 degree spread of light. The dome simply attaches on the front by using magnets - there's nothing to twist or screw, just pop it on and pull it off.


Fresnel (add $100)

This fixed-distance Fresnel lens narrows the beam spread down to ~60 degrees - allowing you to throw the light from the ST-100 while maintaining excellent output. Just like the dome diffuser, the Fresnel attaches using magnets and is simple to use.


Strahlen on Set

(top)

We've been testing out the ST-100 on several productions in a variety of mixed-light environments. Here's a quick video highlighting a few of the productions that the ST-100 has been used on.

On the set of Coder God | Directed by Scott Wenger | DP S. Allman

Perks

(top)

Timeline

(top)

  

Our Plan

(top)

We're coming to the Indiegogo community with a finished product that is ready for manufacturing.

We've spent the past year building relationships with our manufacturers and suppliers, researching and testing every component, and taking the ST-100 out into the field to determine and resolve any usability and reliability issues. Through all of this hard work, we've developed the ST-100 into a product that we confidently stand behind.

If we meet and exceed our goal, we'll be able to produce enough units to not just meet our demand on Indiegogo but also deliver additional demo units to distributors and rental houses across the nation, making the ST-100 readily available to creatives everywhere.

We'll be able to travel to shows across the US (we're lookin' at you, NAB!) and get Strahlen in front of even more awesome people.

And, most importantly, we'll be able to invest even more time and money into improving the ST-100. We believe that we have an incredibly strong base to launch Strahlen, but without your support - we have nothing.

Ways You Can Help

(top)

Back our campaign! By backing our campaign, you're telling us that the ST-100 is a good idea — good enough to put your hard-earned money behind it. When we meet our goal, we'll be able to dive right into production and bring high quality LED lights to everyone.

Share our campaign! The only way we'll reach our goal is if you spread the word about Strahlen. It may not seem like much, but sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, and all of the other awesome spots on the web is priceless to us. And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools at the top!

Give us your input! Help us develop Strahlen! We like to think of ourselves as pretty smart people, but only with your help will Strahlen become something that you'll want to buy. So comment, email, or PM us with your ideas. And get your friends to do it, too!

The Strahlen Team

(top)

Empowering You

(top)

Our goal is to empower others. We want to give others the freedom and flexibility that Strahlen has given us. We're excited that Strahlen has matured to a point where that’s possible.

We work tirelessly on Strahlen because we believe so strongly in what the ST-100 can bring to filmmakers and photographers. Every day we work to make the ST-100 better than it was the day before.

Our promise to those who choose to support Strahlen is that we won’t ever stop. Your feedback will always be heard and great ideas will always be implemented.

Join Strahlen and let’s light the future together.

Risk and Challenges

(top)

We have been working on developing the ST-100 for over a year. In this time, we have experienced a variety of challenges from design, to component suppliers, to manufacturers - but we’ve worked together through every problem to land on the best solution possible.

We’re happy to say that we’re ready to move forward with every aspect of production - all we need is your help to turn all of our hard work into reality.

FAQ

(top)

I'm ordering 2+ units and want a mixture of ST-100T's and ST-100D's. Can you make that happen?

Absolutely! Just specify how many you want to be ST-100T's and how many you want to be ST-100D's.

Are these available internationally?

We're in the midst of researching international requirements. With your help we can speed up the work necessary to ship the ST-100 internationally and make it available in countries worldwide.

Can the ST-100 be battery-powered?

Not yet (at least not directly), but that's the #1 feature we're working on.

Can I get multiple perks?

Yes! You can back our campaign as many times as you want, choosing as many perks as you want.

How can I contribute to Strahlen's specs and features? Can I give you some free advice?

Yes, please! Be sure to add your suggestions to the comments of the campaign. We're paying close attention to what you want out of Strahlen and we'll work hard to integrate a lot of your suggestions.

I’ve changed my mind. Can I get a refund?

Sorry, Indiegogo’s policy is No Refunds. Unfortunately, there’s nothing we can do about this. When your contribution is deposited into our PayPal account, it comes from Indiegogo, not from you. So if we were to refund your contribution, it wouldn’t make it back to you. Please see Indiegogo’s rules here.

story:
I am doing something that I NEVER in my wildest dreams thought I would ever have to do. My wife Barbara and I have spent our adult lives helping others, now sadly we have to turn to others for help. We have put this off for so long thinking it would get better and we would catch up. Unfortunately things just continue to get worse.

I started my working career at the age of 15. Once I got that 1st pay check I felt I could never make enough money. I've always worked 2-3 jobs including owning my own business and working as a volunteer firefighter/paramedic. Working in EMS was my all time favorite thing to do. For 8 or so years I was dealing with low back pain that I tried to ignore until 2011 when I just couldn't take the pain any longer. I went to a few surgeons that all suggested I have a fusion done of my L-5 S-1 vertebra. Sep 12th 2011 was the day I had the surgery and the day my life had changed for ever. I cannot go into detail at this time, but I ended up having a total of 8 back surgeries and approximately 80 days in the hospital. I'm now fused from L-4 S-1 with metal cages on the back of my spine and 1 on the front that they put in going through my abdomen.

Around surgery #6 I was home and became deathly ill. I honestly felt like I was dying. My wife rushed me once again to the emergency room. I knew on the way to the hospital that I probably had developed blood clots in my lungs (pulmonary embolisms) from a picc line that was placed in my arm to self administer antibiotics. Sure enough I had a CT study done and my lungs were full of blood clots. My wife and I broke down in tears. Out of all the times during this whole ordeal that I felt like I was dying, this was the real deal.

I spent most of those 8 months taking steroids. Around surgery # 7 and my 9th MRI my surgeon noticed that I had developed avascular necrosis ( dying bone) of my femoral heads and to stop taking the steroid immediately. I was told that it had progressed to the point that I was looking at 2 more surgeries to fix both hips. My wife and I once again crying our eyes out said to each other, there is no way we were emotionally ready for that. I was told by my orthopedic doc that I would have 6 months to a year max before they collapse. We decided to roll the dice and see if I could put it off for a year. The doctor just sad good luck and don't jump off of anything to avoid collapse.

One year to the month I started to develop horrible pain in my right hip area. I went to my ortho doc and an x-ray confirmed that my right hip had gotten worse and would need surgery asap. 4 days later I'm back in the operating room having my 9th surgery. A 9mm hole was drilled into my femur to bore out the dead bone of my femoral head then replace the area with bone graft. 

Two weeks after the surgery I started feeling the same pain in my hip. At my follow up appt I mentioned this pain and it was ignored. A week later the pain was off the charts. I emailed my surgeon to let him know and the email was intercepted by a nurse that pretty much said to suck it up. A few days later I went to see my primary and demand an x-ray which in fact confirmed a fracture. Surgery # 10 coming soon.

Two years ago I never knew to much about depression because I've had and worked my ass off for everything and anything I ever needed. I have the best wife and the best kids one could ask for. I have ALWAYS felt like I was on top of the world. Now I'm flat broke and cant walk. I have racked up well over a million dollars in medical bills and setting up meetings with food shelves. How does this happen??

My wife is working like crazy to try and keep us a float and not lose our home. It kills me to see her work so hard while I sit here everyday barley able to help with simple things around the house.

We cry and just hold each other asking ourselves, what did we do to deserve this? We have always gone out of our way to help others, bent over backwards to make sure everyone was happy and had everything they needed. We use to have more friends then we use to know what to do with. Now it seems everyone has gone away. Maybe because they don't know what to say...I don't know?

Thanks for listening and we appreciate your help!

Steve & Barb

story:
UPDATE on September 24/13

Cadence received her liver transplant yesterday.  To read more about it, please go to the "updates" tab. 

Thank you to everyone that has supported Corey and Crystal.

 

UPDATE on Sept 13/13

I spoke to my cousin, Corey...Cadence's father and got an update on Cadence.

She spent yesterday in the hospital and had to stay over night.  The past few days have been rough and it's apparent that she needs the transplant very soon.  There is no time left to wait for a deceased donor.

It appears that Crystal, Cadence's mother, would be the best match to be a donor.  They leave for Toronto on Sunday and Crystal will undergo a few more tests.  If those tests come back fine, then she will donate.  If, for some reason, she can't donate, then Corey will start getting tested.  Crystal is extremely healthy so, unless for some reason she is ruled out as a donor, she will get along fantastic. 

The transplant will occur within the next week and a half.  They leave for Toronto Sunday evening and will be gone for at least 2 months. 

Please say a prayer for the family, share this campaign, donate, and/or leave a comment for the family.

Corey and Crystal have mentioned numerous times how much they appreciate all the support they have been receiving.  They are disappointed that they won't be able to make the benefit and to thank everyone in person.

Dawn

------------------------------------------

 

Short Summary 

Five year old Cadence Ogden of East Royalty, Prince Edward Island was diagnosed at the age of two with a rare genetic disorder called Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency.  This inherited disorder can cause liver disease.  Cadence's Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency has advanced far more quickly than expected.  She is now in liver failure.

Her liver is greatly enlarged and not able to do its' work.  This makes her tummy swell and causes her pain and discomfort.  She has periodic nose bleeds, nausea and vomiting and she tires more easily.  Her smile though is as big as ever and so is her spirit.

These past three years have been difficult ones for Cadence, her parents Corey and Crystal, and big sister Mariah.  There have been many trips to the QEH and the IWK and most recently to Toronto Sick Kids.  Cadence needs a new liver and is on the transplant list there.  The expected date for the transplant is unknown but could happen at anytime.

 

How your donation will help the family.

All funds raised will be given to the family to help with the expenses before, during, and after the liver transplant.  Cadence has a doctor appointment at Toronto Sick Kids in October.  Her parents are hoping to be tested as possible donors during that visit.  That process takes a week.  The costs associated with this trip include the airfare for the three of them, accommodations for the week, meals, transportation, and lost wages that her parents may have. 

The bulk of the expenses will occur during the transplant.  They expect to be in Toronto for 4-5 weeks.  One parent will need to purchase airfare to and from Toronto, accommodations for the 4-5 weeks, meal, transportation, and lost wages.

From Toronto, Cadence will be airlifted to the IWK in Halifax and spend a few weeks there.  Again, the cost of meals, accommodations, transportation, and lost wages.

When Cadence returns home, one of her parents will need to take time off work to care for her for a few months.  Again, more lost wages.  Cadence will be on a lot of medication and the cost for that will add up quickly. 

If one parent is a donor match then the expenses will increase a lot more. 

As you can see, Cadence's parents are going to have a lot of expenses.  Any donation amount that you can make would be greatly appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want to help, then please forward this link to everyone you know.  Every dollar will help and it'll be one more dollar that they didn't have.

 

Contact Information

Please feel free to contact me for any reason.

k_dmurphy@hotmail.com or 367-5180

Dawn Murphy
story_txt:
UPDATE on September 24/13
Cadence received her liver transplant yesterday.  To read more about it, please go to the "updates" tab.  
Thank you to everyone that has supported Corey and Crystal.
 
UPDATE on Sept 13/13
I spoke to my cousin, Corey...Cadence's father and got an update on Cadence.
She spent yesterday in the hospital and had to stay over night.  The past few days have been rough and it's apparent that she needs the transplant very soon.  There is no time left to wait for a deceased donor.
It appears that Crystal, Cadence's mother, would be the best match to be a donor.  They leave for Toronto on Sunday and Crystal will undergo a few more tests.  If those tests come back fine, then she will donate.  If, for some reason, she can't donate, then Corey will start getting tested.  Crystal is extremely healthy so, unless for some reason she is ruled out as a donor, she will get along fantastic.  
The transplant will occur within the next week and a half.  They leave for Toronto Sunday evening and will be gone for at least 2 months.  
Please say a prayer for the family, share this campaign, donate, and/or leave a comment for the family.
Corey and Crystal have mentioned numerous times how much they appreciate all the support they have been receiving.  They are disappointed that they won't be able to make the benefit and to thank everyone in person.
Dawn------------------------------------------ 
Short Summary 
Five year old Cadence Ogden of East Royalty, Prince Edward Island was diagnosed at the age of two with a rare genetic disorder called Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency.  This inherited disorder can cause liver disease.  Cadence's Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency has advanced far more quickly than expected.  She is now in liver failure.
Her liver is greatly enlarged and not able to do its' work.  This makes her tummy swell and causes her pain and discomfort.  She has periodic nose bleeds, nausea and vomiting and she tires more easily.  Her smile though is as big as ever and so is her spirit.
These past three years have been difficult ones for Cadence, her parents Corey and Crystal, and big sister Mariah.  There have been many trips to the QEH and the IWK and most recently to Toronto Sick Kids.  Cadence needs a new liver and is on the transplant list there.  The expected date for the transplant is unknown but could happen at anytime.
 
How your donation will help the family.
All funds raised will be given to the family to help with the expenses before, during, and after the liver transplant.  Cadence has a doctor appointment at Toronto Sick Kids in October.  Her parents are hoping to be tested as possible donors during that visit.  That process takes a week.  The costs associated with this trip include the airfare for the three of them, accommodations for the week, meals, transportation, and lost wages that her parents may have.  
The bulk of the expenses will occur during the transplant.  They expect to be in Toronto for 4-5 weeks.  One parent will need to purchase airfare to and from Toronto, accommodations for the 4-5 weeks, meal, transportation, and lost wages. 
From Toronto, Cadence will be airlifted to the IWK in Halifax and spend a few weeks there.  Again, the cost of meals, accommodations, transportation, and lost wages. 
When Cadence returns home, one of her parents will need to take time off work to care for her for a few months.  Again, more lost wages.  Cadence will be on a lot of medication and the cost for that will add up quickly.  
If one parent is a donor match then the expenses will increase a lot more.  
As you can see, Cadence's parents are going to have a lot of expenses.  Any donation amount that you can make would be greatly appreciated.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, but want to help, then please forward this link to everyone you know.  Every dollar will help and it'll be one more dollar that they didn't have. 
 
Contact Information
Please feel free to contact me for any reason.k_dmurphy@hotmail.com or 367-5180
Dawn Murphy

story:
Pour voir la vidéo soutitrée en français:



They support us

Archimej Technology and its innovative technology Spectroscopy 2.0® won the France 2012 Award of the Altran Foundation for Innovation . Read more here.

Mejdi Nciri receiving the award on the 23rd of October 2012 from the Professor Arnaud Basdevant, Diabetologist and Head of the Nutrition Service at the Pitié-Salpêtrière Hospital in Paris and President of the Jury, during the ceremony at the Georges Pompidou Center in Paris.


What is Beta-Bioled?

Beta-Bioled will be the first doctor you can always have with you in your pocket. And we are not talking about a device that monitors your vital signs (heart rate, temperature, blood-pressure, etc.). Those devices are well known, and basically they are simply gadgets.
What we are talking about here is a device that can perform a comprehensive blood analysis such as you do in a hospital today, but from your home (or anywhere you are).

Did you know that blood analysis are the most basic and recurrent In-Vitro Diagnostic tests used by physicians to understand the health status of a patient? They are used in order to evaluate organs functioning, to detect damaged tissues, to control medication and chemical substances present in the body, to identify deficiencies and intoxications, and more generally to monitor known diseases evolution and diagnose new conditions.

This is why we believe blood analysis should be available for everyone, everywhere, anytime and for the fair price.


How will it be?

Beta-Bioled will be a small device that you can hold in your hand and simply use from any place at anytime without any other requirement.

And of course it will also present the same attracting features thanvital-sign gadgetswe mentioned above.

Blood analysis in the palm of your hand.

- It will give you a comprehensive analysis of your blood.

- It will be affordable, fast, easy-to-use and easy to understand. Controlled directly from a smartphone, it will deliver results that can be quickly understood by anyone, providing non-technical pre-diagnostic.

- It will allow monitoring through time. Creating secured medical profiles of patients’ historical results; it will interpret new results based on the person’s profile, adapting the pre-diagnosis to the situation.

- It will be wireless connected allowing, if the person wishes, to transmit the results and medical profile to his personal physician.

Beta-Bioled 3D design



Where are we in the development?

During the first two years of development, we have demonstrated the feasibility and high potential of our technology and we successfully achieved and tested several prototypes.

We have now a working prototype that is performing better than the absorption spectrometers currently available on the market. 

Prototypes of the Spectroscopy 2.0®.


The journey

Our next steps of development are to:

-  Integrate the working prototype into a pre-industrial product ready to be launched in scale production.

-  Develop the mobile interface to easily control the device.

-  Perform a clinical study and validation on the field (through an NGO partnership already initiated).


How is it possible?

All the credit goes to Archimej Technology’s innovative technology: Spectroscopy 2.0®.

SPECTROSCOPY 2.0®, the enabling technology.

Spectroscopy 2.0®, is a disruptive evolution of absorption spectroscopy. Thanks to the use of simple LED chips, and a few other frugal and smart innovations in optics. Spectroscopy 2.0® allows to build absorption spectrometers that are ultra-compact, high sensitivity and low-cost at the same time.

Good news then that current machines used in hospitals for blood analysis run on absorption spectroscopy technique. Because what do you get by combining the technique used in hospitals analyzers with a miniature and low cost absorption spectrometer? Beta-Bioled device. 


Join us

In the current environment where everybody feels more and more the necessity to gain control over their own lives and future, the need to monitor their health in a better way comes first. This is why we are asking you today to help us revolutionize health monitoring.

We set-up the campaign objective at the symbolic amount $US1000. 

We need the funds we could receive with this campaign. And we hope they will be the highest possible, because they will help us to keep moving forward in this project we are passionate about. Nevertheless we mostly care about knowing that you back us up, that we share the same believes and that you are part of this exciting challenge we want to face.

We are changing health monitoring, so please join us, and help us make it happen.


Our perks for Indiegogo contributors.

Legend:




The Team

The Archimej Technology team is fully committed to successfully develop Beta-Bioled, the first hand-held and personal comprehensive blood analyzer. And to make it available on the market within the shortest time possible. This is our promise.

Archimej Technology is led by a team of five international entrepreneurs from five different origins (France, China, Hong-Kong, Tunisia and Argentina), with synergic competences and sharing the same beliefs.
Most importantly, they cleverly complemented their flexibility and dynamism of young entrepreneurs with the wisdom and expertise of seniors in different strategic fields (entrepreneurship, scientific, etc.).

"I am convinced that their innovative idea deserves further investigation. Even though their solution does not exist yet, it can quickly lead to the development of a new product with even better, performances as compared to those available up to now.".

[April 2012] Jean-Louis Meyzonnette, Chairman (2000 to 2009) of SPIE European conferences on Optical System Design and Scientific evaluator in radiometry for the French Committee of Habilitation.


They are already 42 to dare.

42 microfinancers, 42 followers, 42 friends, 42 to be part of the movement.

On behalf of the five founding members of Archimej Technology, we truly would like to thank you for believing in us and in our project. You have supported us since the beginning when we needed it the most. It is thanks to you that we are here today, more than a year later.

Take care,
Archimej's team.




FAQ

Q - Why don't you offer pre-orders of the device?

A - This campaign was not aimed at offering pre-orders, because if we did so you will have had to wait more than a year to receive your device. We thoughts it was to much waiting. That's why we set-up this first campaign as a way to get your feedback and as a preparation for a second campaign with pre-orders that will be launched in less than a year.

Q - Will the device be truly portable/mobile?

A - Yes, absolutely! The device dimensions will be around 10 cm long, with this particular boomerang shape (see prototype picture) given by the technology optical path. We will try to update the campaign with some "artist concept" of the device design.

Q - Will it be just yet another device restricted to healthcare professionals?

A - Absolutely not! The device will be possibly used by healthcare professionals, because of the unmet need it satisfy; but it will be principally aimed at mass-market. Our goal is to transfer the diagnosis/analysis capacity from hospitals to the general public.

Q - Will the price of the device be tentative, prohibitive or affordable? 

A - Great question. For the moment, it is too soon to anticipate a retail price for the device. Anyhow, what we can assure is that the device is being developed focusing on mass-market needs and economic capacity. So be sure it will be affordable, and potentially (depending on countries) covered by social security, at least in part.  

Q - Could the device be used by non healthcare specialists?

A - Yes, absolutely! The device is being developed in order to be used by anyone without any specific knowledge in medicine. If you are familiar with glucometers (for diabetics), the principle of use will be the same. A single droplet of blood, obtained by finger-stick, is sucked up by capillarity in a disposable test-strip and the device do the rest.

story: I'm raising money to cover the cost of a new wheelchair because my primary care provider doesn't cover the cost, nor does any government assistance. The chair I use now has no foot rest and I have to hold up my legs which exhausting and painful. Having MS has drastically weakened the strength in my legs and not having the proper chair has added more difficulties for me. Usually a wheelchair should be replaced every 5 years tops! I've been making due but it's time for a new chair with all the working parts. Please help me to raise money. Share this link on all you social media sites and spread the word among your friends and loved ones.

I've been making due but it's time for a new chair with all the working parts.  Please help me to raise money.  Share this link on all you social media sites and spread the word among your friends and loved ones.

story:
My name is Joshua Amorelli. I am originally from Wisconsin, but currently I live in Georgia working for THE BEST  aviation company (Gulfstream Aerospace) there is. I served in the Air Force for 10 years honorably as a Jet Engine Mechanic. I have always lived a relatively activities oriented kind of life. I love to go out and spend time on the water with my Jet Ski, go lift weights or run 3-6 days a week, and engage in a myriad of other activities in which I would enjoy my life and get out of the house. That all changed about two years ago. In  November of 2012 I got really sick. I mean really sick. For two weeks and a couple of doctors visits, I  had severe flu like symptoms, difficulty walking, trouble sleeping and an unexplained rash on my right bicep. At the time I was running and trimming down and feeling really good about myself. After my sickness I continued my health and workout regimen, but with little results. Honestly I really didn't feel like I had fully recovered. My ability was drastically diminishing at breakneck speed. I used to run Forsyth park in Savannah Ga at least three times a week. I would run 3 miles at a relatively sow pace, and do anywhere between 2 to 4 miles running intervals. Along with that I was also working out at a gym alternating days to keep from over training. I do not  lift heavy, my regimen was more low weight high reps to trim. Two months after being sick, I could  no longer do it. Things were so bad that after working my regular 3 day weekend schedule, I had to crawl from my bathroom to my bed (approximately 3-4 feet) simply because I was so exhausted and my legs simply couldn't do it. I was spending 8 to 10 hours a day in my bed on my days off, simply because I could not get myself out of bed. I still have to fight myself to get out of bed, and go to class and try to stay relatively social. My current doctor/hormone specialist has dealt with my issues in a way that have allowed me to be a little more functional, but now even those treatments are starting to have little to no effect. On a chance reading, my doctor read about a case of Lyme Disease, and immediately thought of my case and the fact we couldn't find a diagnosis that fit my ever increasing symptoms. She came to me about 2 months ago asking me if I remember having a rash or if I had had contact with a  tick. I told her about my initial sickness before things started getting bad, and she suggested I have a lyme test done. Since then I have had another test, and both have markers that are consistent with lyme disease. My next course of action is to see a lyme literate doctor and hopefully start a treatment plan that will get me back to the guy I once was.

The money you donate will go directly to the office of Doctor Kalidas, a Lyme literate doctor located in Orlando Florida for my treatment plan. In the event I do get a job in Wisconsin, the money will go to the office of Dr. Steven Meress at the Fox Valley Wellness Center in Fond Du Lac WI. The problem with most lyme literate doctors is they do not usually take insurance. In the case of Dr. Kalidas' office, I have to pay to be seen upfront, and the initial interview is $395  dollars with treatments ranging from $60 a session to $270 a session. I can handle the logistics, getting there and securing a place to stay is easily attainable. Its the out of pocket expense that I have a problem with. I have spent a significant amount of money just getting a diagnosis that financially the burden of out of pocket expenses are too much. I can petition to have the insurance company reimburse me, and in that event I will be wrapping that money back into continued treatment until my issues are resolved. Any left over money will be donated to Lyme disease fund because that is the only right thing to do if I get a clean bill of health with money left over.

This Campaign is important to me because with your help I can become the person I once was. My health is failing me at an incredible pace, and if it is definitely Lyme disease, the sooner the treatment the better.  I have many of the symptoms consistent with stage two and three lyme disease to include extreme cramping, extreme fatigue, arthritis like symptoms in most of my major joints, numbness on the left side of my face, poor memory, swelling of my joints (particularly my knees), bouts with extreme vertigo,  and weakness in all of my extremities. The longer they go unchecked, the worse they can get and more issues will start to manifest. Please share this with any and everybody you can, and know you will forever have my gratitude if you so choose to help me. God bless and thank you.

Joshua Lee Amorelli

story:
"14 seconds!”  That’s what I yelled to my coach as I pumped my fists in the air at the end of my last 1000m race of the 2013-2014 season.  From the beginning of last season to the end I took 14 seconds off my 1000m time.  

This year I improved in all of my distances, 4 seconds faster in my 500m, 14 seconds faster in my 1,000m, 7 seconds faster in my 1,500m, and I skated a 3,000m, the longest distance women skate in competition, for the first time!  But all of the training leading up to that success has taken a toll on my skinsuit as you can see in the pictures. And I need your help to purchase a new skinsuit so I can keep the momentum going.

MY GOAL

My current skinsuit has holes and is pulling apart at the seams.  My skinsuit is important because its what I use for racing and the quality of my suit affects my speed on the ice. The amount I am asking for will be used in the following manner:

$460 skinsuit

$35 shipping

$64 Indiegogo fees

If I exceed my goal, additional funds will be used for coaching fees and entry fees into national races.  I currently need $2,000 to finish paying for my season.

TIMELINE

I need my skinsuit before my first time trial in October.  With your help I can reach my goal.  

YOUR GIFT

By supporting me you are helping me to achieve my dream of representing our nation at the Olympics in 2018. Your contribution of any size will help to make this possible and is greatly appreciated.   If one person sponsors my entire skinsuit I would be happy to wear the logo of their choosing for the entire season.  (logos must be approved and cannot contain profanity or obscenity.) 


As happy as I’ve been with my progress this season, I’ve also had a few bumps in the road.  Having type 1 diabetes means that I have to get off the ice during practices to test my blood glucose and eat a snack if I’m low.  This season it also meant I had a race where I had to stop skating because my sugar was too low.

At the end of the season the technical director of my team decided that a diabetic skater "didn’t fit the profile of an athlete" they’d like to have.  The team I was so proud to be a part of no longer wanted me.

It would be easy to be discouraged, but I’m fortunate to have people who believe in me.  People like my coach, who refused to ask me to leave the team, and was eventually fired.  And all of my teammates, who quit the team and are now training with me and my coach as part of a private team. They’ve backed me up.  And now I’m hoping you’ll do the same.   A gift of any size, even $1, will help me to reach my goal of purchasing a new suit. 

THANK YOU!  For helping me reach my goal.

This year I improved in all of my distances, 4 seconds faster in my 500m, 14 seconds faster in my 1,000m, 7 seconds faster in my 1,500m, and I skated a 3,000m, the longest distance women skate in competition, for the first time!  But all of the training leading up to that success has taken a toll on my skinsuit as you can see in the pictures. And I need your help to purchase a new skinsuit so I can keep the momentum going.

MY GOALMy current skinsuit has holes and is pulling apart at the seams.  My skinsuit is important because its what I use for racing and the quality of my suit affects my speed on the ice. The amount I am asking for will be used in the following manner:$460 skinsuit$35 shipping$64 Indiegogo feesIf I exceed my goal, additional funds will be used for coaching fees and entry fees into national races.  I currently need $2,000 to finish paying for my season.TIMELINEI need my skinsuit before my first time trial in October.  With your help I can reach my goal.  YOUR GIFTBy supporting me you are helping me to achieve my dream of representing our nation at the Olympics in 2018. Your contribution of any size will help to make this possible and is greatly appreciated.   If one person sponsors my entire skinsuit I would be happy to wear the logo of their choosing for the entire season.  (logos must be approved and cannot contain profanity or obscenity.) As happy as I’ve been with my progress this season, I’ve also had a few bumps in the road.  Having type 1 diabetes means that I have to get off the ice during practices to test my blood glucose and eat a snack if I’m low.  This season it also meant I had a race where I had to stop skating because my sugar was too low.At the end of the season the technical director of my team decided that a diabetic skater "didn’t fit the profile of an athlete" they’d like to have.  The team I was so proud to be a part of no longer wanted me.It would be easy to be discouraged, but I’m fortunate to have people who believe in me.  People like my coach, who refused to ask me to leave the team, and was eventually fired.  And all of my teammates, who quit the team and are now training with me and my coach as part of a private team. They’ve backed me up.  And now I’m hoping you’ll do the same.   A gift of any size, even $1, will help me to reach my goal of purchasing a new suit. THANK YOU!  For helping me reach my goal.

story:
Objective

We are seeking help in funding the costs of clinical trials and FDA & USDA applications.  With your help, we can bring an ecologically sound product to market to help people with hair loss and scalp problems.  Thank you for considering to contribute to our effort!!


About Vitality Hair Recovery

Moroccan Eco-Biologics, LLC is committed to producing highly effective natural organic hair and skin health care products in an innovative and ecologically sustainable way. 

Our Vitality Hair Recovery products have been specially formulated and crafted with an all-natural base of Moroccan plant extracts to create technologically superior solutions for hair loss and scalp problems. 


About the Clinical Trials

Moroccan Eco-Biologics products have passed the first phase of clinical trials which were all about safety.  The testing was conducted on  a small treatment group utilizing RIPT and skin patch tests.  No animal tests were conducted, even on the raw materials.

The next phase of clinical trials, and the reason for conducting this Indiegogo campaign, will be 2nd phase and treatment will be given to a larger group of people to see if it continues to provide the efficacy we believe (and have seen!) and further evaluate safety.  There will be NO testing of this product on animals.

Moroccan Eco-Biologics specializes in using natural and organic products and are seeking a voluntary FDA registration of our products in the coming months.  Since all ingredients are organic and are USDA and Ecocert certified, we are also seeking an USDA and Ecocert certification of the final products.

Your contribution will be greatly appreciated in helping us pay for this detailed process so we can bring this much needed product to market!

About the Founder

Dr. Elhabib Benlhabib is the founder and CEO of Moroccan Eco-Biologics. Growing up in Morocco, for years Dr. Benlhabib has witnessed first-hand the remarkable effects on family and friends who used an all natural “secret family recipe” to promote hair growth. 

After years of scientific study and research he has enhanced the original family recipe, maintaining the key Moroccan plant extracts while incorporating additional natural and organic ingredients including Moroccan argan oil. 

Through his Vitality Hair Recovery products, Dr. Benlhabib hopes to aid anyone who is searching for a natural solution for hair loss or scalp issues and anyone who wants to enhance their hair and skin health.

Dr. Benlhabib has a robust scientific background, having earned his MA in Biochemistry and his Ph.D. in Toxicology and Applied Pharmacology from the University of Minnesota. Over the years he has gained vital experience in a number of areas of research, including extensive knowledge of skin biology and skin constituents by performing independent research on neuroimmune interactions in the skin at the Department of Dermatology/Center for Drug Design at the University of Minnesota. 

Dr. Benlhabib has been able to apply his vast experience and skills to create Moroccan Eco-Biologics and develop the Vitality Hair Recovery products and additional all-natural solutions for hair and skin care. 


What Makes Our Products Unique

Hair loss is a commonly encountered problem for men and women of all ages. Until now, options for successful treatment have been limited to a handful of existing medications that offer mediocre results or have considerable side effects, or highly invasive treatments such as hair transplantation. 

Moroccan Eco-Biologic’s new all natural and organic Vitality Hair Recovery products fill this gap in hair loss treatment options and provide an effective alternative for men and women experiencing hair thinning or hair loss.

There is no other hair growth product on the market like our Vitality Hair Recovery Cream and Shampoo!! 

This is what makes our Vitality Hair Recovery products unique:

• All natural and organic—Our active ingredients are Moroccan plant extracts and all of the remaining ingredients also are all-natural and 100% organic certified. There are none of the harsh chemicals or hormones found in other products.

• Unique ingredients—Only Vitality Hair Recovery uses the formulation of Moroccan plant extracts with unique properties that support natural hair growth and a wide range of other benefits for hair and scalp.

• Can be used by anyone—Our products are effective for men and women and can be used by anyone who wants to have healthy hair and scalp, even if they are not experiencing hair thinning or loss.

• Long lasting results—Our products provide long-lasting results, unlike other products that can actually cause hair loss after discontinued use.

Our Vitality Hair Recovery products provide a variety of benefits for your hair and scalp, are made with only quality ingredients!!


Benefits

• Hair loss recovery (growth)

• Keratin and collagen treatment

• Itch relief

• Dandruff relief

• Irritation relief

• Inflammation relief


Made with none of the "bad" stuff!

• Alcohol free

• Sulfate free

• Paraben free

• Triclosan free

• PEG free

• Petroleum free

• Phthalate free

• Silicon free

• Artificial colors free

• Not tested on animals 

• Biodegradable


Our Campaign

Our Vitality Hair Recovery Cream and Shampoo already have passed safety testing, including human patch test, human RIPT test, and stability and PET tests!

The next step is to get FDA approval of the hair growth cream as an effective hair growth product by conducting a third party human clinical trial to substantiate the preliminary data we already have collected. 

Through our campaign on Indiegogo, we are seeking to fund a third-party clinical trial to make our products readily available to the millions of men and women who could benefit from it!

story:
Please see my new campaign here...

http://igg.me/p/931023/x/753066


“14 seconds!”  That’s what I yelled to my coach as I pumped my fists in the air at the end of my last 1000m race of the 2013-2014 season.  From the beginning of last season to the end I took 14 seconds off my 1000m time.  While many in the speedskating community experienced disappointment last year, for me it was a year of personal success.  But I need your help to keep the momentum going.

This year I improved in all of my distances, 4 seconds faster in my 500m, 14 seconds faster in my 1,000m, 7 seconds faster in my 1,500m, and I skated a 3,000m, the longest distance women skate in competition, for the first time!  And I’m on track to continue to beat my own times next season. 

But as happy as I’ve been with my progress this season, I’ve also had a few bumps in the road.  Having type 1 diabetes means that I have to get off the ice during practices to test my blood glucose and eat a snack if I’m low.  This season it also meant I had a race where I had to stop skating because my sugar was too low.

At the end of the season the technical director of my team decided that a diabetic skater "didn’t fit the profile of an athlete" they’d like to have.  The team I was so proud to be a part of no longer wanted me.

It would be easy to be discouraged, but I’m fortunate to have people who believe in me.  People like my coach, who refused to ask me to leave the team, and was eventually fired.  And all of my teammates, who quit the team and are now training with me and my coach as part of a private team.  They’ve backed me up.  And now I’m hoping you’ll do the same. 

MY GOAL

I dream of going to the Olympics, but more than that, I dream of being the best speedskater I can possibly be.  Most people don’t realize that the majority of aspiring Olympians and Olympic athletes are self-funded.  This year with the money I’ve saved from teaching learn to skate I estimate I will still need $3,750. Your help will make it possible for me to achieve my goal.   

TIMELINE

My ice fees and first payment to my coach are due the first week in September. With your help I will be able to start the season and train through the end of May.

YOUR GIFT

By supporting me you are helping me to achieve my dream of representing our nation at the Olympics in 2018. Your contribution of any size will help to make this possible and is greatly appreciated. You don’t have to donate at a "perk" level... it may not seem like $1 would make much of a difference, but it really does. 

$10 buys new springs for my clapblades, an essential piece of equipment in longtrack.

$15 buys one time trial.  I have time trails every Saturday during the season.

$25 helps pay for equipment maintenance for summer training.  Off-ice training is where skaters gain most of their time for the ice season.

$50 pays for blade maintenance (rocking and bending).  Keeping my blades in shape helps me to keep contact with the ice.

$75 pays my entry fee for AmCup, Nationals, and other competitions

$137 buys half a month of coaching with a coach who believes in me.

$275 buys one month of coaching with a coach who believes in me

$500 pays for a new skinsuit.  Mine has holes in it and needs to be replaced.

$1,000 pays for all of my ice time for the season.

PERKS

Everyone who makes a donation gets a handwritten thank you card.

Individuals donating $25 or more get a jar of Becca's Speed Skatin' Marmalade.  Handmade by Elroy Butterfields, this marmalade tastes like an insanely delicious apple pie.  Elroy Butterfields is a locally owned company that uses homegrown and locally sourced produce in its products.

Individuals donating $150 or more get a handcrafted animal from Ocean Sole.  These animals are hand-crafted from discarded flip-flops that have been collected from coastlines and waterways in Kenya.  Ocean Sole products save the environment and support local artisans.

Individuals, Corporations, or Organizations who donate $500 or more can have their logo placed on my skinsuit for the season.
After you have made your donation we will request a print quality file of your logo.  Logos must meet USSPeedskating guidelines for acceptability. (i.e. no profanity)  Skinsuit will be worn at practices and in all competitions during the season.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please spread the word to friends and family!

Click the Like and Tweet buttons at the top of this page to spread word about this campaign.

story:
I've been stupid enough to sign up to do a Tough Mudder on the 26th October.  For those that don't now, a Tough Mudder is a 12 mile assault course  that involves 20 obstacles with names such as Arctic Enema, Electric Eel and Dirty Ballerina. All obstacles are designed to challenge you and test your determination and basically knacker you out. Those of you that know me will know I love my biscuits and cakes, dislike exercise and moan if I get just a little wet. This therefore represents quite a challenge for me and I want to ask you to sponsor me in the name of a good cause.

My 7 year daughter Scarlet goes to Bishops Down School and in her class is Malachi who finds everyday challenging. Malachi is a cute little 6 year old boy from Tunbridge Wells who has a genetic condition called neurofibromatosis. This is a condition which manifests differently in each individual, he was diagnosed at birth as his father & 2 of his brothers also have the condition.

By 14 months old Malachi was not crawling or developing properly so  his family contacted the neurologist. 2 weeks later his family had the phone call they had been dreading and one they never thought they would ever get! The hospital told them Malachi had a large Bilateral extensive Optic Nerve/Chasm Glioma (brain tumour) and he needed to go on urgent Chemotherapy to save his sight. They were hopeful of saving Malachi's sight but sadly 6 months into treatment ( which brings it's own complications such as blood transfusions, low neutrophil's and a lot of in patient stays as he was very poorly, and hair loss) he lost his sight in both eyes.

By Christmas 2010 just a month before his 2 birthday he went completely blind he also lost all light perception. He continued the treatment in hope of now shrinking the tumour as the sight was no longer an issue.

Malachi's tumour did not shrink either, by the end of his 18 month weekly treatment the chemo had stopped it from growing any bigger so it was now stable.
.
Sadly in 2013 Malachi developed Hydrocephalus where he had to be rushed in for emergency surgery where they performed a drain and he had a Ventriculoperitoneal shunt fitted. In 2013/2014 Malachi had to have 3 further brain surgeries due to shunt failure which is scary in its self.

Sadly in October 2014 Malachi's family found out the Tumour had started growing again and treatment will need to be started now. Malachi has another scan on the 24th of November to decide what chemotherapy course will be started.

Malachi is a bubbly (and extremely lively!) little boy who is achieving in life despite the tremendous difficulties he faces every day. I want to support him in getting the equipment and sensory toys that will ensure he has the same opportunities to succeed as anyone else as he goes through school and with the latest news  we want to start fundraising for his bucket list.

His family have a fund called Malachi's Journey and this is who I want to raise money for. They have been able raise enough to purchase 2 braillers for the school and have donated a large some of money to equip the sensory room which will of course benefit others as well as Malachi.

With the latest news the fund is now wanting to raise money for Malachi's bucket list and I would like to ask you to help with this so please just a few ponds would be great. His family can't buy his health or his sight back but I hope this fund that has been set up will go somewhere towards giving him the future he so definitely deserves.

His

story:
Life is not a guarantee...

My 42 yr old brother, and best friend, has been diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer and is without medical insurance.   In his fight to stay alive I don't want him to worry about bills as I know stress plays a role in our own health.  He is a high school teacher that is one of those teachers you will always remember ( so his students tell me).

    Ron is a 20 yr vegetarian, lover of humanity, and thoughtful and aware in his actions of life.  He has custody of his two children that are 12 and 16.  I remember his daughter telling me when we found out that she couldn't imagine not having her dad around.  Brought some serious tears to my eyes.

   Even through all of what he is going through, when we were in the hospital together, he told me that he wanted to be a role model for others through this process.   I hope that his story will create a moment of change in your life as well...we are not guaranteed of growing old in this world...if there is something you need to change about yourself, or your interactions with others...now is the time!! don't wait because we are not guaranteed life.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for at least $5000, but already there are almost $100,000 in medical bills.   Every bit of money that comes in will go directly to paying down that staggering cost and to help him survive while he is unable to work.

I run a carpet cleaning business in the Cleveland ohio western suburbs and am also donating 10 % of all services to his fund.

I can be reached at www.akleenerimage.com or call me at 440-785-1545.

story:
Why A Gourmet Bloody Mary?

Everyone makes a Bloody Mary differently, but few people do it right.
After overwhelming response from people who had our secret Bloody Mary
recipe at brunch events, we decided to take our mixture to the next
level and put it in bottles for fans to enjoy anytime, anywhere.  The
result is unlike anything else on the market.  Our classic Bloody Mary
is based on Creative Director Ricky Johnson's ever-refined and tweaked
recipe, while our other mixes were formulated as a team, with founder
Rob Green, Kaiser Matin, and Johnson working tirelessly to create
brand-new mixes to change the way people thought of the savory
cocktail.  The results of these experiments are our most exciting
offerings: "Crazy Mary" is a sweet and spicy Caribbean-inspired mix
that uses lush fruits and exotic spices to pair perfectly with your
favorite rum.  "Bloody Maria" is a tomatillo-based mixture made with
agave, lime, and peppers to compliment any tequila.  It won't stop
there, though-  More flavors are already in the works!



After perfecting the recipes in our own kitchen and gathering honest
feedback, we finally feel like we're ready to share these with the
world.  We hope that when you taste it, you can get a sense of the
hard work, knowledge, care, and passion that goes into each and every
bottle.  Our mixtures aren't meant to be a shortcut, they're meant to
give every person who drinks them the flavor and quality you'd expect
from an experienced mixologist.  That's what we expect from ourselves,
and that's what we believe in.  It's not about how much you pay for a
drink, or what's on the label, or where you're drinking it.  To us,
all that matters is what's in the glass.  If you want something
special in your glass, choose Mix It Up.

Just good friends - Chasing a dream

To truly understand what we are doing, you need to understand who we are. We are three friends from different walks of life, but with one common passion, we love the art of mixology and bar service. In fact, we love it so much that we started a company called Mix It Up Craft Cocktails to offer bar catering for weddings, parties and events. We offer clients the chance to serve their guests one-of-a-kind handmade cocktails, fun and exciting wines, and unique craft beer choices. This desire for freshness and quality has led us to make our own liquor infusions, bitters, and fresh juices. We only use the best ingredients, because we only want to make the best drinks possible.

The craft of mixology has grown to the point that you can find signature drinks in establishments ranging from TGI Fridays to your local craft bar.  We at Mix It Up are inspired by this movement and want to bring it from the bar to your own events and ultimately your home, where you can mix your favotite spirit with our mixtures for your friends.  This passion we have for feshness and quality has led us to where we are now: making and bottling our own hand-crafted mixes.

It is our goal to grow the initial line of mixes from gourmet Bloody Mary mixes to a line that includes all natural mixes for mojitos, screw drivers, twisted mimosas and many other mixes that allow you to enjoy mixology quality drinks in your home.

 The funding will allow us to take it from our kitchen and canning it ourselves to have it bottled professionally and provide it to major restaurants, bars, and stores all over the east coast.  Several significant businesses have already expressed interest when we are able to manufacture more to meet demands.  Having the ability to produce more mixes in less time will allow our business to grow and take a shot at major retailers.

 

 

April 12th, 1996

What if you bought Yahoo stock on April 12th, 1996, when it launched? It was valued at $1.08/share, and four years later it was at $118/share. If you sold it then, you would have made A LOT of money.

What's the point?

One of the "perks" for contributing is the option of owning a share in our company, and though we know we are not Yahoo, we do think we can capitilze on the mixology trend and grow to offer more than 20 different types of mixes, sold in retail locations, bars, and restaurants everywhere.

Today, we are three guys stil working our day jobs, but we hope to take this passion and make it our life's work.

We have invested all we have at this point and need assistance to get to the next level. The money will help us to move our production from our humble kitchen to a professional manufacturing facility 2 miles from our home.

The amount we need is $15,000 and its use will be as follows:

  • $10,000 for the first production run
  • $5,000 for marketing and collateral

 

A hand full of give me and a mouthful of much obliged....... 

This is the term that my father said more times than any other of his expressions. Through the years, it just made me laugh.  But now I get it.

So in the spirit of my Pop, here is what you get for getting us out of our tiny kitchen:

$25 - Jar of Bloody Mary, your choice of flavor

$50 - Jar of Bloody Mary signed by the team and labled #1 batch - you choose flavor

$100 - Jar of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavor

         - Mix It Up bottle opener

         - Signed team pic

         - Limited Edition T-Shirt

$200 - 6 Jars of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavors

         - Signed team pic

         - Limited Edition T-Shirt

         - Mix It Up Sticker

         - Mix It Up Mixtures Drinking Jar with Handle 

$500 - Lunch (2) with Mix It Up team in Baltimore.

         - 6 Jars of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavors

         - Signed team pic

         - Limited Edition T-Shirt

         - Mix It Up Sticker

         - Mix It Up Mixtures Drinking Jar with Handle 

$1,000 - VIP - Attend the launch party for the mixes in the Baltimore Inner Harbor (2)

         - 6 Jars of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavors

         - Signed team pic

         - Limited Edition T-Shirt

         - Mix It Up Sticker

         - Mix It Up Mixtures Drinking Jar with Handle 

$2,000 - Be an owner - receive 1% share in MIU Mixtures

           - VIP - Attend the launch party for the mixes in the Baltimore Inner Harbor (2)

           - Mixture for a year 6 jars every other month (6 times)

           - First 6 Jars of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavors

           - Signed team pic

           - Limited Edition T-Shirt

           - Mix It Up Sticker

           - Mix It Up Mixtures Drinking Jar with Handle 

 

 $3,000 - Be an owner - receive 2% share in MIU Mixtures

           - VIP - Attend the launch party for the mixes in the Baltimore Inner Harbor (2)

           - Mixture for a year 6 jars every other month (6 times)

           - First 6 Jars of Bloody Mary signed by the team, you choose flavors

           - Signed team pic

           - Limited Edition T-Shirt

           - Mix It Up Sticker

           - Mix It Up Mixtures Drinking Jar with Handle 

Conclusion

Why should you believe in us?  Because we believe in ourselves.  At the end of the day, that's what make's us different.  We know we'll be successful, because we believe that we are offering a high-quality product to a market that needs it.  If you're reading this right now, chances are that you're starting to believe in us too.  All we need is a little help.  Every contribution we get is greatly appreciated, and we will keep working everyday to make sure it's put to good use.

to learn more about our mixes and what we do, visit our website:

www.MIUMixes.com

www.facebook.com/miumixes
story_txt:
Why A Gourmet Bloody Mary?
Everyone makes a Bloody Mary differently, but few people do it right.After overwhelming response from people who had our secret Bloody Maryrecipe at brunch events, we decided to take our mixture to the nextlevel and put it in bottles for fans to enjoy anytime, anywhere.  Theresult is unlike anything else on the market.  Our classic Bloody Maryis based on Creative Director Ricky Johnson's ever-refined and tweakedrecipe, while our other mixes were formulated as a team, with founderRob Green, Kaiser Matin, and Johnson working tirelessly to createbrand-new mixes to change the way people thought of the savorycocktail.  The results of these experiments are our most excitingofferings: "Crazy Mary" is a sweet and spicy Caribbean-inspired mixthat uses lush fruits and exotic spices to pair perfectly with yourfavorite rum.  "Bloody Maria" is a tomatillo-based mixture made withagave, lime, and peppers to compliment any tequila.  It won't stopthere, though-  More flavors are already in the works!
After perfecting the recipes in our own kitchen and gathering honestfeedback, we finally feel like we're ready to share these with theworld.  We hope that when you taste it, you can get a sense of thehard work, knowledge, care, and passion that goes into each and everybottle.  Our mixtures aren't meant to be a shortcut, they're meant togive every person who drinks them the flavor and quality you'd expectfrom an experienced mixologist.  That's what we expect from ourselves,and that's what we believe in.  It's not about how much you pay for adrink, or what's on the label, or where you're drinking it.  To us,all that matters is what's in the glass.  If you want somethingspecial in your glass, choose Mix It Up.

story:
OUR CAMPAIGN IS COMPLETE - THANKS EVERYONE!

Want your own PUSH Band? You can pre-order on our website at by clicking here!

Force, power, velocity. Decades of research in sport science have established that these three metrics lay at the core of strength training. PUSH is the first fitness device that allows you to track and analyze these metrics, ensuring that your training is optimized. 

How does it work? PUSH tracks how your body is performing at a certain weight and provides insights to help you optimize the load. Not moving the bar fast enough? Lower the weight. Not showing signs of fatigue two sets in? Change the weight.  PUSH allows you to push your body to its true potential, using meaningful metrics, and get stronger over time while minimizing the chance of injury that can set you back.



PUSH does more: use your iPhone or Android device to create or download routines, or just walk into the gym and train. You set your training goals and PUSH provides feedback on your movement. PUSH will take your training to the next level. You can also plan your training program, track your progress over time, and share it with friends. Using PUSH, you'll get more out of your training. 

"PUSH is hoping to add some professionalism to what is essentially an amateur space." – Techcrunch

"New fitness tracker helps athletes push their limits at the gym." – Mashable

"PUSH has gained interest from dozens of top-tier athletes, trainers, and teams in the NFL, NHL, MLB, European soccer leagues, and MMA leagues. But if you lift weights and want to ensure that you’re lifting them the way you should, PUSH will help keep you on track." – Greatist

"Knowing your strengths, weaknesses and limits at the gym can be tricky [...] That's where PUSH, a brand new wearable fitness monitor, comes to the rescue." – Askmen

Whether you train alone or with a coach, PUSH has you covered. Press GO to start training or use a scheduled routine, PUSH will start tracking what matters.


PUSH detects reps, sets and extract, from each rep, scientifically-validated metrics that can tell you if you're lifting too much or too little. You can gauge your performance based on the velocity of each rep or your peak power output. These metrics have been utilized for decades by elite athletes to gauge their performance improvements over time. Now, it's your turn.


Training isn't as much fun alone: share your routines with friends (and enemies). Wear your badges and new personal records. Display your achievements with pride - you earned them.


Planning an athlete's regimen in spreadsheets can be a real pain. The PUSH Portal is the perfect solution to help you better manage, track, and optimize your client's training whether they're training at the gym or on the road, in-season or off-season.

Want to learn more? Check out our awesome infographics in the gallery!

We've tested the output of our device against some of the leading tools available for sport science researchers and our initial results look great (see for yourself below). Our device produces comparable results to force plates, an advanced research tool used by sport scientists to conduct studies, on athlete performance. Force plates cost thousands of dollars and require significant know-how to operate; our device only costs $149 and is easy to use.

We're currently in contact with several world-renowned sport scientists who have expressed interest in collaborating on research studies using PUSH. We're thrilled by the results so far and look forward to working with researchers in the field of strength training. If you're a sport scientist who is interested in working with us on testing PUSH, please get in touch with us at info@pushstrength.com


With PUSH, the app is completely free and accessible via Android and iPhone apps. You can even download the app and use it as a manual entry fitness tracking app.


After PUSH ships, we'll be adding optional portal access to trainers and athletes at a small premium. Some of the perks on the campaign include free and limited subscription to this portal service. Updates to the app and portal are always free. 



We currently have a working prototype and we're now focused on: 

  • Miniaturizing the electronics and design of the enclosure
  • Testing usability of our mobile app
  • Adding more exercises to our database

We will soon begin the process of: 

  • Finalize production run designs
  • Getting consumer electronics certifications
  • Tooling, packaging, and production






We've been working on PUSH for a year and we've come a long way. We need your support in helping bring PUSH to the millions of athletes that rely on subjective methods of tracking training. With your help, we can build a community around PUSH that is passionate about data, sport science, and improving their strength in an efficient and safe manner. 

So why should you support us? 

  • Be the first to get one.
  • Take your training to the next level.
  • You are passionate about strength training and want to improve your performance.


  1. PURCHASING & SETUP
  2. BUYING & SHIPPING
  3. TECHNICAL
  4. PRIVACY & SECURITY
  5. OTHER QUESTIONS

1a: When I receive my device, how do I get started?

Pair the device via Bluetooth with your smartphone, create your athlete profile and GO.

1b: I am a coach/trainer, how many devices do I need?

Depends on the size of your team/group. Our device has been optimized for individual use and we do recommend that you issue one per athlete so that you can keep track of their training regardless of when they choose to train.

1c: Can I wear multiple devices at once and retrieve more in-depth data?

Currently, only 1 unit can be worn during training but we do plan to test how multiple units can potentially provide a more comprehensive feedback on the quality of movement. Stay tuned!

1d: I train many athletes at the same time (each with a unit), how can I keep track of them all at once?

You can see the data instantly on your iPad through our web portal for all of your athletes.

1e: Does the armband come in different sizes?

The PUSH Band comes in S, M, L and it is equipped with a Velcro strap that is easily adjustable to fit your arm. We also offer a waist-band for professional athletes interested in tracking body movement in specific exercises.

1f: How do I clean my armband?

The PUSH Band is easily cleaned with mild soap and warm water, it's machine washable and antibacterial. Just remember to remove the unit before cleaning the band.

2a: When will my product arrive?

We aim to ship by April-May 2014.

2b: What are the shipping costs?

Add $15 for shipping to USA and Canada, $25 for international shipping.

2c: What if I live outside the US or Canada?

We're working diligently on certifying our device for international use but we do anticipate some delays in shipping internationally. Please contact us for more information at info@pushstrength.com

3a: How long does the battery last for?

We designed the battery to last for 6-8 hours of active time, covering an average weeks’ worth of exercises before needing a recharge.

3b: If connection is lost, will it keep the data until connection is reset?

Yes, we've designed The PUSH Band so that no data is lost in case the connection to your phone is dropped. Plus, the PUSH Band will let you know if the connection is ever lost by flashing the indicator light.

3c: Can I upload my current excel data to PUSH's database?

Yes we can do custom integration with existing platforms, please contact us for further details.

3d: How﻿ exactly are you measuring Force?

We measure force by processing accelerometer/gyroscope data through a collection of custom algorithms. These algorithms are specifically-designed for each exercise so that we can give detailed﻿ and accurate feedback on your training performance.

4a: Is my data secure?

All of your data is stored on our secure servers, we use a cloud platform that hosts data for some of the top Fortune 500 companies. Ultimately, your data is yours to own and you can remove it from our servers at any point.

5a: Can I cancel my pre-order?

We'd be sad to see you go but all you need to do is forward your pre-order confirmation email to info@pushstrength.com with a simple request to cancel.

5b: What is the difference between PUSH Prime and Strength?

There is no difference other than the discounted price. PUSH Prime is our way of thanking our first loyal supporters who back our campaign.

5c: Does PUSH come with a warranty?

Yes, the PUSH Band comes with a 1-year limited warranty. Get in touch with us for more information.

5d: How can I get in touch?

You can email us at info@pushstrength.com, our team will be more than happy to help.
